comments: I recently replaced my 3 Jerzee sleaveless with 3 Champions.PROS:The Champions look a little better and hang a little better.Fabric is soft.Logo on front is nice, muted black.CONS:Fabric is a little thinner than I would have liked.Logo on back is brightly colored and unnecessary branding.  I will use a marker to blacken it.SUMMARY:Decent sleaveless, with normal sized arm holes.  Fabric is 100% cotton and thin, so very good for extreme heat and sunblock on the shoulders.
I wish I did not buy this.  it shrank a lot in the wash and I washed it with cold water.  It is now sitting in my drawer waiting for me to lose 20 lbs.

My husband is a Large in any other shirt.  I had previously purchased a large and it is too small after washing. He likes the cut of this shirt and likes that it is cotton so I purchased an XL and after washing it fits like the Large we were originally hoping for.  Almost borderline too short though. He is 6’2”

I have a really solid, well-fitting basic sleeveless tee from Champion that's served me very well; it's super comfortable and my favorite shirt to work out in. I wanted to pick up another one so I bought this item.What I didn't realize is that they had updated their basic tee, and the old style I liked was #T2231. That one is made from a really sturdy cotton, with reinforced neck and arm cutouts.This one, style #T0222, is a downgrade. The fabric is much flimsier and the fit isn't as nice. The arms flare out awkwardly and don't have the same fitted construction, with much larger/droopier cutouts.I returned mine and will try to snag the other style.
T-shirt bought specifically for training, the size is more for comfort. embroidered badge the champ is glued behind, fabric is thin and soft, perfectly felt on the body, excellent for warm weather.

Amazing purchase. Fits comfortably and shows off arms (even my limited 2-month progress arms!)Not tight in the chest area, but not extra loose ether. It definitely will show chest gains, but remain comfortable to stretch and be active in. Looks amazing! I’ve received many compliments with it on.Going to buy a red one.

Wow, this shirt is amazing!  Trim athletic fit and seems to be very high quality material.  Perfect for the gym and better than most shirts two or three times more expensive.  I'm going to have to buy one in every color.

I really like these "authentic" Champion shirts.They're like a slim fit,---not big and baggy around the waist like most shirts nowadays.I'm buying three more before they "go out of style" and become "relaxed fit"!

In my opinion this shirt fit a little snug for me. I was also disappointed with the rather thin material and lack of opacity in the white T-shirt. I like a white T-shirt where my skin does not show through. This could be a great shirt though for someone really looking for an athletic cut to show off and athletic body.

I was looking for a great way to show off the arms and not have so much of a farmers tan while working out. The wife beater shirt was a little too much but this one is the mullet of shirts. The collar that screams business, with the lack of sleeves  that screams ready to party! The fish was excellent, and as expected. I am fairly tall so I always worry that the shirts will ride up when I lift my arms up. I can say that I lift my arms up and no leg m The fit was excellent, and as expected. I am fairly tall so I always worry that the shirts will write up when I lift my arms up. I can say that I lift my arms up and no ligma showing. The ladies can hardly keep their hands off me now. Even though I had initially a problem with shipping, it was handled very quickly and the item was delivered fast.

I notice that many people are complaining about the number of pages the ink prints.  I too had this problem at first.  The solution was simple.  I put the settings on draft which prints the same quality with less ink.  Standard print eats a lot of ink and if you put it on best it definitely consumes ink really quick.  I keep my printer set on draft and change it to standard only when doing special printing such as t-shirts, invitations or greeting cards.  When the light comes on that means that you have at least 50 pages (sometimes more) that you can print before you run out of ink.  I was able to put the cartridges I removed (because of the low ink light) back into the printer and got 50 or more pages out of them.  Just glad I decided to try it before I threw the cartridges away.  I hope this helps.

Yes, this was easy to install.  No, it wasn't worth the purchase price.  I printed out about 15 pages and all of a sudden my low ink light was back on.  Yes, the printer was inexpensive, but I have since tossed it because the cost of the ink was going to bankrupt me.  I am very disappointed because I liked the printer.  This is no deal.  Maybe if you print something every week or two, but not good for daily use.

Didn't seem to last as long as I expected.  But that may be misleading, since it starts telling you your ink levels are low when the cartridge is maybe one-half consumed. The Pop-up warning screen shows the ink level to be like maybe 5%, when you still have lots of ink left.  So, don't replace the cartridge until it actually stops printing.  For me, that was at least one hundred copies later.

This is the first time I ordered just the black ink (I usually get the combo) but there is no reason it should be such a poor product...they are the same thing. This printed 10 pages vs 25 with the one I got in the combo pack. I couldn't finish my project even. NEVER again!
Would of gave it five stars but could only afford 4 after buying ink lol
I am very dissapointed. I put this in today and after making four copies my printer says I need new ink.

As with all Canon ink cartridges, runs out much too quickly. This was never a problem some years back but most definitely is now. I used to print regularly and only had to replace ink every few months but now it seems even with hardly printing anything at all, the ink runs out. It is getting to where buying a new printer is cheaper than buying ink!

Lasted for about 15 sheets. Very much a scam. I thought i was imagining things, or perhaps doing something wrong with the printer settings but, after reading others’ reviews, I’ve concluded it’s a scam. I saved 5 cartridges I have bought and used in about one year, and I hardly ever print. Waste of money, shipping and packaging. Someone should complain that this is FRAUDULENT.

works well and easy to install, swapping cartridges takes 15 seconds. For some reason, the canon printers burn lots of black ink. It could be the consumption rate or the cartridge itself that requires this much ink. I don't print much so it isn't a issue.PS: Based on the supreme court decision in Lexmark v. Impression, it is fully legal and permissible for a third party to fill your ink cartridges. Not sure if there is one yet for this cartridge, but maybe worth a search? Hope that saves you some money!

It just doesn't seem fair that these ink cartridges are so darn expensive. The quality of re-manufactured or other brand cartridges is just the same, but the problem is that Canon printers detect them and flash up a warning and won't work with anything of a reasonable cost. So we are stuck with buying Canon's new ones.Canon compensates by selling the printer for $34! The Canon printer is wonderful and definitely my favorite among all the many other brands I've owned. But it doesn't seem fair that the ink is so very expensive -- not much of a discount for buying in bulk, either.I'd be happier if they would do good discounts if you are buying 3 or more. Give the consumer a break.

The review you are looking for:6.1 185 lbs extra large ordered.  Fits exactly the same as all major crappy cotton shirts in the USA.  Compare size to:  Basic Editons, Haynes, Carhartt (not Carhartt quality), Fruit of the Loom, Polo; all of which I have in my closet.  Do you have any type of cotton t-shirt in any of these brands?  If so, then whatever the size they are is the length and width of these shirts.  The arm holes are the size of a standard shirt with sleeves but only these are sleeveless and are exactly proportionate to the picture.I half expected to get a shirt waaaaaaaay to small or waaaaaaay to big and for the arm holes to be too big or clownish based on some of the reviews, but that just isn't what I got.  I got a shirt sized exactly as every run of the mill cotton shirt in my closet but only this one doesn't have sleeves.100 percent double stitched.  It's ok, just buy it in your size like you were at K-mart and if it doesn't fit then you can return or exchange it for free.  It only took four days to get it.

6'0" about 175 with medium build is my figure.I like how the tank top fits. Its not like a wife beater in tightness or a thin strapped tank top. It covers to the edge of my shoulder. Has a decently soft texture and has a small tag near the love handle.Other than that, it is a good shirt that is decently priced. I will be buying more eventually. Hope it lasts a long time too.

I bought this shirt and the CHAMPION equivalent in order to the compare the two.The Champion is the better shirt overall. The arm holes on the Russell are weakly reinforced and do not hold their shape. The fabric has a tendency to "roll." The arm openings are also too large. By comparison, the Champion arm openings are strongly reinforced and the openings are sized correctly...like a t-shirt with the sleeves removed. The material on the Russel is also thinner giving it a flimsy feel. The one area in which the Russel is better is the fit to size. The Champion seems to run a little small. So I'd go with the Champion and maybe size up one size.

I'd like this product more if the armholes weren't large enough to fit a small child through them. Aside from that it's a well made 100% cotton shirt. I love that there isn't an annoying neck tag. The color holds really well. Product quality is great, even after several months, it's not showing signs of wear.I am a large busted and broad shouldered woman and I don't particularly like women's tank tops since they never fit right as I like my clothes to be loose fitting. I don't like exposing my bra to the world which is why I take issue with the size of the arm holes. The picture and product don't match up in that respect.

These shirts do not wick at all. I mis-read another review and thought it said wicking. I bought these to wear in martial arts. I use them to sleep in now instead.Stitching started to come out around the arm holes, and the neck after the second was on all there.  I've woken up a few times with the thread used for stitches wrapped around my kneck. Not enough to be dangerous, just annoying and pulls the shirt funny (which wakes me up).

I ordered two Russell Men's Essential Muscle t-shirts - a blue one and a black one.  Supposed to be the same exact style and model with the only difference was the color.  The Blue one was exactly as described - a Russell sleeveless t-shirt.  the Black one was something else - it was not a Russell and in fact had no identifying name tag.  Also the sleeve holes were not hemmed and in fact looked as though they had been cut out by someone wild with scissors.  I am sure Russell would be embarrassed to have this product associated with their brand.  I gave a 3 because I could not give a 2 1/2 star rating - as only one was right.  I threw the other one away.

I bought this shirt in November of 2018 and wear it all the time.  I love the heck out of it.  One of my fav tank tops.  I liked it so much that I bought another identical one in April of 2019 and then the issue arose.  The first one fit just perfectly, but the second one doesn't "sit" right.  It tends to bunch up around the neck and shoulders instead of laying flat like the first one.  I thought it might need to be "broken in" but I've had it for 2 months now and it just fits horribly every time I try to wear it.  Super disappointed in the 2nd one but I think I waited too long to try and return it.  I think I'm going to order one more to see if I just got lucky with the first one or If I just got unlucky with the 2nd one.  Here's hoping......

I love this shirt. It doesn't shrink much, so even after being washed and dried it fits very well. It's baggy, which I prefer, and being that we're consistently hitting around 100 degrees (F) in Houston on a daily basis... it's comfortable all around.I bought a few of these a while back, and so I've bought another to have a new and extra one in rotation. I'd recommend these to anyone looking for this style, whatever your reasons may be.

I ordered two of these for my college-age son and my high school-age son for them to wear during band camp this summer. They're both slender guys with broad shoulders so I ordered a large. The length of the shirt and the shoulder width fit them great but the arm holes are HUGE! For what they intend to wear them for, they are fine with the large arm hole size but keep in mind, it may not be to the liking of a typical wearer.

for a better slightly looser fit go one size larger than you normally wear... unless you're trying to show off your physique (or lack of physique).i'm 6'3 and 290+, if i raise my arms mah belly shows.

Love these UA tech short sleeved - good for working out, lounging & as an undershirt. Unlike most cheap white cotton undershirts, these don't make you sweat & they last a really long time - proud to admit I have some that are many years old & still look perfect. They haven't discolored or faded & never smell bad from body odor. Worth it? Yes, most definitely.

Fits perfect, looks really niceUpdate: ordered different color of same product (grey) after a long gap (dint realize)At first, this product looks just ok, something about its material and fitting still did not convince me fully that is a. Authentic product

This is an alright shirt, as the fit is good (good length, nice fit in the body, longer tail). However the quality of the fabric seems to be lacking. I've worn the shirt just 3 times and it already has a couple very small pulls in the fabric. I've never had an Under Armour shirt pull this easily. It makes me wonder if this is an authentic shirt or just a fake.

This was recommended in one of the online running blogs specifically as a higher quality shirt that doesn't chafe.My usual point of comparison for  running shirts is the North Face "Better Than Naked" line. I understand that those are priced much higher, but  I was hoping that at the very least, the Under Armour was going to be at least a little close to the TNF than something like a Target brand.Sad to say, the Under Armour is pretty much the same quality as the $10 offerings from Target. The material is light and decently moisture wicking, but has pretty rough texture and tends to really cling to the body.  Towards the end of a medium, 6 mile run in this shirt, I started feeling a pretty significant chafing discomfort. So one of the main reasons for which I got this shirt didn't work out, therefore I can't recommend it.
Great Shirt doesn’t hold sweat or stink like Nike does.  UA is my new brand.  Leave sports fun and leave politics out of it!

Fit perfect. The cut is loose, while still being flattering. The fabric is soft and light. I normally hate any shirt that isn't 100% cotton, but underarmour is a strange exception.  These only get more comfortable after wearing and washing. I have a couple of these shirts that are years old and still look new and feel amazing.

Just received this yesterday, put it on and went straight to the gym.  The fit was as expected, It sufficiently wicks sweat away to cool you during your workout,  very comfortable and stylish as well.
I bought size L but is a little short for me, the next time I will buy XL. Equal is very nice , good color and excelent quality

Needless to say im a big guy. 6' 3" and 300 Lbs.These shirts are well made and keep you much cooler than a regular shirt.They are sized right and run on a "just right" fittingits almost like wearing no shirt, The breeze blows right though it and if it gets wet it dries quickly.Like them so much I bought 5 more.The price is right, they do what they are supposed to, stop looking and take the shot.

I had just bought some big name brand t-shirts that were very disappointing, they were on the small side, and very thin material.  So I was reluctant to buy these Champoion t-shirts, but so glad I did, they are perfect fit and very good material.  I will be buying more of these.

Mine was actual champion, I was expecting fake after reading multiple reviews but it has the tag, label and all. Super soft actually but I ordered an XL so it would be oversized and it was a BIG mistake. I’m about 5’5 and average weight for my height and it’s HUGE like a long dress.

No, it's not purple because I'm a Gators fan, it's because mine and ("Yes Dear,") my wife's favorite color is purple (actually, she's a Bama fan and I'm an Auburn fan).  It reminds her of Plymouth's Plum Crazy (much as I am...[crazy that is] about her).  THE Shirt!  Exactly what I was needing.  We have children and grandchildren in which these Southern belles WAY outnumber the fellas, like oh, (11 to 5 [incl in-laws]).  Hence, getting up at night when they're visiting, I (ahem) needed cover.  The XL-Tall fit that bill nicely.  Covers my XL chest and drops to mid thigh.  Makes an outstanding night shirt.  I liked it so much, I bought another in Grey, just to scare the heebe jeebies out of 'em.  Same size, same Champion logo.  Let them awake me in the middle of the night again..., Papaw is a ghost!
Fits much larger than most this size.
Looked well made, but was way too big. Had to return it. I got a 3xl tall.....and even thought that was a big 3xl tall. Bummer.
Looks great on my husband and fits comfortably.
It’s a nice shirt but I should’ve ordered it one size smaller..
I was expecting an authentic champion t shirt & what I received was a bootleg poor quality shirt.
Way too big and no champion "C" logo on sleeve. Not authentic
Nice material; soft and silky yet durable but those logos (on the front and back - for good measure). No sir - not for me
Excellent
Exactly what I wanted. Great Columbia quality and fast shipping!!
Very stylish very comfortable
My husband loves this! Great quality shirt. Great price.

This is my second time ordering a t-shirt from.this company.  My dad absolutely loves the material and I think the sayings are funny.  I bought him "The Grandfather" one and just got him "Best Dad Ever". I also ordered the "Powered by Ramen" one, since he eats those things every dang day. Lol. It should be here in a day or two.  Anyway, I highly recommend these shirts!!  Great quality and very affordable!!  💚💚💚💚💚
Shirt fits well but letters faded after one washing. My husband didn't even wear the shirt before the first wash. See photo.
Can't lie- these shirts rock.  It fit my dad well.

I purchased this t-shirt for my dad's birthday last month in red with white lettering. He loves it.Pros: Unbeatable price, great quality material, bright coloring, the detail on it is perfect, many colors and sizes to pick from, size is exact.Cons: I honestly cannot think of a single complaint or anything negative about this t-shirt.This is one of those purchases I get very excited about because of the price and quality. I will be back to buy more.
Great quality, true to size & comfortable soft shirt.. shipped fast and on time. Husband loved it for his first Father's Day present! Ordered the grey shirt

my boyfriend and I just recently found out that we are expecting. so for valentines day I decided to get him a "number 1 dads shirt" so I found this one and really liked it. the sizes run big. I got an XL thinking they ran small. so I defiantly should have stuck the large.  and the colors are a little off too, I got the coal black and it looks more brown.

I bought this for my husband for father's day. It exceeded my expectations. My hubby has a thin and muscular build, and average height. Most shirts either got in the body and the sleeves are too short, or the sleeves are the right length but the body is so wide he's been swallowed alive by the shirt. The material is thin, but sturdy feeling. A great buy for the Best Dad Ever.
Shirt looked great at first, but the lettering almost all came off after one wash in cold water. I'd give negative stars if possible. Very disappointing...

Bought this shirt for my husband for Father's Day. It looked great when it arrived (I got the navy shirt with white writing) but after 1 wash the writing faded substantially making it barely readable. I would pursue a refund if the gift wasn't sentimental to my husband. I wish the shirt had been of higher quality.

I love how slim this case is and how well it protects my phone. However, I could not rate this product a "5" for two reasons. First, it is not a "stay-clear/anti-yellowing" case. After exactly a month of using it (purchase January 7, 2018 and today is February 7, 2018), the front/face of the case has turned yellow. So if you hold the phone case on its side, the front is a yellowish tint and the back is still clear like the day I bought it. I thought it was my make up rubbing off on it, but after cleaning it with soup and water (more than once) it still has a yellowish tint. Also, the back of this case is not a "hard scratch-resistant shell". Within my first week of using it I already had numerous scratches. Today, a month later, the back of my case is completely filled with scratches. I will admit, the case does protect my phone. The actually case has cracked but the case is so thick that I can see the crack but I can not feel it and most importantly, my phone is unharmed. By the way, I NEVER write reviews. But I felt the need because I love this case but hate the issues I have encountered within my first month.

CONFIRMED: This case does work well with the iPhone X and does support QI Charging through the case! It's a snug fit the first time popping the device in, but once it is in it gives great all around protection as expected from OtterBox.My only complaint is that with my Glass Cover which wraps on the sides, the case forces it up and creates a bubble. I will need to try and re-apply the glass with the case on. I would suggest that others do the same.I will also add that the case feels great in my hand with the iPhone X in it, I think this will hold up to anything I throw at it.

Got this case and put my brand new iPhone in it. I dropped my phone 2ft to the kitchen floor, and it shattered (front and back) into pieces. I even had the Otterbox brand tempered glass on the screen. I have always used the commuter with my previous iPhones and I swear by it. This one is awful, do not trust your $1100 phone in this case. I was stuck making an insurance claim to replace a brand new phone within 2 weeks of buying it and placing it in this case :(

I don't know about you but the objective of getting a clear case is to show off how elegant the iPhone X really is. My go-to case "was" Otterbox because of it's durability. Within a week's time however, the sides started to turn yellow; within 2 weeks even more yellow. So I call the Otterbox customer service to ask if the case is supposed to turn yellow. They say no, so I ask for a replacement. To their credit, they replace it with no problem, albeit, a $6 shipping charge. I get the 2nd one and within the same 2 weeks, it was pretty yellow again. I call Otterbox again and they send me a 3rd one, free of charge this time because I insisted (since they won't admit it turns yellow). Sure enough, after 2 weeks it was yellow again. Folks, it just looks awful with a yellow tint around the sides...it just removes the beauty of the phone. Fortunately, I had known a person who had a Speck Presidio clear case, and theirs had not turned yellow. I finally bought the Speck case in July. We are now in September and it has not turned yellow. Go Speck if you HATE that yellow tint. I'm careful with my phone so I don't usually drop it...I'm not sure is Speck can handle drops better than Otterbox but it sure looks good without that DAMNED yellow tint.

After a long stay away from this company I decided to give this case a try for my iPhone X.At first glance it’s bulky and rounded, and makes me feel like I’m holding an old Android phone.Incredibly it seems as if the techs at Otterbox have created a completely frictionless phone case. This made my iPhone X slide into places no phone should ever go.  Consistent only in the fact that the surface chosen to rest the phone on must be plumb and level or else suffer yet another trip to the floor, nook or wormhole.However the case did manage to protect my new IPhone from the dozen or so drops it sustained within 24hrs due to the case itself.Just long enough to order a new case which is perf and return this warm stick of butter surrounding my sweet phone.

The product is horrible. It says that it has anti yellowing features and it’s already yellow after only having just about three weeks I am very disappointed in the product and would like some explanitaion on this.
I LOVE this case. Not only is it efficient and 100% genuine in its function, it's also SO PRETTY.
The case is amazing, but the clear version does scratch easily on the back, returning for the black version now2 weeks later.  The whole back is scratched pretty bad

Installed on an Iphone XS (2018)This cover was meant to be used in an IPhone X. It fits fine on the XS, except for the speakers at the bottom. Left speaker was shifted to the right and now has 2 of the holes covered up by the case. This does not affect performance of the speakers at all though.The cover is made out of hard plastic with semi rigid rubber areas inside and on the sides. It was very hard to install on the phone because the case does not flex. I thought I was going to break my brand new phone, but eventually got it in.This case provides plenty of protection for the rear cameras. The camera bump sits around 1-1.5mm deep inside the case. This was exactly what I wanted. Most other cases Ive seen are practically flush with the camera.Buttons operate correctly, though a little hard to push. The silent mode switch I find a little hard to get as it sits very deep inside the case. I need long nails to reach the switch.I find the case a little on the slippery side. Particularly the back side. I installed a metal plate such that I could use my magnetic phone holder that I have in my car. Due to the thickness of this case, the phone is held up fine, but not as tight as my previous phone. The slippery back makes me nervous that the phone might slide off.Overall I like it. Plenty of protection, to be tested when I drop this phone eventually.Might eventually change it for something more stylish though.

I’m not one to write reviews but I felt like I need to for this product. First off, I had this case for my iPhone 8 Plus and it was great. 3 weeks ago I go the iPhone XS and purchased this case thinking it would be great like my last one. Boy, WAS I WRONG. On week 2 of having my phone, I dropped my phone from maybe 3 feet off the ground. It landed flat on concrete. I picked it up and the upper right corner of the phone slipped out of the case which caused the phone to crack between the case and the screen protector. So I thought to myself, maybe user error.... I ended up replacing the cracked screen. A WEEK LATER my phone fell 2 feet from my hand as I was leaning over and fell to the ground. AGAIN the phone slipped from the case and it cracked the bottom right part of my screen protector (thankfully not the actual screen). I am not sure if the case is not tight enough or what, but I DO NOT recommend this case to anyone with an X or XS. I just ordered my MOUS case and cannot wait to throw this one out!

I read some reviews of this shirt about the sizing which stated buy a size smaller that you would normally buy, so I bought a medium as I would normally buy a large.  The medium was too small.  I returned and bought a large which is perfect.  So for me, I buy this shirt in a large as I would for any other shirt I would buy.  The shirt is wrinkled when arriving.  I used a steamer, and it removed the wrinkles nicely and quickly.  Be careful using a steamer.  It is nylon/polyester, so I just hit it quickly and don't leave it too long in one place.  The steamer is always moving over the fabric.  Good shirt. I like it , and will probably build a collection of these in different colors.  Excellent summer shirt, and will be cooler than a T-shirt in my estimation.  Never heard of a fishing shirt before.  Glad to make this discovery, though I will still get my fish from Costco and wear this shirt as I buy them.

I bought this shirt to wear backpacking, and I’m really putting it to the test. Sometimes I wear it for 2 weeks at a time without washing it, all while hiking and wearing a pack.It’s held up great so far. I love how light the fabric is. The shirt keeps me cool in hot weather and serves as an adequate base layer in cold weather.There is some discoloration from sweat, but nothing too bad.I love how the sleeves roll up and down. It feels very secure and looks good.The shirt seems like it’s going to live forever even thought I’m asking a lot of it. There are no rips in the fabric despite the fact that I’ve worn it through many forests and scrambled up and down rocks. There is plenty of room in the shoulders for movement.I am a 5’8” female and I weigh 180. I ordered a men’s medium because I wanted it to be big. I used to own a small and it was still big on me, but I like them this way so they are very airy. I will attach a photo.

This is the second shirt of this type I've bought.  I use it in Baja for summer fishing on the Sea of Cortez where it is frequently 95+ degrees and humid in unfiltered sun. Me and the shirt are in the sun for about 8 hours. The material is very lightweight but blocks the sun at SPF 50 level, I think. The sleeves can be rolled up to short sleeves or left longsleeve. I leave them down and the material is very breathable so your forearms stay comfortable. I also turn up the collar to protect my neck. I wash it out at the end of the day and it's dry in a few hours and ready to go for the next day. It's nice to do so, but you don't need soap to wash out the sweat. I just rinse it well in fresh water and air dry it. My last shirt lasted 10 years (maybe that's about 200 days of use) and the only reason I got a new one is because the fabric is beginning to feel a little thin. But after all this use there are no rips, no seams coming undone, no buttons falling off...so, good construction.

It's a nice shirt, but way too thick of a material for warm weather. I was expecting something lighter duty and more breathable like my nylon sun pants. Fabric also feels a bit rough and isn't brushed. Size all around seems fine, but the neck was super tight when fully buttoned, which is bad for a hot weather shirt. Going up a size would help but them the arms would be too long.I will have to return this shirt. It's just not good enough for what I need. I found a similar shirt from a different brand that is made from polyester and is much lighter and better in hot weather.

I got this shirt for my husband for Christmas. I had bought/ordered one for my father a year or so before and my dad loves his. Uses his for golf a lot. My husband and I like to hike and camp and kayak and go birding and I figured this would be a great shirt for those types of activities. The shirt fit my husband perfectly, and the color looks just as it was shown. The shirt has performed very well and my husband says it is very comfortable. It seems very well made and has gone through the normal wash cycle and low setting on the dryer several times now with no show of wear or fading.It doesn't seem to wrinkle more than I would expect. We take it out and hang it up fairly quickly, but do not iron it.We are planning a trip to South America next late spring and this shirt will surely be packed as it will perfect on jungle hikes there. We will need something that breathes well and will dry quickly.  The shirt is also attractive, so it looks good tucked in to chinos with a belt as nicer casual attire for when in town.

Most want to know the size! I am 6 feet, 175 lbs., and always wear a large, 34-35 sleeve. I ordered this Large long sleeve and the sleeves fit perfect. The rest fits a bit big, in the shoulders and body. I then ordered this short sleeve in Medium. Fit is more typical of a large, as compared side by side along all my large shirts. I included pictures and measurements because they tell the truth, I wish more reviewers would also! If sleeve length is not an issue, the medium fits best if you normally wear a large, unless you want that extra room. Being slim and trim, the medium is still more roomier than my other large shirts. Medium body is 24.5", and large is 26" wide. Length from armpit to tail, med. 15.5", large is 16". Shoulders from seam to seam is, med. 21.5" and large 22.5" The sleeve length of a long sleeve is 33.5. on a large. If someone else could post a review of the sleeve length of a medium, measured from collar to end of sleeve, that would help others!

I had an exact shirt in different color in medium that I thought was a bit small for me, this Large feels just a bit too big...  but the large is more comfortable then the medium...  So, at 5-10 195# I would go for large over medium.  Otherwise, these are my favorite shirts now, casual but nice enough to wear to church!

The build and quality of this Columbia shirt is everything you could expect. My only issue is fitment. I usually wear slim fit shirts and ordered this based on the image. When I received, the shirt sleeve length was good as well as chest but the cut around the stomach is "baggy". I'm 6'2" 190lbs and this shirt doesn't fit like the photo. Regardless I'm keeping because it just seems all of these kind of shirts are "baggy in the belly" unlike the the sporty PFG Terminal Tackle shirts.

I grew up in Florida and spent most of my time outside. As a result, I've got scars all over... I've had so much scraped, burned and cut off of my body, I look like I was in a knife fight with Pahoo-Ka-Ta-Wah. I need the protection when I'm out in the sun hiking, fishing, cutting the grass or whatever and I hate sunscreen or lotions.This shirt is well made, comfortable and looks good. Big pockets. Plenty of room, I wear Xlarge.  I would say the sizes are true. I'm 6' 2", 210 lbs. This shirt fits great, is warm but not any warmer than a cotton long sleeve shirt. Unless there's a breeze it's going to be warm, especially if it's 90 degrees in the shade.I liked the first one so much I ordered three more.

This is a great shirt! Yes, it runs large, but we bought our size anyway. As an ocean fishing shirt it is comfortable. And if he falls overboard can be seen easily. Kidding of course, no one wants the Captain over board. We got a fabulous deal for buying a not so popular color, the bright lime green.  Quality Columbia brand construction and product. Have several of these and they last forever, indestructible! Prefer the nylon fabric over polyester. A nylon cotton blend would be even better.

The shirt fits as expected and is a descent quality shirt I originally bought it to wear at a 70s party but I liked it so much that I went and bought another one the colors are very vibrant I don't think anyone will have any issues with quality/price

Picture quality: perfect! I washed the shirt 3 times and it hasn't faded at all yet.Size: I ordered a size large which is what I normally where in t-shirts, but it was extremely too big. I returned the shirt and ordered a size medium which was still a tiny bit too big, but I don't really like tight shirts anyways so it was fine. So ladies, please order one size smaller!My measurements: (in inches)Shoulders: 38.8"Bra: 36DBust: 38.9"Waist: 30.2"Hips: 37"Height: 5'2"Shipping & Returning: I had to return and replace my shirt to a size Medium because I ordered a size Large which was way too big. As long as you follow Amazons instructions, its very easy to return your product or get a refund. The shirt came in good packaging.Arrival: fast.I definitely recommend with product to anyone! But for women, order a size smaller.
Love it! Colors are vibrant and exactly like the picture! I will recommend this company to anyone who want good quality tie dye products! I plan on buying more!
Was skeptical at first but when I tried it on, was I glad I went for it.  100% satisfied as you can see in the  picture below of me and my girlfriend rocking it together.

Ordered a Neon-Rainbow for my grandson.Predominant color is bright pink. Most of the shirt is covered with bright pink.  Not so on the picture of what the shirt will look approximately like.I didn’t see it until it was delivered to grandson’s home and washed before being worn (no, it did not change color from he wash. Would have returned it prior to washing if I’d have seen it first. That said the quality for the price really is very good.Funny part is I ordered 2 at the same time and the 2nd one, a size child’s S for a 5-6 year old was as advertised and fit my big 4 year old grandson just fine.I know it’s tye dye and colors vary but be prepared for possibly something totally not expected.  In fairness to the seller and because I have to get a different one to replace the pink one, I'm ordering another in totally new color pattern.  Keeping my fingers crossed on the next one.

The shirt is very bright and pretty. I threw it in the wash with my other clothes and everything came out fine. I also dried it in the dryer and I don't think it shrunk. I wasn't sure whether to get a M or L, but ended up going with the L in case it did shrink. I am 5'6" 160' and 38x32x41. The L fits comfortably but definitely looks like I'm wearing a man's shirt. I think I will try a M next time. I gave 4 stars for the pretty design and fast shipping. The fabric is a little bit coarse though and I wish Colortone would offer a women's cut.
Shirt is tiny for a large!!! Won't order anymore

Love this. Exactly like picture. Read several comments about stiffness of material...it's because of the dye. Fabric softener should straighten that right out. Not a concern. That being said, I haven't washed this garment yet, but do expect it to shrink so I will wash in cold and lay flat to dry. No issue for me as I allow everything to air dry. This does run a little small. I ordered up 1 size and it fits fine. Not as loose as I'd like, but another size up would swallow me, not doubt. Up 1 size, air dry, no problems. Will update only if something changes. Very happy with this.
Nice shirt, great quality.  The size runs a little bit small. If your size is Medium, I suggest next size.

I loved the colors and the price is right.  I only gave it four stars because it fit a little small and it is advertised as thick cotton but I thought it was thin (I have some T-shirts that are much thicker).  I was going to send it back but my friend really liked it and it fit her so I gave her the first one I ordered and then I ordered a second one at the next size up.  The second one was a little larger than how I normally wear T-shirts but that is fine because I really like the extra roominess.  The T-shirt is very comfortable.  I am thinking about buying some more different colors.

This is the best shirt out of several brands of work shirts I have tried. I tried stocking up on Duluth Trading Long-Tail t-shirts because they had extra room called a 'tradesman fit' that's the opposite of a slim-fit shirt, that and they are a few inches longer on the bottom to prevent plumber's crack. The problem I ran into, price. Duluth Trading stuff is really nice, I mean REALLY NICE, but it's too expensive. From underwear to shirts to pants, I love their stuff to death but I went broke just buying 2-3 days worth of clothing.So began my search for alternatives. For a few days I wrapped my mind around all normal shirts being too short for me. One, I do not like plumbers crack and I bend down and kneel down a lot. Two, I conceal carry. Long shirts do 80-90% of the concealment for you if you have one, otherwise you have to dig a holster inside your pants and dig into your hip hard. Extra-tall sized shirts is a cheap alternative to the semi-custom size of the Duluth Longtail t-shirts. Next criteria I needed, price. Well pretty much everything is cheaper than Duluth, except maybe UnderArmour. But UnderArmour stuff is generally tight-fitting, so they lose that competition. These are shirts I bought in Tall size to supplement my existing longer Longtail t-shirts:Fruit-of-the-Loom (FOTL) cotton t-shirt from Wal-Mart: Average fit around my body, feels like advertized size. Thin material. Cost $8 in Wal-Mart, cheap but it's not a quality shirt at all and doesn't compete with the rest. It's just a grade lower. It's a cheap shirt but I would still gladly wear this if I didn't have my other work-shirts.Hane's Beefy-T's 6.10z t-shirt: Cheap, less than half price of Duluth. Material is too thin for me for a work-shirt. Yes, even in summer I like thick material as it wicks more sweat away. The material was too thin for a work shirt, same thickness as the FOTL shirt. Slightly trim fitting, after break-in they are what I consider 'normal' for their advertised size, slightly more trim than the FOTL. $10 with Prime.Dickie's Big-tall heavyweight crew neck short-sleeve: thicker than the Beefy-T, but just barely. Same price as Beefy-T. Very trim fitting for advertised size, I would consider these as a 'trim fit' for very lean individuals to be comfortable in. Even if I was in the same shape as I was at 21, these would still be tight fitting.Duluth Long-Tail t-shirt (did not order as tall, ordered at normal height): Thick material, comfortable in summer by wicking moisture better and comfortable in winter since it's thicker. Two or three inches taller than other standard-sized shirts which spoiled me and now I order tall shirts from all other companies. I consider them nearly perfect shirts year-round but the price, I only have 3 because after shipping they run over $20 a piece from Duluth, and no Duluth does not have Amazon Prime shipping. Nice, very nice, but expensive to build a wardrobe with.Carhartt Big-Tall Work Wear Short-Sleeve t-shirt: Material is as thick as Duluth shirt. I ordered this in tall, and is 1 inch longer than the standard-length Longtail-T from Duluth as a result. Not quite as generous fitting as the Duluth shirt, but it's a good bit larger girth than the other brand shirts. Material is slightly rougher feeling than the Duluth but still comfortable even when bending non-stop. Costs $15 with Amazon Prime, 50% more than the Hane's and Dickie's but at least $5 cheaper than a Duluth shirt.My summary is the Carhartt wins overall. Thick enough, long enough, and I tested mine in 100 degree heat recently. Like the Duluth shirt, the thicker material worked to help wick sweat away longer than thinner shirts will. But I live in a very humid area a few miles from the Mississippi river. Very humid Mid-Spring to Fall. Lots of people might not need to fight humidity this much. I can stock 4 Carhartt shirts for a buck or two cheaper than 3 Duluth shirts, and anyone who works outside often knows you can often go through two shirts or maybe even three on a hot work-day in order to keep dry. So that means I can stock up on 12 shirts instead of 9 going Carhartt to carry me through a whole week without running out of shirts, even when a certain family member (you know who you are in each family) hides them in a clothes pile somewhere for a few days. The savings is enough to make a big difference for anyone buying a few shirts.

Once again, not disappointed with the Carhartt shirts I purchased to be embroidered for our construction business. Hunter Green pictured on top of Carbon Heather, Dark Cobalt Blue, and then the navy, all Carhartt brand and original fit. Size LARGE men's and the size is 24 inches under the arm and 32 inches long- from the top of the shoulder to the bottom of the shirt. Also bought some size large Guilden brand shirts, and the Carhartt is an inch wider, longer, and the arms are way wider as well. Great quality and I know from past purchases that they hold up with heavy use and heavy washing.

TERRIBLE QUALITY SIZING CONTROL I have purchased these numerous times I re-READ the TAGLESS TAG in the shirt SHOCKER it's clearly Stamped 3 X LARGE TALL. it was 7" longer & at least 6" inches WIDER than the old ones I have made in GUATEMALA (these were also stamped exactly the same & made in Guatemala if you happen to weigh 300-500 pounds and are 6' 8"+ these will probably Fit YOU.SIDENOTE=I am 6' 4" 260#  58"chest  & my regular size is 3XLT in this Carhartt workwear Pocket T.the shirt is a nice heavy weight so I am hoping if I order 2XL they will fit like the 3XLT used to Thank Goodness for PRIME &  Free Returns

Normally I wear a size large T shirt so I ordered the large. It was a little too big so I ordered a Medium. When the Medium arrived it was exactly the same size as the large, so I ordered a Small. When the Small came it was exactly the same size as the Medium and the Large. There is only one size they are just marked with S.M.L. Since I only use these for working in the yard it's not a big deal, but all of them are the same size.

As you can see from the label this shirt made in Guatemala is NOT 100% cotton, nor is the color anywhere as light as the heather grey. You sent me Desert grey. The other two made in Haiti and Mexico supposedly were, but all feel pretty rough like polyester!

Great shirts and its about all I wear. I liked the light duty shirt but it lagged a little too much with all the junk I carry so these are it. Summer and long sleeves in the fall and winter. I've been a customer since I was a kid. The offshore waters here in the northeast are unforgiving most of the time so I wear their stuff on  the outside too. On these,no ripped off pockets or torn armpits,they wash well and you can't beat them for comfort. I've got cigar burn holes in them and the holes don't stretch out. The little burnholes are still little burn holes when they com out of the wash,good stuff and this is a great deal.

Love these shirts. They wash up well, don't shrink, the neck stays tight. Sure, they are pricier than other tshirts, but well worth the extra money. Others will be long relegated to the rag bag or sleep shirts for your family and these will still be going strong. Bite the bullet and order a few. You won't regret it.I ordered several of these and the Dickies. Very close. These were cut about an inch longer. Other than that, they were virtually identical. The length made the difference for me. Dickies went back and I ordered more Carhartts.But, be advised, they are a heavier material than most. Too heavy to be worn as an undershirt.

My husband is 6' 3" and 300+ lbs. He requires a shirt with a pocket, a long torso to tuck in and one that doesn't stretch out or lose it's shape. He is very happy with these shirts. He isn't a fan of advertising a brand name but is impressed with the quality.

The sizes are unlike any other manufacturer I've purchased from.  These shirts don't just run large, mine seemed to be SEVERAL sizes larger than what was indicated on the label.  Despite being "regular fit" this thing fits like a tarp, and the length goes all the way past my knees, it's ridiculous.  This shirt is so oversized it's laughably bad.  Not only does it look terrible, but it would be impossible/dangerous to work in because the loose, draping fabric is just begging to get caught on anything and everything.  I've loved Carhartt stuff for years, but something is has gone seriously wrong with their design and manufacturing.  I won't buy this brand ever again.

Carhartt gear is typically top notch but the sizing was WAY off and the material was uncomfortable. I'm 6'5" 260# normally wearing XL shirts and their XL Tall fit like a giant potato sack that hung halfway down my thigh. Supposed to be loose and long, but with this being one of their smaller Tall fit shirts I can only imagine the 3XT is essentially a queen size bed sheet. Decided to run it through an extra hot wash for a little shrinkage and give it a go. Helped a little but not enough to not make me look like a little kid wearing my dad's old T. Wore it while doing an outdoor project and after 10 minutes of sweating the shirt became gritty and incredibly uncomfortable. Made for a mediocre towel the rest of the day as I opted to go shirtless instead. Only slight positive i can think of is the material is thick enough to keep you warm. It retained water very well and weighed ~5 lbs by the end of the day.

Highly recommend this product, purchased this for my wife 2 weeks ago along with the iPhone X. Also had a tempered glass screen protector on it...anyways, I dropped her off at the front door of the house today and after she closed the door she accidentally dropped the phone and it of course landed under the back tire of the car. Unknowingly I proceeded to drive to park and run over it! Thankfully it was perfectly fine! The screen protector however didn’t get so lucky. I’m extremely pleased with the performance of this case! Recommend to everyone! -Rebeca’s husband

Doesn't fit properly on my iPhone Xs. The rubber buckles around the buttons. It is real loose the volume and on and off button. This case does not fit properly, the edges are exposed and flimsy. I’d be worried if I drop it. This is not for iPhone Xs. I am hugely disappointed. Openings at the bottom for mike is bigger than required (looks like they sent the cover for iPhone Xs). Camera and apple logo on the back of the phone do not properly fit at the center of the openings.  This is a huge disappointment since its a costly cover then it should fit in the iPhone Xs.

This case is great! Sleek but feels protective. It has a "lip" that goes over the phone screen so if you drop it, the case hits the ground first and not the screen. I had no issues with it not fitting as previous reviewers mentioned, this one fits perfectly over the X with no bulges or button alignment issues.I've used the Commuter Otterbox for every previous iPhone I owned and they were always great, so I hope this one continues to work just as well!

I bought this case because I had the same one for my iPhone 6s and it worked with a new baby so well. My baby would throw it and drop it all the time and nothing ever happened. For years I didn’t have one crack.  I got the new iphone XS two weeks ago and just a few days into using this case the screen is cracked. You can tell that this case isn’t as good as the older version of the same model because it doesn’t come up as high around the sides of the screen so it can’t provide as much protection. I’m not sure why otter box changed their design for the commuter but I am returning this and paying to get my screen fixed :(((((

Pros• Slim but provides the perfect protection to your iPhone X.• Two layers case.• Hole in the back for the ones who like to show off the Apple logo.• Feels good in your hands with a great grip.• Even if your phone has a tempered glass, thanks to its raised beveled edge, it will keep the screen safe if the phone fell on a flat surface.• Provides great protection to your back camera thanks to the raised beveled edge.• The buttons are very responsive.• Protects your lighting port against dust and debris, thanks to a nice cap.• Wireless charger friendly, I am using a Choetech.Cons• Might slip on some hard surface.

Overview: This case has protected my iPhone X from numerous drops.Pros:  I'm not an overtly clumsy person.  But for some reason I feel like I need to drop my $1,000 phone onto the ground from waist to chest height.  Not a single scratch has appeared from the numerous drops.Cons:  The reason I keep dropping my phone is the hard outer shell is super slick.  Imagine dipping your hands into olive oil and then picking up your phone.  That is how slick this case is.  There is no texture to the outer shell.  You will accidentally drop your phone with this case...numerous times.  The good news is, it is awesome at protecting the phone from the inevitable drops.

I do not believe this is a legit Otterbox, or the quality of Otterbox has changed. With all my previous Otterbox cases the two part system has worked really well and both layers feel of quality. This case has a cheap rubber that is not flexible as they have been before and and doesn’t fit like a glove. The plastic is lacking the support to keep the rubber tightly against the phone especially on the top half of the phone.

I bought the symmetry case clear and it was scratched up in a week. This case has more protection and is just as slim! Weighs more yes, but it’s worth it. 1,000 dollar phone deserves this case. Don’t be cheap!  Plus you get the opening in the back for the Apple LogoWorks with WIRELESS CHARGING TOO

I got this for my new iPhone Xs as I loved the Commuter case on my previous iPhone 7.  Overall I did not feel like this case fit the phone well. Not sure if this is an issue with the Xs or just the overall design of the case.  The rubber portion felt loose and spongy, especially around the side button and camera while the outer plastic piece felt like it was too small and never felt completely secure over the rubber.  Things just didn't line up or look tidy.I just ordered and received the Otterbox Symmetry Case which feels perfect on my phone.  Seems like a much more secure fit and doesn't seem to sacrifice anything on protection.  Love Otterbox and their products, but the Commuter on the iPhone Xs is a "miss" for me

I was really excited to get this case but disappointed when I got it. I have always had a Defender case and this doesn’t feel as safe as I’m used to. There is only rubber on the inside and slightly on the edges so I doesn’t grip that well when holding or using on the side. Also there is no clear protector for the circle in the back which is what made me decide to return it. Great case for someone who is careful with their phone just not someone who wants to feel protected.

Years ago I had a small epiphany: I realized that every time I went into the t-shirt drawer to grab a shirt, I was always (almost subconsciously) hoping that my favorite couple of shirts was in there, and I would be a bit disappointed when I had to grab another one. So I decided that going forward my wardrobe would contain ONLY my favorite types of shirt.The main problem with that is the fact that the overwhelming majority of t-shirts (regardless of how much you pay) are total crap. They are thin and flimsy, the fit isn’t good, and they aren’t as comfortable as they should be.So, ever since then I’ve tried to find the best possible t-shirts and this is one of them. The other is the Hanes “Beefy-T” but those are super thick 100% cotton and not ideal for all situations.These Russel shirts are the BEST blended shirts in the world (meaning they are made with a blend of cotton and synthetic fibers). They fit EXCELLENT. They are just lose enough to be comfortable but not so loose that they look sloppy. That means that you can wear the shirt out (if you want) and not just wear them to bum around the house. The fabric is very durable even after years of use and the colors don’t fade. The synthetic fibers keep you cool and the cotton feels great agains your skin.I highly recommend these shirts.

I bought these because my XL shirts are too big for me and I needed to go down a size. I usually buy Hemp shirts because of the comfort...but at $30/shirt I was willing to take a chance on something else. I've had Russell products in the past and I recall them being the go-to outfitter when I was  in school. These are awesome to wear during the summer and to the gym. Mine are holding up nicely in the wash and the color has not faded nor have they shrunk. These are so cheap that if you are on the fence just do it. I originally wanted to buy Under Armour t-shirts.....with Russell I was able to buy 3 for the price of one UA shirt. I like the logo on bottom and some have the logo on the sleeve...all 3 of my Russell shirts are different but all 3 are holding up fine and look good. I'd say this is a medium weight shirt....i've had thinner.

This is my "Goldie-Locks" of t-shirts. I wanted a t-shirt that was ultra comfortable that I could work out in that wasn't too thin or too thick, not too long or too short, not too loose or too tight. I tried multiple brands and figured out that these Russell Athletic shirts were the ones that fit my needs. I have broad shoulders and a large back and chest. These shirts fit my body shape very well. I don't care for the dry-fit shirts. I like the feel of cotton or a cotton/poly blend against my skin. In addition to working out these are great for every day wear and lounging around in as well.

Somewhat thinner fabric material than other colors in this product line, which does not fare well in the wash after  a few rounds of washing - fabric pills. I bought this product thinking that a polyester mix fabric would be pill resistant, unlike typical cotton fabric, but not so, it seems. Incidentally, I bought the same product line (different color) years back from a store, and they still look like new after dozens of washes. Im still evaluating other colors in this line that I bought along with this one, will update this review later.

I've owned a number of Russell brand t-shirts over the years and these are made from by far the thinnest material I've ever seen in one of their shirts. I don't know why men's t-shirts all of a sudden started getting made from tissue paper thin material. I bought some Russell tees just a few years ago and they were made from a much heavier material. Maybe these are specifically meant for Amazon?It's still pretty well made and there's nothing wrong with these shirts, but I prefer a heavier shirt. They also run a bit small for my liking. They call them "cotton" shirts but they are actually a cotton/polyester blend? If you're a fan of modern, paper thin tees that are kind of tight then these will be fine for you.

I buy a lot of Russel Tee Shirts.  This time I ordered 3 different colors.  Navy, Dark Green and Maroon.  I would say these are OK but not a lot to brag about.  The colors are representative of what is advertised, they do fit as expected but the material seemed a bit thin to me.  Fair price but for Russell, I was a bit disappointed.

Worn once, for all I know it will fall apart, second wash.  HOWEVER, I very much like this T shirt.  I am six foot, 165, skinny and strong.  A medium fits me perfectly, not tight, not loose.  For eight bucks total?  Give this shirt a try.  You can buy four for the same price as one Nike or UA wicking shirt.  EDITED after receiving additional shirts.....  I've lowered my rating from five to four stars.  My first shirt was "vintage heather navy", and appears to be a slightly better quality material than the two colors which I ordered subsequently.  And given what appears to be a slightly thinner product, the medium is just slightly too tight on my mature chest.  Still a bargain, but I'll be careful about how and where I wear them.  If you're a slim college kid with big guns, get this shirt.

So far these T shirts fit almost like the original over 10 year old shirts with no rips or tears.I looked up Russel Athletic and found that they were still in business. Two things really piss me off though.  My original shirts that last forever are made in USA. Their add eludes that the shirts are still USA. It pisses me off that their shirts are no longer made in the USA. It sickens me that a manufacturer formerly of the USA who produce A # 1 quality garments! This defies the fact that US does not make quality goods! Shame on you Rusell Athletics- Shame on you! Greed took over. You make more$$$$ but you put people out of work!  Evan

Like many of the reviews here say these T-shirts are not what they used to be. Maybe its just the wrong style but overall I am not pleased with the purchase. I have worn the Russell  athletic T's for many, many years because of their heavy duty material that always held up to the hard work I do.  These shirts are just like the all too common cheap synthetic feeling stretch cotton that you find at bargain stores. They are very thin, not like they used to be. Sweat in it once and its time to change your shirt because you are soaked. I wore the grey one once and developed holes in the front from just one day of normal wear.When it comes to a work/workout shirt I have never minded sacrificing comfort for functionality and while the Russel athletic T's of the past were not uncomfortable I could care less about how super soft the shirts were. These feel flimsy because they are.  I almost wondered if these were counterfeits.

The quality was ok for my needs.  The sizing however was WAY off.  Instead of being a 4X they were more like a XL. I kept checking the size to make sure I had ordered correctly. I held them up to a 3X that had been washed several times and the 3X was approx. 1.5" bigger on each side.  Had I not already removed the tags I would have returned them, instead I will pass them on to someone else.

Highly recommend this product, purchased this for my wife 2 weeks ago along with the iPhone X. Also had a tempered glass screen protector on it...anyways, I dropped her off at the front door of the house today and after she closed the door she accidentally dropped the phone and it of course landed under the back tire of the car. Unknowingly I proceeded to drive to park and run over it! Thankfully it was perfectly fine! The screen protector however didn’t get so lucky. I’m extremely pleased with the performance of this case! Recommend to everyone! -Rebeca’s husband

This case is great! Sleek but feels protective. It has a "lip" that goes over the phone screen so if you drop it, the case hits the ground first and not the screen. I had no issues with it not fitting as previous reviewers mentioned, this one fits perfectly over the X with no bulges or button alignment issues.I've used the Commuter Otterbox for every previous iPhone I owned and they were always great, so I hope this one continues to work just as well!

The plastic is lacking the support to keep the rubber tightly against the phone especially on the top half of the phone.

I bought the symmetry case clear and it was scratched up in a week. This case has more protection and is just as slim! Weighs more yes, but it’s worth it. 1,000 dollar phone deserves this case. Don’t be cheap!  Plus you get the opening in the back for the Apple LogoWorks with WIRELESS CHARGING TOO

I got this for my new iPhone Xs as I loved the Commuter case on my previous iPhone 7.  Overall I did not feel like this case fit the phone well. Not sure if this is an issue with the Xs or just the overall design of the case.  The rubber portion felt loose and spongy, especially around the side button and camera while the outer plastic piece felt like it was too small and never felt completely secure over the rubber.  Things just didn't line up or look tidy.I just ordered and received the Otterbox Symmetry Case which feels perfect on my phone.  Seems like a much more secure fit and doesn't seem to sacrifice anything on protection.  Love Otterbox and their products, but the Commuter on the iPhone Xs is a "miss" for me

I was really excited to get this case but disappointed when I got it. I have always had a Defender case and this doesn’t feel as safe as I’m used to. There is only rubber on the inside and slightly on the edges so I doesn’t grip that well when holding or using on the side. Also there is no clear protector for the circle in the back which is what made me decide to return it. Great case for someone who is careful with their phone just not someone who wants to feel protected.

I love how slim this case is and how well it protects my phone. However, I could not rate this product a "5" for two reasons. First, it is not a "stay-clear/anti-yellowing" case. After exactly a month of using it (purchase January 7, 2018 and today is February 7, 2018), the front/face of the case has turned yellow. So if you hold the phone case on its side, the front is a yellowish tint and the back is still clear like the day I bought it. I thought it was my make up rubbing off on it, but after cleaning it with soup and water (more than once) it still has a yellowish tint. Also, the back of this case is not a "hard scratch-resistant shell". Within my first week of using it I already had numerous scratches. Today, a month later, the back of my case is completely filled with scratches. I will admit, the case does protect my phone. The actually case has cracked but the case is so thick that I can see the crack but I can not feel it and most importantly, my phone is unharmed. By the way, I NEVER write reviews. But I felt the need because I love this case but hate the issues I have encountered within my first month.

CONFIRMED: This case does work well with the iPhone X and does support QI Charging through the case! It's a snug fit the first time popping the device in, but once it is in it gives great all around protection as expected from OtterBox.My only complaint is that with my Glass Cover which wraps on the sides, the case forces it up and creates a bubble. I will need to try and re-apply the glass with the case on. I would suggest that others do the same.I will also add that the case feels great in my hand with the iPhone X in it, I think this will hold up to anything I throw at it.

Got this case and put my brand new iPhone in it. I dropped my phone 2ft to the kitchen floor, and it shattered (front and back) into pieces. I even had the Otterbox brand tempered glass on the screen. I have always used the commuter with my previous iPhones and I swear by it. This one is awful, do not trust your $1100 phone in this case. I was stuck making an insurance claim to replace a brand new phone within 2 weeks of buying it and placing it in this case :(

I don't know about you but the objective of getting a clear case is to show off how elegant the iPhone X really is. My go-to case "was" Otterbox because of it's durability. Within a week's time however, the sides started to turn yellow; within 2 weeks even more yellow. So I call the Otterbox customer service to ask if the case is supposed to turn yellow. They say no, so I ask for a replacement. To their credit, they replace it with no problem, albeit, a $6 shipping charge. I get the 2nd one and within the same 2 weeks, it was pretty yellow again. I call Otterbox again and they send me a 3rd one, free of charge this time because I insisted (since they won't admit it turns yellow). Sure enough, after 2 weeks it was yellow again. Folks, it just looks awful with a yellow tint around the sides...it just removes the beauty of the phone. Fortunately, I had known a person who had a Speck Presidio clear case, and theirs had not turned yellow. I finally bought the Speck case in July. We are now in September and it has not turned yellow. Go Speck if you HATE that yellow tint. I'm careful with my phone so I don't usually drop it...I'm not sure is Speck can handle drops better than Otterbox but it sure looks good without that DAMNED yellow tint.

After a long stay away from this company I decided to give this case a try for my iPhone X.At first glance it’s bulky and rounded, and makes me feel like I’m holding an old Android phone.Incredibly it seems as if the techs at Otterbox have created a completely frictionless phone case. This made my iPhone X slide into places no phone should ever go.  Consistent only in the fact that the surface chosen to rest the phone on must be plumb and level or else suffer yet another trip to the floor, nook or wormhole.However the case did manage to protect my new IPhone from the dozen or so drops it sustained within 24hrs due to the case itself.Just long enough to order a new case which is perf and return this warm stick of butter surrounding my sweet phone.

The product is horrible. It says that it has anti yellowing features and it’s already yellow after only having just about three weeks I am very disappointed in the product and would like some explanitaion on this.
I LOVE this case. Not only is it efficient and 100% genuine in its function, it's also SO PRETTY.
The case is amazing, but the clear version does scratch easily on the back, returning for the black version now2 weeks later.  The whole back is scratched pretty bad

Installed on an Iphone XS (2018)This cover was meant to be used in an IPhone X. It fits fine on the XS, except for the speakers at the bottom. Left speaker was shifted to the right and now has 2 of the holes covered up by the case. This does not affect performance of the speakers at all though.The cover is made out of hard plastic with semi rigid rubber areas inside and on the sides. It was very hard to install on the phone because the case does not flex. I thought I was going to break my brand new phone, but eventually got it in.This case provides plenty of protection for the rear cameras. The camera bump sits around 1-1.5mm deep inside the case. This was exactly what I wanted. Most other cases Ive seen are practically flush with the camera.Buttons operate correctly, though a little hard to push. The silent mode switch I find a little hard to get as it sits very deep inside the case. I need long nails to reach the switch.I find the case a little on the slippery side. Particularly the back side. I installed a metal plate such that I could use my magnetic phone holder that I have in my car. Due to the thickness of this case, the phone is held up fine, but not as tight as my previous phone. The slippery back makes me nervous that the phone might slide off.Overall I like it. Plenty of protection, to be tested when I drop this phone eventually.Might eventually change it for something more stylish though.

I’m not one to write reviews but I felt like I need to for this product. First off, I had this case for my iPhone 8 Plus and it was great. 3 weeks ago I go the iPhone XS and purchased this case thinking it would be great like my last one. Boy, WAS I WRONG. On week 2 of having my phone, I dropped my phone from maybe 3 feet off the ground. It landed flat on concrete. I picked it up and the upper right corner of the phone slipped out of the case which caused the phone to crack between the case and the screen protector. So I thought to myself, maybe user error.... I ended up replacing the cracked screen. A WEEK LATER my phone fell 2 feet from my hand as I was leaning over and fell to the ground. AGAIN the phone slipped from the case and it cracked the bottom right part of my screen protector (thankfully not the actual screen). I am not sure if the case is not tight enough or what, but I DO NOT recommend this case to anyone with an X or XS. I just ordered my MOUS case and cannot wait to throw this one out!

Wow, how can you mess up this bad? These are NOT the same sweatpants they used to have! We ordered from this same place, same company, same way on Amazon by pushing "reorder this item" and they are completely different pants. Knock-offs maybe? Our previous ones were awesome and thick, nicely made BUT these are horrible: they are paper thin with no fleece or felt on the inside, big thick exposing nasty stinky rubber waistband, they fit really odd in all the wrong places. I should return them but seems more a hassle than anything.Guess I'll try and wear them as scrap pants I suppose. I see this a lot on Amazon lately, you can order one thing from the same place and it's great and then the next order is completely different.

Like so many others here, I'm fed up with these pants. The waistband thread rips out at first washing, and at third washing the fabric has pulled away from the waistband elastic. By the time you get it out of the dryer the threads have encircled the legs and you can't get them apart.There is a solution, though it will cost more and is not Prime-eligible: Look up Champion Men's Closed-Bottom Jersey Pant (yes, it's exactly the same description as this pant here). The ASIN (Amazon Standard Identification Number) is B003XDTAWU. The model number is p2235. The waistbands are made differently; they are much more durable and have given me much less trouble. They are made in Honduras, whereas the rip-apart pants on this page are made in El Salvador.Unfortunately, the better ones cost $17.90 plus $6.99 shipping. But for people who rely on these pants as my husband does, they are much more reliable and worth the extra charge.

Have to give one star because the trousers have  2 inches different lengths . A picture is shown below.I am surprised at such a stupid mistake and very curious of how it happened though do understand everyone makes mistakes .

I've tried several different sweatpants over the years and having used them at the gym, for playing badminton, as sleep/daily wear etc. etc. I've come down to some key requirements. These are probably the only sweatpants that fit all of them:1> full-loop inner drawstring at the waist (full-loop: not a split drawstring that could get twisted in the dryer or lost in the seam by mistake; I don't even tie it - just pull it a bit and leave the rest to the elastic in the seam) (inner: not an outer drawstring that would lurk from under my gym t-shirt)2> comfy ankle elastic (comfy: not a tight-fit at the ankle - so it's easy to pull on and off especially after an exhausting workout/game) (elastic: not a drawstring at the ankles that I would have to constantly conscious about while moving around in the gym or any new place I go to)3> light-weight material (it's not heavy and/or warm - just ok to keep the cold at bay but it's not built for that)4> not-irritable (and polyester irritates you, these come in a color variant with more cotton)5> have held up pretty well over 6 months of constant use and machine wash+dry (may have faded a bit but the discoloration must have been uniform to have gone quite unnoticed (talking solely about the granite heather variant - haven't tried the others)) and look like they'll last me at least a year.Considering that I am very lazy at writing reviews, I must say I'm a very satisfied customer. I'm ordering 2 more of these sweatpants since even after 6 months I could not find another product to match my sort of specific requirements. If only they came with a length option I would have ordered some for my dad, who wears the same waist but is shorter in height and such closed-ankle sweatpants cannot be altered like the open-ankle ones. At the price-point I highly recommend them to anyone looking for a decent pair of sweatpants.

Fit and fabric are the same, but unfortunately the waistband is much wider than before and not completely fabric covered, so not as comfortable or attractive.  Not sure if this is a permanent change to all Champion  jersey closed bottom pants and not sure reason for change.  We'll see how the consumer reacts to this.  Hope Champion strongly considers returning to the original design.

This might have been the most disappointing pair of sweats I have ever purchased. The material is some blend rather than the all cotton sweats I have owned in the past. The strings that are meant to hold the pant up are a complete joke, made of cheap material, they want to break the first time I cinch them up. The cut of the pant kind of flares out round the seat and tapers down towards the ankle. A cheap imitation of the old sweats that used to be available in athletic stores. Definitely not what I was looking for, and I ordered two of them. It seems that sporting goods stores want you to buy a $75 pair of designer sweat pants which don't feel right going to the gym in. I could not find basic cotton sweatpants that fit the way I prefer so I opted to buy from a picture from Amazon, and though the picture seemed to be what I was looking for, it was not in fact what I expected.

I initially was happy with these sweatpants. After a couple months though, I now realize that these definitely are NOT 100% cotton as specifically advertised.  At first, I thought the discomfort I experienced when wearing them perhaps was due to some new-fabric sizing that did not wash out completely. This obviously polyester blend is uncomfortable because the fibers rub the skin and also stick into the skin. They have become even more uncomfortable with additional washings.

I just got these. They’re nice pants. But don’t make a mistake and buy these if you’re looking for fleece material. These are cotton pants. I didn’t realize that when I chose these. I thought they were fleece material. But it’s ok. We’re going into hot weather now, so these are ok to wear. They fit ok. They feel ok too. I like it that they have pockets. But they are not deep pockets. So with all that in mind, that’s why I gave it 4 stars. I tried looking for black sweatpants all around my area and nobody seems to have what I’m looking for OR just don’t have them at all. Especially Walmart. I was shocked Walmart didn’t have Anything at all. That’s usually the first place you look for cheaper items that you want. But these pants aren’t cheap! The elastic around the waist is pretty well made. So I’m happy with that. So if you’re looking for cotton sweats, then these are for you and I recommend them. I didn’t feel any polyester in these pants and they are not a sheen type of material. I don’t like sheen.

I've been a loyal user of these jersey pants for at least the past several years.  Unfortunately, my older pairs finally began to fall apart, so I bought two pair of these new jersey pants to replace them.  Immediately upon receiving them I had to send one pair back because I couldn't help but notice the legs were CONSIDERABLY shorter than the other pair (despite both being the exact same sizes).  That was problem #1 and easily remedied by the return, but that one experience was a "quality control" red flag for me from day one.  Then, immediately upon starting to wear the pair that I decided to keep, I began to wonder about the construction quality of the waist band because the elastic is no longer sewn/wrapped INSIDE of the jersey fabric like it used to be on the older version of these pants, and the stitching also just didn't seem very tightly sewn.  Well, sure enough, here I am just a couple months after receiving them and already the stitching on the second pair that I kept has begun to to unravel!  The older pairs of these jersey pants that I used to own were FAR better made in every way, and they each lasted me several years before the "stretchiness" of the elastic on those older pairs finally broke down.  These new pants:  very poorly made!Bottom line:  Don't waste your money on these!  These pants are just one example of a Champion product that was once made with decent quality, but clearly no longer is.  Guess that's what happens when you contract out to the lowest bidder!  Time to start searching for jersey pants made by a different, better quality brand.

I would stay away from this brand and these sweatpants.  My husband only had this pair for a month and the stitching was already coming undone.  I purchased two of these at the same time one in a different color and that one did the same thing. I returned that one because it was less than a month that he had these pants.  Very disappointed, because these are light and comfortable, but then this issue of the stitching coming undone was unacceptable.
