I would not recommend these you will be hating yourself for buying these.

In terms of my torso, the shirts fit just as I desired.  A bit snug (and stretchy), but still comfortable.  But know that the shirts do run long.  Where most shirts stop roughly where around the pockets of my normal jeans, these shirts extend to cover my entire fly (zipper) of the same jeans and a bit more.  It also resembles one of those super sexy tight and short dress-shirts that girls sometimes wear, just to give you a better picture.The material is the usual thickness; not too thick or too thin.  The bottom of the shirt is also hemmed.  And yes, it's tagless.  The tag is printed on the actual shirt, no extra material or stitching.In short, as I use these as undershirts, the length isn't a problem as it will be tucked into my pants.UPDATE: After roughly 15 washes, the shirts are still holding strong.  They've held their size and stretch well.  Stitching still looks like it did day 1, and the shirts have not faded at all.  I've gone as far as to order 2 additional packs of these shirts as they fit well, feel great, and are well made.  To date, I have no complaints, large or small.Purchased this product a total of 4 times: April 2017, Nov 2017, Jan 2018, Dec 2018I wear tank tops daily under my work shirt, meaning they get washed OFTEN.  They do expand, but it takes a lot of washes, and even then the expansion is really just the loss of the stretchiness.  The shirts basically go from slim fit to normal fit.  I will continue buying these shirts as they feel great, wear well, and last a suitable amount of washes.

I am female. They make women's undershirts too short, and cheap ones for women are never 100% cotton (which is LAME), so I thought I'd try this. Ladies: It's a fairly deep scoop neck, but probably sits too high on the actual breast part to wear as a cami under anything really girly, but for regular under-shirt performance I think it's great! I like wearing A shirts to bed. Good news: covers most of your butt to give you that held together feeling. Bad news: arm holes are cut deep into the chest which could give some girls too much side boob. Wash them first if you want to avoid reaching escape velocity. I wear them tight so they don't get bunch under your clothes and to get extra support.

1. These run VERY small. I am tall and thin (6'4" 180) and usually buy Hanes undershirts. Their large size fits me well but they stretch out too quickly. I've never had a problem before buying undershirts that are described as long-hemmed for tucking in. But these are on the small side and they shrink A LOT. I tried it on out of the package and was very optimistic, so I washed them all, and putting one on out of the wash I don't think they're going to work - pretty sure this won't stay tucked. It's that short now!2. Other reviews mention this; they are not the softest fabric. Perhaps this would improve with repeated wear/wash cycles that I won't get to because of the size problem. I wouldn't describe it as scratchy or rough, necessarily, just... not soft.3. Assorted colors really means assorted. You don't just get what's shown here. I bought two four-packs: Black, Light Gray, Royal Blue, Royal Red. Second pack had Navy, Navy, Royal Blue, Light Gray. Take your chances!I guess you get what you pay for. I was happy to have a slightly less luxurious feel and to roll the dice on colors, for the price. But, they are just too small. So, bottom line: beware. These are MUCH smaller than other brands' large undershirts.

The shirt size I ordered fits me as expected. However, the shirt colors that was sent was different from the one that was advertised. I was expecting the brown and navy blue but received red and royal blue instead. Not good.

These are pretty nice basic tanks, especially for the price...which if we're honest makes each tank top work out to be about $2.75....and I'm not even sure it makes any kind of sense in our world that I can pay $2.75 for a tank top and then have the audacity to JUDGE it...bwaKeep in mind that $2.75 includes the shipping to me cause I have Prime..ha...wow.....kind of makes me feel like it should be a 5 star review just for that...hmm..Annnnyways, they are a close fitting Large. As they are meant to be undershirts I suspect. Not loose and baggy.They are for my husband who is wide shouldered, slim build, 200 lbs and 6 feet tall. He first tried them on before we washed them and they were slightly loose and then after washing and drying they shrunk up a bit to a perfect fit. Think athletic fit, no bagginess.Great for exercise or under looser shirts.The hem of these tanks are just raw edge that has been overlock stitched. Very basic...but again...$2.75 a tank!The colours stayed true after several washings already so that is cool.The photo doesn't do the colour mix justice, they are deeper, richer colours. The red is more super hero red than maroon and the blue is very blue..again, think superheros.I did experience a small problem after the first wash. The stitching came half undone in the shoulder of one of the tanks...we inspected the others and their shoulder stitching stayed tight so I am assuming it was a fluke...but again these are your basic cheap tank and for the price don't be expecting top quality stitching and finishing.They're comfortable too. My husband usually wears a looser tank for every day wear but for exercising, Yoga etc, he wanted the slimmer fit so the shirt wasn't hiking up and getting in his way. The ribbed quality of these make them stay put.So, all in all very nice!I'd buy again if we needed them.I docked a star for the unfinished hem and shoulder seam that I had to fix after the very first wash.

I have been buying these very undershirts for sometime now. Amazon - as usual - has the best prices too.Amazon also makes buying these and many other underclothing items a fail-safe purchase thanks to their free-return offer.The Medium size (showing 'MMM' on the undershirt) feels very good against your skin. It stretches nicely to fityour body and probably are best for the more fit/athletic shaped guys at least in the Medium size I get.Shipping as always for Prime members was fast and I got them in 2 days. Do note that they tend to be on the long sidewhere the Medium size is 34" long out of the box. It does shrink a little after a couple of washes, but being thin fabric itwill rise some when you wear it and not really remain the full 34" inches down.

I'm a bigger guy and have very few problems when I order a 3xl. Usually, anything this size is roomy and loose on me.Not these.I probably should have tried one on first but they looked big enough as I removed them from the packaging. After I tossed them in the wash, I tried one on and it was so tight, I looked like Philip Seymour Hoffman's character in Boogie Nights.Definitely would not recommend these at all as the material is cheap and ill fitting.

My 4-star review is only for one reason: the colors I received were not the one's pictured on the description page. I got 2 out of the 4 colors pictured. Unfortunately, it looks like this may have been my fault. Upon a closer read of the description, it looks like this was mentioned -- "Items are assorted and comes with colors different from the image."Aside from 2 unwanted colors (a bright red one and an ugly shade of blue). The size fits me just right and feels just fine on me. I use them to work out at the gym. Nice snug fit. Hopefully they don't shrink in the wash as others have said on here. I'll be sure to air-dry them to avoid possible shrinkage since they are 100% cotton.Anyway, recommend getting but be aware you may not get the colors you want.

[UPDATED REVIEW 2016.11]I have now owned these tank-tops for a year.  Although they are slightly less abrasive after many washes, they are still snug.  They have not shrunk or stretched out and have for the most part remained the same size.  I still recommend ordering a size larger if you prefer a looser fit.[ORIGINAL REVIEW 2015.11]As previous reviewers have suggested, it is a bit snug however I prefer my tank-tops to be this way.  Buy a size or two sizes larger if you like a looser fit.  My only complaint is that the texture is slightly abrasive despite being 100% cotton.  I have only owned them for 5 months so I am hoping it will break in with time.

I like FOTL products because they are pretty good and cheap.  HOWEVER, it's rediculous that they are never the same product twice.  A-frame shirts...no hem at bottom, then hemmed bottom; sturdy shoulder stitches, then weak shoulder stitches; average sized arm holes, then rediculously large arm holes.  Same with the boxer briefs...good overlap on front flap, then no overlap on front flap, then good again; large fits, then large doesn't fit; cotten feels like cotten, then cotten doesn't feel like cotten.  It's as if FOLT is bought out and moved to a new country every few months.  Crazy.  So why am I still ordering them?  Because it's not always bad changes; sometimes they get better.
Awesome shirt.  The kids got it for my husband and he loved it.  Great fit and great quality.  we got an XL.  My husband is 6'2" and weight 250 pounds and a muscular build.  Hope this review helps
I didn’t see it in person as it was a gift sent straight to my dad through Amazon. He said he liked it! Ordered a 2XL. He’s 6’5”

For some reason grandfathers love these types of shirts or at the least the ones in my family do. My daughter is three and we get one for them every year, usually whatever Target has at the time but this one was much better. Arrived quickly and the price and quality are great. I would absolutely buy from this company again.

Shipped much faster than I expected, looks great and the base is a standard Glidan shirt if that helps anyone figure out sizing. I ordered 3x and looks tts. Very happy with the product, have a hard time finding good Pop Pop gifts!

I actually purchased 3 of these tees, for our nephew-in-law, his dad & my husband for Father's Day. They are really nice & printed very well, not just some cheap stamping on the front. They are light, a perfect weight for summertime. The size, large, seems about right. If in doubt, order one size up, I'd guess. But for us, these are all fine & I'm sure they'll be a big hit come Father's Day weekend.

I ordered this shirt as a gift form someone for Christmas.  I was completely surprised how soft and what great quality it was.  I read some of the reviews that said that it ran small, so I ordered a size up.  I believe I could have ordered the regular size as I believe they are true to size.

This shirt came and was extremely wide and short.  We purchased a 2XL for my father who is 6'2".  The shirt was several inches too short and extremely baggy.  The company quickly refunded the money.  We would buy this again if it was available in tall sizes.

Such a cute t-shirt! My dad loved it! I think the large runs a little large around the waist, but the arms looks like a typical large. Overall, excellent and well made shirt! Fabric is soft and the printing is done really well.
I bought this for my dad on Father’s Day. He’s about 5’9 and 280 lbs, he’s a big fella.  After reading the reviews I Opted to go up a size and it fit perfectly.

The idea for the shirt is pretty neat. Other reveiws said the shirt was too small. I bought xl but really should have got medium. The logo sits in the middle of the belly rather than the chest. The size combined with the logo placement means this shirt wont be worn out of the house.

I have had this protector as I feel it is was necessary to get it for my iPhone 8 plus. Being a recent convert from a Samsung Galaxy 5, I could no longer feel comfortable being responsibly gentle with an even larger and significantly heavier phone, so I looked for a case that wasn't too bulky, but also something that offered some protection. My first case was the Pursuit, but I felt it was too big, and the cover switch for the ringer did not work properly, so I returned it.After much research, and nearly buying a silicon case with fuzzy lining, I chose this. I went back to it because it was American made, which I felt meant it may have went through a strict quality control process, and I liked the feel of the pursuit case, despite the non-functioning ringer cover switch.I am happy with this purchase, and for the face of the phone that is not covered, I feel this product works well if you have a separate glass face protector. I am usually a bigger fan of single piece protectors, but not in the instance of a case where a touch screen is involved. I am also happy that this case was not as bulky as I expected, as I had planned to get a slimmer case for formal events. To me, this provides excellent protection without being bulky.This unit went on over my phone a little tight at first, as it was activating some of the side volume buttons as it was being fitted over my iPhone 8 Plus. But once on, it felt very snug. I like that the case feels nice with semi-grippy rubber around the side, but rigid and hard along the surfaces on the back at the same time. I guess I'm a tactile sort of person because besides liking the feel of this case in hand, I have no problems placing my phone down on hard concrete (which I would be nervous about doing with iPhones bare glass exterior) and enjoy that the phone feels protected in my front (yes, front) pocket as well, from shifting and or bending.An important feature to me is that the camera 'bump' is aligned in a fitted hole that gives it and the flash an ample opening and provides what feels to be a quarter's thickness to keep the bump from touching a surface if the case is placed camera-side down.The bottom cut-outs for the lightning cable and bottom speakers holes seem perfectly aligned for me, and the side buttons for the power and the volume controls are pleasantly stiff, which are find for me since I do not use them much and value the protection they provide for the little-used buttons. I also like that the ringer on/off switch is a simple cut-out rather than an attempted addition side button. I feel that this switch is, by design, something to correctly cover and have another working switch over it, as the Pursuit attempted to do.I highly recommend this case and I think it is an excellent value on Amazon at $28 at the time of purchase. I would be willing to bet it's nearly twice as much if you buy it at your local cell phone provider.Thank you for reading and I hope this review helps you.

This is the fake GARBAGE that AMAZON Fullfilment sent to me! It’s a FAKE KNOCK OFF of an Otterbox branded Symmetry Series case. Amazon’s is made in China. The REAL Symmetry case from Otterbox is much different looking and comes in very expensive packaging!!! Total disappointment from Amazon today!!!

The item I received is NOT a true Otterbox. The box that this cheap silicone/ rubber cover came in states “Stylish Coice, Fashion Case” with an Otterbox sticker stuck crookedly on front. The “case” does not have a hard back or a raised beveled edge. I know this is fake since I’ve had one for my previous iPhone and it was a wonderful product. Otterbox box was also imprinted in the case. This “cover” does not have Otterbox on it anywhere. Returning immediately.** Added pics. I purchased a real one from Best Buy on left. They price matched Amazon. You can see the flimsy fake in second pic and the true Otterbox in last two pics.

I've had this case for almost 10 months so I think I can speak definitively about this.Look I know I'm the kind of person who drops stuff. I'm also the kind of person who likes to go out which makes me a 2x kind of person who drops stuff. So when I'm getting a case, it's a short term relationship.Not this son of a gun. Let me tell you the ways I've dropped this - off of a desk, off a ladder, accidentally threw across the street, sneezed so hard it flew out of my hands and hit the wall, angrily made hand movement and it slipped out, demonstrating how good it is by throwing it on a couch, demonstrating how good it is by throwing it on the floor,  dropped in a pot of water (that probably has more to do with the phones water resistance but STILL), thrown as a joke, thrown as not a joke, adamant gesticulation, demonstrating how hard my brother's head was by hitting him with it (would not recommend), trying to impress girlfriend, dropped every day.Seriously, as someone who drops their phone both intentionally and unintentionally, I cannot recommend this case enough. Also it looks good, I love the color, it's light and is the slimmest case that will still protect your phone to a degree that you legitimately don't have to worry about it if you're a class A phone dropper.

Case seems to protect the phone well enough but it scratches very easily and the scratches make it very slippery and hard to hold. After only having the case for a short time it already looks terrible. Not a good design, next time I’ll be going with something other than OtterBox.

Terrible...I always trust otter box with my phones. This case however let me down. It is really pretty but pretty poor quality. The back got scratched from just placing it on a table, and not to mention the color transfer from any clothing item you wear. I’m disappointed I paid so much money for this disappointing case 👎🏻

Did not protect the back of my phone from breaking.  My phone was in my coat pocket and I was bent down getting something from the floor of my car when my phone slipped out of my pocket and fell to the driveway. I didn’t even cringe, it was such a small distance and didn’t sound like a hard fall. Very shocked to see the cracks across the back. Ive trusted in this brand for years and was very disappointed!

I give one star because I can’t give a 0... In the features says STAY- CLEAR / ANTI-YELLOWING, one of the main reasons I bought it. But after a week using it it’s horrible. Looks like it’s 2 colors! All the edge it’s yellow, looks dirty. DONT BUY IT !

I bought this for my daughter for Christmas and she loves it! It is very protective yet fashionable. She’s dropped her phone multiple times from pretty high with his case on and her phone stayed safe; the case did not take any damage either. It came in the nice packaging and also came with a warranty. (The white splotches seen on the case in the photos are just from the flash.) I hope this review helps! 😄

Ugh I had high hopes for this one, but I dropped my phone twice..and not from a skyscraper.. from less than 3 feet and both times my glass protector cracked.. thankfully I had the protector on it, but I have had the same screen protector on my phone since December ($40) and have dropped it many times without a scratch.. but since this case doesn’t actually cover the phone.. the phone touches the ground first instead of the case.. and that’s why it cracked it.. I went back to the other series and so far so good..Another thing ..the phone is hella slippery when your trying to use it.. no grip what so ever ..The only thing I liked was that I could use the Apple mirror in the back since it was see through

I notice that many people are complaining about the number of pages the ink prints.  I too had this problem at first.  The solution was simple.  I put the settings on draft which prints the same quality with less ink.  Standard print eats a lot of ink and if you put it on best it definitely consumes ink really quick.  I keep my printer set on draft and change it to standard only when doing special printing such as t-shirts, invitations or greeting cards.  When the light comes on that means that you have at least 50 pages (sometimes more) that you can print before you run out of ink.  I was able to put the cartridges I removed (because of the low ink light) back into the printer and got 50 or more pages out of them.  Just glad I decided to try it before I threw the cartridges away.  I hope this helps.

Yes, this was easy to install.  No, it wasn't worth the purchase price.  I printed out about 15 pages and all of a sudden my low ink light was back on.  Yes, the printer was inexpensive, but I have since tossed it because the cost of the ink was going to bankrupt me.  I am very disappointed because I liked the printer.  This is no deal.  Maybe if you print something every week or two, but not good for daily use.

Didn't seem to last as long as I expected.  But that may be misleading, since it starts telling you your ink levels are low when the cartridge is maybe one-half consumed. The Pop-up warning screen shows the ink level to be like maybe 5%, when you still have lots of ink left.  So, don't replace the cartridge until it actually stops printing.  For me, that was at least one hundred copies later.

This is the first time I ordered just the black ink (I usually get the combo) but there is no reason it should be such a poor product...they are the same thing. This printed 10 pages vs 25 with the one I got in the combo pack. I couldn't finish my project even. NEVER again!
Would of gave it five stars but could only afford 4 after buying ink lol
I am very dissapointed. I put this in today and after making four copies my printer says I need new ink.

As with all Canon ink cartridges, runs out much too quickly. This was never a problem some years back but most definitely is now. I used to print regularly and only had to replace ink every few months but now it seems even with hardly printing anything at all, the ink runs out. It is getting to where buying a new printer is cheaper than buying ink!

Lasted for about 15 sheets. Very much a scam. I thought i was imagining things, or perhaps doing something wrong with the printer settings but, after reading others’ reviews, I’ve concluded it’s a scam. I saved 5 cartridges I have bought and used in about one year, and I hardly ever print. Waste of money, shipping and packaging. Someone should complain that this is FRAUDULENT.

works well and easy to install, swapping cartridges takes 15 seconds. For some reason, the canon printers burn lots of black ink. It could be the consumption rate or the cartridge itself that requires this much ink. I don't print much so it isn't a issue.PS: Based on the supreme court decision in Lexmark v. Impression, it is fully legal and permissible for a third party to fill your ink cartridges. Not sure if there is one yet for this cartridge, but maybe worth a search? Hope that saves you some money!

It just doesn't seem fair that these ink cartridges are so darn expensive. The quality of re-manufactured or other brand cartridges is just the same, but the problem is that Canon printers detect them and flash up a warning and won't work with anything of a reasonable cost. So we are stuck with buying Canon's new ones.Canon compensates by selling the printer for $34! The Canon printer is wonderful and definitely my favorite among all the many other brands I've owned. But it doesn't seem fair that the ink is so very expensive -- not much of a discount for buying in bulk, either.I'd be happier if they would do good discounts if you are buying 3 or more. Give the consumer a break.

I love how slim this case is and how well it protects my phone. However, I could not rate this product a "5" for two reasons. First, it is not a "stay-clear/anti-yellowing" case. After exactly a month of using it (purchase January 7, 2018 and today is February 7, 2018), the front/face of the case has turned yellow. So if you hold the phone case on its side, the front is a yellowish tint and the back is still clear like the day I bought it. I thought it was my make up rubbing off on it, but after cleaning it with soup and water (more than once) it still has a yellowish tint. Also, the back of this case is not a "hard scratch-resistant shell". Within my first week of using it I already had numerous scratches. Today, a month later, the back of my case is completely filled with scratches. I will admit, the case does protect my phone. The actually case has cracked but the case is so thick that I can see the crack but I can not feel it and most importantly, my phone is unharmed. By the way, I NEVER write reviews. But I felt the need because I love this case but hate the issues I have encountered within my first month.

CONFIRMED: This case does work well with the iPhone X and does support QI Charging through the case! It's a snug fit the first time popping the device in, but once it is in it gives great all around protection as expected from OtterBox.My only complaint is that with my Glass Cover which wraps on the sides, the case forces it up and creates a bubble. I will need to try and re-apply the glass with the case on. I would suggest that others do the same.I will also add that the case feels great in my hand with the iPhone X in it, I think this will hold up to anything I throw at it.

Got this case and put my brand new iPhone in it. I dropped my phone 2ft to the kitchen floor, and it shattered (front and back) into pieces. I even had the Otterbox brand tempered glass on the screen. I have always used the commuter with my previous iPhones and I swear by it. This one is awful, do not trust your $1100 phone in this case. I was stuck making an insurance claim to replace a brand new phone within 2 weeks of buying it and placing it in this case :(

I don't know about you but the objective of getting a clear case is to show off how elegant the iPhone X really is. My go-to case "was" Otterbox because of it's durability. Within a week's time however, the sides started to turn yellow; within 2 weeks even more yellow. So I call the Otterbox customer service to ask if the case is supposed to turn yellow. They say no, so I ask for a replacement. To their credit, they replace it with no problem, albeit, a $6 shipping charge. I get the 2nd one and within the same 2 weeks, it was pretty yellow again. I call Otterbox again and they send me a 3rd one, free of charge this time because I insisted (since they won't admit it turns yellow). Sure enough, after 2 weeks it was yellow again. Folks, it just looks awful with a yellow tint around the sides...it just removes the beauty of the phone. Fortunately, I had known a person who had a Speck Presidio clear case, and theirs had not turned yellow. I finally bought the Speck case in July. We are now in September and it has not turned yellow. Go Speck if you HATE that yellow tint. I'm careful with my phone so I don't usually drop it...I'm not sure is Speck can handle drops better than Otterbox but it sure looks good without that DAMNED yellow tint.

After a long stay away from this company I decided to give this case a try for my iPhone X.At first glance it’s bulky and rounded, and makes me feel like I’m holding an old Android phone.Incredibly it seems as if the techs at Otterbox have created a completely frictionless phone case. This made my iPhone X slide into places no phone should ever go.  Consistent only in the fact that the surface chosen to rest the phone on must be plumb and level or else suffer yet another trip to the floor, nook or wormhole.However the case did manage to protect my new IPhone from the dozen or so drops it sustained within 24hrs due to the case itself.Just long enough to order a new case which is perf and return this warm stick of butter surrounding my sweet phone.

The product is horrible. It says that it has anti yellowing features and it’s already yellow after only having just about three weeks I am very disappointed in the product and would like some explanitaion on this.
I LOVE this case. Not only is it efficient and 100% genuine in its function, it's also SO PRETTY.
The case is amazing, but the clear version does scratch easily on the back, returning for the black version now2 weeks later.  The whole back is scratched pretty bad

Installed on an Iphone XS (2018)This cover was meant to be used in an IPhone X. It fits fine on the XS, except for the speakers at the bottom. Left speaker was shifted to the right and now has 2 of the holes covered up by the case. This does not affect performance of the speakers at all though.The cover is made out of hard plastic with semi rigid rubber areas inside and on the sides. It was very hard to install on the phone because the case does not flex. I thought I was going to break my brand new phone, but eventually got it in.This case provides plenty of protection for the rear cameras. The camera bump sits around 1-1.5mm deep inside the case. This was exactly what I wanted. Most other cases Ive seen are practically flush with the camera.Buttons operate correctly, though a little hard to push. The silent mode switch I find a little hard to get as it sits very deep inside the case. I need long nails to reach the switch.I find the case a little on the slippery side. Particularly the back side. I installed a metal plate such that I could use my magnetic phone holder that I have in my car. Due to the thickness of this case, the phone is held up fine, but not as tight as my previous phone. The slippery back makes me nervous that the phone might slide off.Overall I like it. Plenty of protection, to be tested when I drop this phone eventually.Might eventually change it for something more stylish though.

I’m not one to write reviews but I felt like I need to for this product. First off, I had this case for my iPhone 8 Plus and it was great. 3 weeks ago I go the iPhone XS and purchased this case thinking it would be great like my last one. Boy, WAS I WRONG. On week 2 of having my phone, I dropped my phone from maybe 3 feet off the ground. It landed flat on concrete. I picked it up and the upper right corner of the phone slipped out of the case which caused the phone to crack between the case and the screen protector. So I thought to myself, maybe user error.... I ended up replacing the cracked screen. A WEEK LATER my phone fell 2 feet from my hand as I was leaning over and fell to the ground. AGAIN the phone slipped from the case and it cracked the bottom right part of my screen protector (thankfully not the actual screen). I am not sure if the case is not tight enough or what, but I DO NOT recommend this case to anyone with an X or XS. I just ordered my MOUS case and cannot wait to throw this one out!

Not enough people put their body dimensions on here to make sizing an unseen/unknown shirt easy.I'm a guy - so I don't care if you know my specs - here they are:6' 5" tall310 lbs23" technical torso measurement (back of neck to waist line)21" armpit to waist line54" chest18" pythons (biceps for you skinny hipsters)Usually I buy shirts in 2 XL, 2 XLT, or 3X.Normally I buy shirts with the "tall" designation since my gut sticking out typically makes a "non-tall" shirt rise just to the point of showing skin when I lean back or reach up with my arm(s). No one wants to see that - unless that is your "thing"I went with the 2XLT version of this as a baseline.Results:100% cotton shrinks even if it "preshrunk." Pre-shrunk does not shrink as much, but there is a noticeable shrink none the less.New from package w/ no wash - length was fine - fit was snug, but not too much to show off the moobs or gut too badly.First wash - length still fine - fit was too tight - moobs and gut sticking out like an over packed sausage - not flattering.-You can pull the shirts to stretch it out to be less form fitting, but I don't want to mess with that after every wash.Returned both 2 XLT's and went with a 3X regular length.3X reg length is good enough (unless reaching with arms up as far as I can) - fit is quite loose on the moobs and gut (read comfortable and flattering), but not to tent proportions.Shirt really is heavyweight and I love it. Can't see through it and looks like it will last a while, just like most Dickies items do!Pocket is a touch too tight/small for my Galaxy S5 with case since they seamed in a dedicated pen/pencil pouch inside the total front pocket dimensions. As is, it is good enough to hold a couple pens or something along the size of a deck of cards.Ask your grandma, mother, or wife for a seam ripper to remove the Dickies tag on the front pocket. If they are good with the stitch, ask them to rip out the dedicated pen/pencil pouch and the pocket becomes big enough for a smart phone.I used to buy Fruit of the Loom Men's Short Sleeved Pocket T-Shirt from both the Normal and Best collections since they used to be available locally in a "mart" store. That Wal place doesn't carry the front pocket shirt in my sizes anymore so I found them here on Amazon. FotL changed their material/construction practices with this shirt recently and they are bad quality, even at $5-$8 a pop.  They lasted me about 6 months of 1-2x/week use and one weekly washing before fabric was worn thin and piling badly.  They are now dedicated "I don't care what happens to them work shirts"I am a fan of Dickies items and I would say that these shirts display overall good quality and with some modifications done at home I would highly recommend them.

I want to start our by saying that I am, in general, happy with both the quality of the product and the timeliness of the delivery.I used to buy Champion tee shirts ;with featured a decent weight fabric and a generous cut.  A few years back Champion was bought out by Fruit of the Loom and the fabric got lighter, and the cut got skimpy--now resembling the Fruit of the Loom tee shirts.I then switched to Dickies (regular weight) which I can buy at Walmart.  It featured an even heavier fabric and an even more generous cut than the Champion tees of old.  I am happy with the Dickies standard weight tees.  But Walmart carries them in on black, white and gray only.  I wanted colors.I ordered the Dickies heavy weight. When it arrived I tossed it in the laundry along with a brand new Dickies standard weight.  When they were laundered I handled both and they did not feel much different.  I examined the construction and they appear to be the same quality (excellent).  The heavy weight was made in Nicaragua, and the standard weight was produced in the Honduras.  But both seem of similar assembly quality.I decided to weigh them on my kitchen scale:  Stardard weight (XL) 9.25 ounces; Heavy weight (XL) 9.75 ounces a difference of 1/2 ounce (5.26%).  Hardly a heavy weight.So if you are not interested in colors, I recommend the standard weight; if you want the colors go with the heavy weight.If you want a true heavy weight tee I only know of Duluth Trading whose tees are of a true heavy weight fabric and the cut is generous but the product is expensive.  I find the Dickies to be a much better value.  For tall men, the Dickies are available in a "tall" too.A good product, but not really a heavy weight.

The Dickies Men's Short Sleeve Heavyweight Crew Nick t-shirts are great! We ordered in 6 different colors. I know this might sound crazy but husband and I have been searching for the past 3+ years for t-shirts that would meet the following basic criteria:1. Heavy Weight Cotton2. Will survive going through the washer more than a dozen times.3. Minimal shrinkage after washing/drying4. Not See-Through -- no secondary shirt needed5. Little to no graphics6. Tag-lessThe Dickies t-shirts exceeded our expectations. The t-shirts are the thickness of the cotton that used to be the norm in the 1970's, 1980's and 1990's.  Most t-shirt companies have made the cotton thinner, and thinner and thinner. To the point the men might start wearing man bra's. The Dickies t-shirts do not have obnoxious graphics added (which is also hard to find). The front pock contains a small Dickies logo. Another positive, the inside back neck is "tag-less".We like these t-shirts so much, that I'm tempted to order another dozen or two for upcoming years.

I love these shirts. I now own around 12 in various darker colors. They are great fitting and nicely made. The material is indeed thicker than usual, yet not heavy or stifling in heat. They do have two problems, however: 1) The colors fade, and some of them do so very quickly. Gray seems to hold up best. Green and brown are losing a lot of color saturation with every single wash. 2) These things are oil STAIN MAGNETS. You may not notice anything while wearing them or doing the laundry, but later, it's not uncommon to take a "clean" one off the hanger and notice a few spots, then throw it right into the hamper. None of my other shirts do this, from cheap 100% cotton tees to poly blends.For both of these problems, I'm only knocking off one star because I really do love these shirts otherwise. There must be something that other manufacturers are doing to protect their fabric, but Dickies is not. For now, I'm keeping a bottle of Grandma's Secret GS7001 Laundry Spray, 16-Ounce near the washing machine. I've found it works fairly well. Usually.

I'm 6.2 and 205 and don't like short sleeves crowding into my armpit, so I normally go up a size so that my shoulder seam drops over the side of my upper arm by an inch or so. In this case I took the suggestions about going up a size again due to these running small?So XL normally works and I like the shirt tail to be longer so I want to tuck them in and they will stay put!Based on the reviews here, I ordered the 2XLT, so when these arrive the seam between the upper part of the sleeves and the shoulder rides just over the top of my shoulder, but the sleeve are still a bit short by 3/4 to even a full inch. They had a bit better fit before washing and I don't use a dryer for most of my cloths. Anyway, I'm keeping the shirts, the collar seems to be well made and keep it's shape so that's important as well.Note: Shirts from another order were made in Pakistan and were not stated as being "heavyweight" shirts.they feel about the same (a bit softer maybe) and yet the fitting is better with about 1/2 in more sleeve than ones from this order, which were made Nicaragua? Laying both out seam to seam and the sleeve on the Pakistan was a bit longer than those from Nicaragua, both shirts had been washed twice!IMO - the material that is being used today vs. the past are not going to hold up as well as shirts from late 80's and early 90's which in my case held up well past 20 years or more and many were made in the USA.

If  you are big AND tall, make sure Amazon sends you the correct shirt.  I've ordered several of these Dickies shirts, and about every other order, Amazon sends me 1 or more of the wrong size.  The most common mistake is they send me a "3XL" instead of the "3XLT" I ordered.  If it doesn't have the "T", it isn't a tall shirt!  Check every shirt you order.  I've had orders where some were correct and others were wrong.  I'veeven had two shirts of the same color in the same order where 1 will be a tall and other other won't.  Amazon customer service tells me they are sending in requests for the warehouse to check stock, but I still get the wrong shirts.  The difference between tall and regular is 2-3" and for me makes the difference between being able to tuck the shirt in or not.Overall, I'd give the shirts 4.75 stars.  They seem to be very well constructed.  Based on how thin some other shirts I’ve bought are, these could easily be considered heavy fabric.  The actual thickness of the fabric varies a bit between different colors.  I am both big and tall, so it is unheard for me to find good T's for $8-12/ea.There is a paper label around waist high which you will want to cut off, it rustles. The label on the back of the neck is printed on the shirt, so nothing to rustle or scratch there.Content: Of the shirts I have, content varies by color.100% cotton  - Chocolate, Dark Navy, Dark Olive, English Red, Heather Green, Lincoln Green, Orange, Royal Blue.99% cotton, 1% polyester - Ash Grey90% cotton, 10% polyester  - Heather GreyMade in: Nicaragua and Mexico.There is a slight variation in the cuts of the different colored shirts.  Some are a little roomier than others.  The label recommends washing in cold.  I HIGHLY recommend washing in cold.  The shirts tend to shrink a little the first couple times they are washed.I always wash mine in cold and hang them up to dry, but still had that little bit of shrinkage.  The most comfortable: Dark Navy and Black Olive.  They started out very roomy and even after a bit of shrinkage are still quite comfortable.  Chocolate and Lincoln Green just barely still fit.  Desert Sand started out ok, but after two washings it had shrunk enough that it is a little small.  I find I'm yanking on it to stretch it.Don't take the Amazon listing picture colors too seriously.  I've included a pic of the actual shirts.  Chocolate and Dark Olive appear lighter in my photo than they do in person.

I've been buying these shirts for over 10 years. Work great for use as winter undershirt or summer casual. I wash in warm / regular cycle and warm / regular dry. I buy one size larger than needed because of shrinkage (3xlt shrinks to 2xlt).18.5" neck ... 51" chest ... 6'4" ... 240 Lbs.Pros: (7 shirts rotated on daily basis)* Heavyweight = 6.75 oz. 100% cotton* 2 Yrs. ... Beginning signs of stretching / fraying / color fading* 3 Yrs. ... Time to replaceCons:I really can't think of any.I hope this review helps:)

Possibly the best crew neck T I've owned.  Love the fit. Its comfortable, and the collar doesn't loosen after a day of working in it. There is a WORLD of difference between these and the standard Gildan/Hanes tees available at Walmart or similar stores. I'll never go back to a traditional tee after owning these heavyweight ones. It's also much better than the Pro Club brand, which was highly recommended by a couple guys I work with. I actually wear these out daily while getting groceries or doing other things because I like them so much.

The Dickie's Men's short sleeve shirts are perfect for my husband! Here is a picture of him in the Orange color, which is great for his job. The shirts are heavy weight material and they hold up nicely for a long time.  He is 6'2" and about 195 lbs. He wares size Large. They shrink just a touch on high heat in the dryer and then it's a perfect fit.

I bought this shirt because of it's pocket, high rating, and low price.  I'm dissapointed.  First, if your a big guy, NFL, lumberjack, you'll probably love this shirt.  I'm 5'11, 165 lbs, career military.  This fits me nice in the shoulders and chest, but hangs like a dress around my middle, because there is NO shape or form fitting.  I could live with that.  Wouldn't be the first shirt made for larger people that I have to have tailored to fit me below the chest, but here's the real kicker.  There's something about the design of the sleeves and the weight of the fabric that causes the whole shirt to lift up and bunch around the chest and neck if I lift my arms up shoulder height or higher.  That's definitely something you don't want in a T-Shirt that is supposed to be soft and comfortable.  This cotton is pretty stiff.  Maybe after a few washes it'll be softer, but it seems like a fairly stiff weave.  It certainly doesn't hang/drape like the pictures shown.  Lastly, the pocket, as shown in the picture, wraps around the side of the chest and is largely useless except for keeping a pen in.  It does have a separate little pen spot in the pocket, but the opening is too small to use most modern pens with a rubberized grip.  So, all in all, pretty disappointing for me.

I'm going to start this review by clarifying that I have a lean, narrow foot. I have a C toe and a B heel. So this review is biased towards a narrow foot. That being said, I have tried about twenty different sandals to find a couple that fit reasonably snug. So for comparison purposes this may be a useful guide for people. My preferences are light weight, comfortable, with a heel strike that has some padding. I also like moderate arch support. I don't want a lot of flop in my flip. I don't want a negative heel. I'm going to list the sandals I've tried, and give a brief comparison, which should be helpful to everyone. I'll start with this one:Reef Phantom LE - (Mens 9) This leather sandal is much lighter than most of the others, weighing in at 142g. Somewhat more snug fitting than average. Very comfortable and attractive. Reasonably priced. This pair was a keeper for me.Reef Mens Leather Fanning ll - (9 Mens) These are the heaviest of all the sandals I've tried, weighing in at 219 grams each. The footbed is comfortable but more firm than some of the others. Nice looking. They have an average fit, (fairly snug), but they were a little lose on me. I think these would last a long time. Unlike with the Reef Draftsman, I did not feel the bottle opener under my arch. Comfortable, but expensive and heavy.Reef Leather Slap ll - (Mens 9) Oddly, this sandal was a full size shorter than any other Reefs I tried, (A full 1/2 inch), so order up. They weighed in at 205 grams each, making them the second heaviest in this comparison. Had they been the same size as the Fanning ll's they would have been the heaviest. Average fit. These are one of the most comfortable sandals in this line-up. Very cushy heel.Reef Phantom Prints - (9) Weighing in at 113g, these were the second lightest sandal of the bunch. Snug fitting and comfortable, these are my personal favorites. Reasonably soft heel-strike with an average width footbed and just the right amount of arch support. They won't likely last as long as some of the heavier sandals, but they can be had for half the cost. I've seen them for $20 on up, depending on color and size.Reef Phantoms - (Mens 10) These synthetic sandals seem to be made elsewhere from the other two Phantoms listed above. The fit is much different. They are wider in the footbed and sloppy fitting. These are made for a wide foot. Again, they are fairly light, weighing in at 134g, and I got these a full size up from the other two because everyone said they ran small. I think they run just a half size smaller.Reef Draftsman - (9) This is a leather sandal with no additional heel support. It also has a bottle opener on the bottom. Nice looking, fairly snug fitting, and fairly light, (About 156g) but this sandal has an issue. As others have indicated, you can feel the bottle opener under your arch. I don't think anyone would be comfortable in these for long. I sent these back.Reef Crew - (9) This leather sandal is fairly light at 138g each. They have a slender footbed and a somewhat snug fit. I like that, however, there is no additional heel support and they run as high as $60.Reef Twinpin - (9) These basic synthetic leather sandals are fairly light at 137g each, and they have a slender footbed, but the thong is very lose and has no additional heel-strike.Sanuk Fraid So - (10) These sandals weighed in at a modest 139g each and were really comfortable and attractive. I loved this sandal. Unfortunately, they have a very wide footbed and a very lose fitting thong. Yep, fraid so. But if you have fat feet, you'll love these.Sanuk M Fraid - (9) These leather/poly sandals weighed in at 175g each, making them one of the heavier sandals here. They have a slender footbed, (A full half inch thinner than the Fraid So), but with a sloppy thong.Sanuk Beer Cozy - (9) This fabric sandal has a wide footbed and a sloppy thong, but weighed in at a respectable 134g each. These have a very cushy, comfortable footbed. People rave about how comfortable they are. But you need to have fat or wide feet. Dang!Teva Mush ll - (9) These are by far the lightest of the bunch, weighing in at a mere 92g each. They're also comfortable with a fairly narrow footbed and a snug thong. So, yes, I love these. And at $25 they are a bargain, even though they won't last as long as some of the more expensive sandals here. The middle of the heel-strike is a little harder than the surrounding area and some people have complained about it, but I haven't been bothered by it in the short periods of time I've spent in them.Teva Men's Classic - (9) This is a very basic, uninspired sandal with a ruff, heavily textured, old school footbed. Perfect for some people, but I found them uncomfortable. It's light, but not as light as the Mush ll's. The thong was more loose than the Mush ll and it runs a little more money.Teva Mush ll (Canvas) (9) I listed these as well because the canvas thong fits more loosely than the regular Mush ll's and weighed a little more. Other than that they have the same footbed.

Second pair of reef I bought here and they broke within 2 weeks. It's also smaller than the ones they sell in the stores. I think it's knock offs. The ones I bought at a department store still last me 4 years now

Not sturdy in the least. If you're going to write a review here, I hope you've at least worn these continuously for a few weeks because mine came apart just outside of the 30 day return window.While wading through a creek, the webbing on not one but both flip flops pulled out of the sole. There are no visible tears or broken stitches, so I can only conclude that it was held in the sole by glue that gave out when I tried to lift my foot out of the water. That's just cheap manufacturing. With a little more material, the webbing could've all been sewn together and there would be no risk of it pulling out, but instead the manufacturer went with cheap glue instead.You would expect "Reef" flip flops would be able to survive a little water, but you would be wrong.

So to start off I wore the Reef sandals with the bottle openers on the bottom for a year and I loved them, and they were correctly sized. I got a size ten of these phantom sandals and it was way to small, but I went ahead and returned for an 11, they were also too small and different from the first pair, like different materials used in the strap.Finally ordered a 12 and they actually fit (my size ten feet) but the under part of the straps are cratchy and uncomfortable, and I have medium high arches but the arch bump on these is huge, I was worried i’d roll my ankle again because they made both my feet tilt outward. And they just look ugly, these fit as in my feet will go in them but the back is almost level with my heel while the front sticks out like 2 inches past my toes, pic included of the size 12s
Bought mine 02/17/17. Fell apart 06/02/17. Horrible previously had a pair that lasted 10 years.

okay, the sandals fit, but the strap is WAY tight. I can tell they will break in eventually, and I'll probably wear them in the shower a couple times to help, but wow... they are tight. the first time I tried them on, I was ready to send them back. But I knew if I went a size up, the sandal would be too big and then of course there is a possibility of the strap also being too loose and loosening even more once broken in. So, I figured I would wear them for a day and just wiggle my toes often to keep my feet from falling off. So far so good. I have not lost any toes. They are great sandals, and I got mind for $25, but I would not pay any more than that. I guess if you are reading this, I would recommend trying a size up, especially if you are a half size like I am. I ended up going with a 10 instead of an 11. After a couple days they will be fine, but if you don't want the hassle of breaking them in like I have to, go a size up.

I bought this for my husband and years of wearing out his old Reefs and I LOVE IT!  Yes, me, a woman. Even though I bought it for my husband, I use it every chance I can get to run out and get the mail from the mailbox, or to get something either from the yard or garage.  It is so comfortable. I have dry heels and even wearing these sandals makes it feel comfy. They're not hard or rough like other sandals I've worn, they have the perfect amount of  cushion.  My husband love his sandals too.  After wearing out his old one after years of wearing them, he asked me to find him another pair of Reef sandals!  He rarely asks me to buy the same brand of shoes or sandals AND believe it or not, he's really picky, that's how awesome these sandals are!  He like Reef as much as his Sanuk, if not more. I would definitely recommend these to others who wants a pair of durable comfy sandal.  I'll buy myself a pair once I find myself one at an awesome price like this pair.

I love and have loved Reefs for years......  Capitalism is a weird thing.  These sandals used to be made with RUBBER soles that lasted for MANY MANY YEARS.  When my last pair broke (4+ years of use), I started looking for a replacement.  I was shocked that I had to spend so much time finding a pair of plain old reefs without bottle openers on the sole (gross) for under thirty dollas.  I thought I hit the jackpot when I found these on Amazon.  Much to my surprise, when I started wearing them, I noticed they were manufactured with some hard plastic crap sole that is akin to the garbage found on the bottom of most sneakers these days. Ever look at Nike shoes then and now? See what I mean?  Thank you capitalism for screwing consumers twice over in the name of your shareholders.  I have no problem paying more for quality products, but nowhere in the description does it state the material used for the soles, so I feel like i got hustled and I don't want others to make the same mistake.  After less than a month of wearing them, the proverbial "tread" has worn down to nothing.  Hear that?  It's the sound of my money flushing down the toilet to line the pockets of Reef's parent company shareholders.  bring back the rubber dammit!

The straps on both pulled out within 6 weeks. The first one was in the first two weeks but I didn't think too much about it and glued it back in place with some 5 minute epoxy. The second one pulled out today while I was squatting down to pick something up. I work M-F so this was with mainly weekend and some evening use only.  Highly disappointed in the quality. As a Floridian, I've owned several pairs of Reefs in the past and they just don't make them like they used to.

I have been wear flip flops all my life. I've worn Quicksilver, Tevas, Sanuk, Crocs and dirt cheap flip flops. I wear flip flops everywhere that its now sad. The Reefs Phantoms I or II have always been my favorite. Tevas would be my second choose. I don't like Crocs style and Sanuk are not bad, I just did care for them all that well. Quicksilver was narrow, soles worn out to fast and slipped a lot until finally broke. I now buy reef flip flops exclusively every year regardless if there still good. The one short coming with these flip flops is the straps are tight at first. Its always been like this for me and reefs. I have to use two hands to put them on again at first. I've worn these reefs the last 4 weeks straight and it took about 5 days to loosen up. Now that they are worn in a tad, there perfect again. I have a hard time with finding flip flops or shoes because of wide EE size 13 foot. These are wide enough and fit great. They track well with the heel as well.I don't want to give a 4 star because of the tight strap because, I believe its needed to wear in so they don't feel sloppy as they wear,  like all the over flip flop companies do. Reefs for Life!!!!

The quality and fit if the shirt it's self is great. However the screen print was crooked. Enough that I noticed as soon as I opened the package. The saturation of the screen print ink was perfect and aside from the cockeyed graphic (maybe it was just a fluke?) I was very happy with this product. If print was straight, I would have rated 5 stars. I submitted photos and I put a a straight edge of a white piece of paper that was lined up with the bottom of the shirt to demonstrate the angle of the screen printing.

This shirt is so cute and hilarious. I got it for my husband who loves mob movies and is a new grandfather. The print is perfect—just as advertised but I have a major issue with the fit of the short. I ordered an XL as that’s what he wears. The shirt is wide enough but is way to short. It’s weird. I’ve never seen an XL this short. I’m not sure if that’s the case with all their shirts or not.

Bought this for my father when I found out I was pregnant it was his gift for his birthday. It has become his favorite shirt wears it proud when we go out with the babies. The material is nice and thick and the color was black not faded not an odd shade of black just perfect.

Got this for my grandpa, who's Italian and loved the movies.  He was super excited, took pictures and sent it to his friends.  It was a nice breathable material and the print itself wasn't faded or blotchy.
I love this shirt. It cracks me up. Bought it for my dad. He loves it, too. He's 6'4" and thin, but wears XL in order for it to fit lengthwise. It fits like any other XL shirt I've ever gotten him.

My son is going to be a grandfather for the first time and is so excited.  He loved it!!  (I can't find the picture to upload :( He had a big grin on his face.  It fits perfectly and is a good quality shirt.  Not expensive and he loves the Godfather movies too.

Updated!!  He is a big fan of the movie and loves it as is!!  It's a pretty shirt and the black cotton fabric seems nice and soft.  However the white printing is very light.  Due to the uneven print, it looks like if it is washed more than a couple times the printing will crack.

I purchased this as a Fathers Day gift for my father who celebrated his first Father’s Day as a grandfather. He initially thought it was just a godfather T-shirt which he was excited about but when he opened the package you could see his heart melting when he saw the grandfather. Great buy!!T-shirt is well made and the text is well constructed onto shirt I had no problems with my order

My husband is a huge fan of the movie, The Godfather. So as a grandfather, this was the perfect gift. The fit was exactly as expected. I might have gone one size larger in case of shrinkage.  However, he loved it.

I guess I expected the design of the shirt to be better quality than what it is. It looks like the machine to press the words/image on ran out of ink. I don't know that it'll hold up after a couple washes.

HALLELUJAH!I have been searching for years for a form fitting plain t-shirt, and I think I've found it. I have read hundreds of reviews where no one bothers putting their measurements, which I find absolutely useless for anyone else, so hopefully my review helps some of you. I was skeptical at first, just like every other time I've purchased a cheap t-shirt online (too short, too slim, too blocky, too wide, uncomfortable material), but I was pleasantly surprised when I tried this shirt on.I am 6'4", 215-225 lbs and fit, so length and slimness is important to me. I bought an XL, and the length is incredible (if maybe not slightly long for some, but probably perfect after a wash). Not too often you get an XL with a cheap shirt and they keep it slim fitting rather than extending the width 15 inches assuming you're only going up a size because you're 300lbs. It fits the shoulders great. The XL extends to the ends of my shoulders ALMOST perfectly (sorry, don't have exact measurements to help here). As for the sleeves, another bonus! We all have hatred for flared sleeves and they feel like they're inevitable in cheap t-shirts. I have around 15" cold biceps for reference and they hug the biceps all the way through without being too tight. They extend not too far past the halfway point in the bicep which I prefer (picture is accurate). Lastly, the material is very comfortable. The pictures were a bit deceiving when I was trying to guess how the material would feel but I can say my expectations were surpassed.Hopefully this helps out fellow brothers my size. I know this is the type of review I would try to scour for before purchasing, but with little success.

****************IT'S BEEN A YEAR!**I've been blessed to basically live in these shirts for over a year now. I've never had a relationship like this with a t shirt... i now know for sure that it is love. My baby is 15 months old and I've managed to lose 15 lbs, so the shirts were getting a little loose. I'm cheap. And I'm resourceful. I took in an inch on the sides of these suckers and they're as good as new(ish).*****************My husband fell in love with this brand after he wore one from a local gym. He took note of the brand and then started searching the internet for it. Luckily he found it on Amazon. He knew to go up a size so it would fit better. He bought one, and then two more. And then three more. They are really soft and are a good fit (remember to go up a size).Another thing he really likes about it is that they are long enough (but not crazy long) to cover his concealed carry when he carries on his belt. He also likes the sleeve length, because as he proudly puts it, "they show off my biceps"This is a little embarrassing, but I started liking his shirts... so I made him buy me one. And now I think I have four. No, I have five. They are just really comfortable. It's not like I'm dressing up for my toddlers, so I wear them all the time. And to Wal-Mart. Because they're actually one of the nicest plain t-shirts I've ever worn. Comfortable enough to wear to bed as well. And, yeah, I'll just say it, not all t-shirts are great for breastfeeding with, but these are great. They aren't stiff; they have enough give, but also keep their shape.These are our favorite t-shirts and we'll probably keep ordering them and end up wearing them as senior citizens, and possibly request to be buried in them because, hey, they're really comfortable.

The perfect fit, the perfect fabric, the perfect selection. We got them in every color and we don't regret it. If you've got a long torso and a particular need for softness, this is the shirt for you. The neon green/yellow is great for public events with a crowd.

I'm 5'7", have a muscular build, weigh about 168lbs. This shirt is very soft and it didn't overtly shrink in the wash/dryer. It's a great fit. I plan to buy more now that I know the cut is nice. The sleeves aren't too long and there's plenty of room in the chest and lat areas so you don't feel constricted but it's still form fitting. Awesome shirts.

As other reviewers mentioned, absolutely wonderful t-shirts.  No logos, no BS, super comfy, stylish.  I'm 6'2, 270lbs, I work out but not crazy.  I bought the 3XL size.  I bought one, got it, tried it on, and went back immediately and bought 10 more in different colors.I wear them all the time, casual with jeans, dress up with slacks, although I find their colors don't really suit active wear.  I mean, they are comfortable but look a bit out of place for active wear.  Maybe because they are just plain shirts, no logos or anything, and active wear I guess is suppose to be moving billboards...but yes, I wear them at the gym because I really don't care and they are just so super soft comfy.

I bought seven of these in different colors.  They are really soft and fit very well.  I bought the XL for my 42 inch chest and they fit nicely. My only complaint if you can call it that is that the colors could be more vibrant.  Don't misunderstand they are quite similar to the colors shown but could be as I said more vivid.  Very good value for the money.  The seams are well stitched with double rows, the sleeves come down about three quarters of the way down my bicep and don't ride up.  I'm reviewing all seven that I purchased in this one review.

One of the best fitting t-shirts ever worn, this is without a wash, hopefully it doesn't shrink. I'm 5'11", 175 lbs and a large fits well, but maybe just a tad too long. The sleeve length and tightness is spot on and the body section tapers down toward the waist. If you like the original plain volcom t-shirts you'll probably also like this fit and material, they are both about the same weight only $10 cheaper. If you have a thin triangular torso shape, and have a hard time finding shirts to fit because most U.S. shirts are designed to fit people over weight, then this shirt is for you. Not too tight, not too loose, just about perfect.

I am confused by the abundance of reviewers stating this shirt is "dress like" in length. It is a great fit in my opinion, perfect.  I am thinking maybe those who are saying it is too long or guys that are really short.  I am 6'1, 180 and the M is very well fitted on me. The length sits on the upper half of my glutes and when I raise my arms in the air, it sits perfectly at the waist line without exposing skin.  I think these fit the more brodly shaped should guy.  The arm sleeve seam sits in perfect position and the sleeve splits my bicep perfectly in two allowing the meat of the tri and bi to show.  I will be purchasing more colors.  Def a nice shirt for CC

For reference: 37" chest, 6'0" tall, 30" waist, 145lbIf you have similar dimensions then your long search for a decent fitting shirt is over. Plus, these are way more comfortable than 100% cotton and air dry much faster. This shirt now make up 80% of the shirts in my closet. Can't believe these beautiful things are only $5.Make sure to double check each shirt when you get them. One of my shirts was ripped along the neck-line, but could be hand-sow back on. Another, clearly defective, shirt had extremely wide armholes. That one will just be used in future craft projects.Other reviewers have pointed out that white is abnormally light and allows more light to pass through than the other shirts. They are correct. Nonetheless, it has been solid enough for my preferences. Not sure how much that would change after a run through a heated dryer.

I'm 49, 5'11", 168lbs, with a medium/muscular "fit" build, and wear the Large.  These fit me perfectly, snug in the chest & sleeves (hugs the arm with no flaring) and yet long enough to go below the belt-line, right at about the zipper on my jeans.  If you've got a belly on you, or you work out so much you look like a body-builder go a size up.  Fabric is wonderfully soft and stretchy, and washes well with only light shrinkage.  Colors hold well.  I purchased 7 of these and wear them every day as my go-to shirts.

My Dad has ALS and has little time left.. He is always very unhappy, This shirt helped me bring a smile to his face! Even if for a moment, Your product gave my Dad happiness for a moment! Thank you very much and god bless you!
Great fit! My husband is and average  6'3 and I got a 2xl and it fit well. He enjoyed his shirt and wears it quite often! Lol

While the t-shirt is cute, I was extremely disappointed when my husband took it out of the bag today and realized that it is so crocked... not just a little bit but a very noticeable amount.  I think a ruler or something could have been used... or when they put the shirts under the press that puts on the design, ensure that the shirt is straight.

Fit as expected, needs to be washed before wearing, smells like factory. Still 5 stars because you should rinse your new clothes before wearing them.  After wash the words were still intact. Would buy again

This is what I expected.  It was a father's day gift and he loved it!  This shirt was a softer than I expected.  It also fit like a medium should.  I have washed it a few times and haven't seen any sign of wear yet.

Awesome product but what won me was the nice detail of including a "Best Dad" award certificate!! I bought this item for Father's Day and was neat to find a littl something extra to include with my gift!!! Thank you!!

This is a great shirt, I would defintaly buy it again , its going to be a fathers day shirt so its perfect, great material and coustomer service is amazing , this is defintaly going to be perfect for the person we got it for , it came on time I would defintaly recommend this to anyone whos looking into one of these kinds of shirts ...awesome value and awesome shirt :) thank you for such an amazing product :)
Love the shirt, bought the shirt for Father's Day from the kids...they loved it, the husband not so much.  ha ha ha.  He does wear it and states it's comfortable.

I bought this for my husband and he loved it! I bought a large, which is what he normally wears, and it fit like it should. The material is soft and comfortable. He also liked the certificate that came with the shirt as well. This is a very cute father's day gift!
This was what I gave my husband on his last Father's day. He loved it! He laughed so hard. I will never throw it away. :)

Say you were at a high school football game. Say you were sitting on the top of the bleachers. Say some old lady kicked your purse and your phone was on top. Say your phone skated in slo-mo into the gap in between the seats and walkway. Say you watched it careen the 15 feet or so to the ground below, into the dirt, under the bleachers. Say you looked at her and you knew she knew and she didn’t even say sorry. Say you found a custodial guy eating a burger with a *LOT* of mustard. Say you complimented him on his hunk of keys and told him the tale. Say he unlocked a creepy gate under the bleachers and found your phone in THIS OTTERBOX and it was perfectly fine. This is what happened to me. Wish it were cuter? Say you put on a jungle PopSocket with pink flamingoes. I will NEVER get another case. Only me and the OTTERBOX.

I purchased this case for an iPhone 8 Plus. The first case Amazon sent lifts in the center causing a gap between the screen and the phone. I called OtterBox and filed a complaint. They said exchange the case with Amazon cause it's been less than 30 days. Amazon quickly sent me a second case. The second case had the exact same problem suggesting the new iPhone 8 Plus Defender Case may have quality control problems. Take a look at the photo I included with this review. The point where the plastic is connected to the case is lower on the bottom and the top then it is in the middle. The video shows the same anomaly - pressing on the screen causes the case to bend resulting in missed keypresses and harder contact. I am a huge fan of OtterBox Defender cases and my previous iPhone 6 case does NOT have this defect.UPDATED 9/26/17 - Per OtterBox's response to my review, I called Customer Service for a replacement case. A representative named Ariel took my call, looked up my incident number, and offered to help. I explained the issue with the case and OtterBox's response to my review. Ariel apologized for the defect and placed me on hold to speak with a Supervisor. Upon return, Ariel offered to complete a Warranty exchange for a new case to be sent out. I said that sounds good until Ariel asked me to pay $4.99 for Shipping and Handling. I said, let me get this straight, I ordered a new case through Amazon and it arrived defective. I replaced the case through Amazon and the second one is also defective. OtterBox invited me to call Customer Service for a replacement case and now I need to pay an additional $4.99 to have a working case sent to me by OtterBox. Clearly, OtterBox has given up on Quality Control AND on Customer Service.DO NOT BUY THIS CASE UNTIL OTTERBOX PROVIDES A SATISFACTORY RESPONSE!!!!UPDATED 10/5/17 - The replacement case finally arrived via FedEx SmartPost. The screen protector is perfectly attached to the side of the shell and there doesn't appear to be any gap between the screen and the phone. This suggests the first release of iPhone 8+ cases likely had a manufacturing defect which was corrected in stock sent to OtterBox. Check your case for screen protector alignment issues before the Amazon return policy expires and if you do need to go through OtterBox for a warranty exchange, expect to pay for shipping and handling.

If you want ultimate protection, this is the case for you. But if want a case to show how slim your new iPhone is, look elsewhere. To give you an idea on the thickness, on the back around the Apple logo and camera is about a quarter inch of protection. Again, great case, small hands beware.

I’ve used OtterBox in the past and sometimes felt it was beyond the protection I needed.  The cases have always been made sturdy, easy to put together, and built to last.  The OtterBox remains one of the leading brands for phone case protection and I feel the brand continues to improve the case design that aligns with phone innovations.Usually, I don’t gravitate towards colorful cases but the rosemarine/plum haze color is fun and not overbearing.  I also enjoy the color combination with my rose gold iPhone 7 Plus and feel that it compliments it.  The case comes in 3 pieces and is easy to put together.  The inner layer consists of two hard plastic pieces that snap around the case, one side includes the screen protector.  The outer shell is a rubbery flexible material that covers the area where the inner pieces connect and add extra protection.I’m very impressed with the screen protection with this Otterbox.  In my opinion, the screen protector feels better than using the solo film screen protectors.  Not better than glass, but I have the luck of breaking glass ones after a couple of days.  The screen protector also doesn’t have the annoying bubbles and doesn’t cling to a speck of dust.  The only parts of the phone that are consistently exposed are the speakers and the cameras.  The buttons are covered and are fully functional without difficulty.  The lightning port and the switch to set your iPhone 7 Plus to silent are covered with the rubber but you can open them.The only downfall I used to have with the Otterbox was the size.  Now that the iPhone 7 Plus is much slimmer I feel the case is a better fit.  I can’t use the Otterbox with my lightning dock but not many cases on my phone allow me to use it anyway.Overall, the Otterbox Defender for the iPhone 7 Plus is an excellent choice for people with an active lifestyle or professions that put your phone at risk for damage.  The Otterbox is one of those cases that if I were to drop my phone I wouldn’t gasp and cringe in fear because I know it’s thoroughly protected.

I had just bought a new iPhone 7 Plus and I wanted a good case for protective purposes. In the past there had always been occasions when somehow, no matter how careful I was, I managed to drop my cellular phones. In addition, not only did I drop it, but I somehow always managed to drop it onto either a concrete or asphalt surface. At least 2 cell phones I had broken that way, so I was looking for a case that featured "protection" as the primary functionality feature of the case I bought. This time, I decided I was not going to make the same mistake again. Thus, I did a search for highly protective iPhone 7 plus compatible cases.Amazon has a huge collection of cases, even ones that are protective. Some even use special military grade plastics. Yet I wanted one that would allow easy access to all the features of my cell phone. This one achieves those objectives, without creating any barriers to access of all my new phone's features. Thus, I chose this one which did everything on my list of requirements.The best results and comments I can make about this "Otterbox Defender Series Case" is the following:  1). Installation is trivial and simple  2). Access to every feature and button is easy  3)  AND, the case is very PROTECTIVE!!!How do I know? Because within 48 hours of my installation I was getting out of my car, when I dropped it on the cement parking lot. So, I said to myself, "Well, that is why I bought this one, so let's see if it is still working.And, Voila, every single function and button still worked. Nothing was damaged, and it greeted me immediately with perfect functionality! In addition, since that time I have dropped the phone 3 more times. Once on my hardwood floor, once on my asphalt parking lot driveway and once again on the concrete slab of my garage and every time it worked perfectly.Note please that all the drops were from an altitude of approximately waist high, therefore about 3 to 4 feet from impact. I decided that in every respect, this Otterbox Defender Series case was a perfect selection for meeting all my criteria. However, I would not attempt to find the limits of its protection. Thus, I do not recommend high altitude drops or throwing the phone and case to the concrete, but for normal use, including accidental drops this product fits the bill in every respect (I did not test for water) and thus I was totally satisfied and gave this product a well earned 5 Star rating. If good accidental drop protection is what you need, then I strongly recommend this product!

The case goes on and comes off easy, dropped more than once on pavement(butterfingers) phone protected. Only two things I dont like about it are the plastic screen protector that it comes with already attached, terrible, zero protection from anything but dust, Last couple of these for other phones I just took the plastic off and the glue that attaches it and got the glass screen protector that I know offers real protection from minor impacts. The second thing is not a big deal but I figured  I’d mention it, the case does increase the size of the already big phone slightly, the otterbox commuter case is thinner but I like the all rubber exterior of this one over the mostly hard plastic case of the commuter whch I also owned, the all rubber just makes the grip much more secure in your hand. Both cases offer superior protection in my opinion.

What the hell is the point of getting a NEW defender case when it comes completely smeared?! This will be the second one I’ve purchased the first one was fine this one looks like it fell out at the warehouse and dirty fingerprints are all over it.

UPDATE- Very disappointed in otter box quality of this case. I may have received a weak and defective product. The white plastic part of the case has snapped inside the soft cover. People use these cases on construction sites with no problems. I go to school, work, and home. There should be no reason why my case has broken after 2 months of me having it. The rest of the case is in perfect condidtion. Also another downside to this open part at the top of the phone is I have to open the case to clean lint and debris from the screen every couple of weeks. That whole also lets water through so if I forget to flip the phone over while I’m at the sink I have to clean water out of the case(which is how I found this break)Very pretty medium dark teal with white shell looks great on my black phone. Fit is sleek at a little under a dimes width for thickness. Durability fantastic obviously otter box is know for being one of the best for protection. The dad clip I’ll admit I use. It helps my small hands hold onto this huge phone kind of like a popsocket would. The clip is also the perfect size to fit in my car door cup holder so I can use my phone for gps. Case does not obstruct the sound quality. Dislikes- although the screen protector does protect my screen from scratches it doesn’t not stop debris from getting in the case. I did not want to have a built in screen protector. I wanted tempered glass but every case with this level of fall protection has a built in protector. I also don’t like the fact that it doesn’t have the apple logo centered in the circle in the back.I am afraid that this rubber part will start to warp and loosen. Will update with progress of that aspect.

I have been a otter box fan/ user since they came out, all my cells have had them. I just upgraded my phone and i got my case in the mail. I have never experienced almost having to slam my finger down on my screen to be able to text or unlock it. the screen cover has made it almost impossible to use my phone without slamming the screen. I am so disappointed right now with this case.

This is a great case, but you have to remove the built-in screen protector. The gap between the protector and your phone’s glass is insane — you have to press so much harder just to initiate a tap on your phone. AND it’s loud!
