It sounds like you’re tap dancing when you text someone.Solution: Remove the built-in protector. Grab a knife and start cutting it out, get rid of it, and apply one of those adhesive high-impact glass screen protectors before you put the case on. Much better.

I am a woman that usually takes an 8 to an 8.5 sized shoe. I read mixed reviews, some saying these fit as expected while others said they were a little small. I looked up the Nike Men's shoe size chart and measured my feet. I saw that a 6.5 would fit perfectly. Based on reviews and my experience with Nike products (typically are made half a size smaller than my normal size) I decided to order a size 7. That way, if the sandal was a little small for my "expected" size, a size 7 should fit just fine. When I tried these on, I was right. The size 7 was a perfect fit!The straps have nice padding in them and the bottoms of the sandals themselves are very comfortable. You can tell they are made nicely and should last quite a few summers!On bear feet I have a good half an inch of room left at the tops with maybe a quarter of an inch of space on the backs of my feet. The sandals also fit well with regular socks and thick socks.I highly reccomend! I think for the price they are a good value. They will last you a while. I just would highly suggest basing your size off of your history with Nike products as I do find their shoes are made a little smaller than other companies.Also remember, if you are female, order 1.5 to 2 inches smaller than your regular shoe size. I usually wear a size 8.5 and since my size 8 Nikes  fit well but are snug, I decided on a size 7.Hope this helps!

Though these sandals are for men, I'm a female & I purchased these for myself. I normally wear sizes 8-9 (sometimes 10).These sandals are thin & narrow. They run small & the strap feels snug. I tried sizes 8, 9, & 10. Size 10 was the only size that fit comfortably with & without socks, while 8 was way too small; & 9 only fit well without socks.They came in perfect conditions, & are well constructed. The strap is padded which makes it comfortable to wear. The sole is hard, but not uncomfortable to walk in. The Nike logo is a glossy finish. & if the white ever gets discolored or dirty, using clorox or baking soda with a toothbrush will clean it right up.Overall, I like these sandals & so does my mom (whom I gave the size 8 to. & I returned the 9).
Bought those 6 weeks ago and the synthetic leather strap separated already. Looks like sewed on, but is cheap made in China glue. $25 down the drain
Ordered the black/red but received ones with a maroonish/brown sole and orangish letters... Disappointed since it did not match the product description and images, as advertised.

The strap fit for the first day. Then it stretched. That probably would have killed a couple stars, but what really does it for me is the molded base. It's too firm to mold to my foot and too flat. I don't have high arches, but in normal use, the heel slides to the inside of my foot, and I end up walking on the outside of it. Because the strap is loose, I have to constantly kick the toe of the slide up, and in a week, they're already showing signs of a lot of wear. I've worn them maybe a dozen times, probably 12 hours in total.

Very good quality sandals, that's clear. One of the best ones in terms of durability and finishing. That said, on bigger sizes like 12, it becomes too narrow on the width, I had to try to stretch it out which will compromise the structure in order to use this regularly. My friend have the same one size 9 and I got size 12 and I can see that both of them have exact the same width.But still, very good sandals!
They came faster than expected and fit really snug. I got a size bigger (7) but I'm sure the (6) would have fit perfectly fine.

I had been wearing the adidas slides that have the elevated bumps for massaging your feet for a few years now and figured I should get a pair of slides without the pricks on it and came across these on amazon! I'm a size 9 in women's (which i believe is a size 7 in mens) but I've read the other reviews saying you should size up to wear comfortably so I ordered a size 8 and it fits very nicely! Not tight at all even with socks on :) I thoroughly enjoy these shoes and have been wearing them for almost a month now! Initially they did feel tight and it surprised me but they do kind of stretch a bit over time, nothing too crazy, just to a comfy amount. Love em !

My husband owned an old pair that he purchased from a sporting store. After 2+ years of use they literally split in half (the funniest thing I've ever seen), but he was refusing to let them go. He duct taped them everyday 😂. I finally thought to myself, if hes not going to buy himself a new pair then I will! I was surprised to see them come in an actual nike box. I was so excited to gift him these since they were well needed 😂. Great quality as well. Excellent experience.

Did not get what was pictured on my order however it did say black/white... but they just don't fit I got them for my son which we pretty much have the same size foot. he was complaining about them being too small so I tried them on and they are so tight and uncomfortable bc of the size issue everyone else is complaining about. I can see that they may be a good shoe but the sizing is all wrong and I'm disappointed with the fact that the image I purchase doesn't at all match the show I received.
These fit well and were very comfortable..unfortunately i only got about 4 wears out of them before they split at the seams...glad i was home
Silver is a very light khaki. Fit like your dad’s shorts from 1993. The come up past my belly button and are very baggy in the leg. I look crazy.

I was originally hesitant to buy these shorts because the model looked a bit dorky (maybe it was just the shorts and the shirt tucked in... I just felt that vibe) and the price was super low. Don't let that keep you from buying these shorts! They are not only exceedingly well made but they are the perfect length (above the knee). At a price of 15 dollars you won't find any other shorts that come close to these. I really love how Amazon has democratized good looking clothing!

I've got a pair of dockers that are a 36 inch waist.  I've put on a little weight but the 36in waist still fits, just a bit snug.  Given that, I thought I'd order a 38 in these shorts and they'd be a nice solid fit.  Instead, they are nowhere near buttoning.  Basically, a 36 in a Dockers is the same as a 32 in Amazon.  How is it possible that they are so bad at measuring?  In any case, order at least 1-2 sizes above what you need on these horrible shorts.
I read some of the good reviews and some of the negative reviews my review is five stars quality flat front shorts for $15 that fit perfectly so perfectly I ordered twice

I bought this for my grandson for school. They run true to size. Great quality!  I was leary about getting Amazon brand because he is 15 and thinks everything has to be name brand. He loves these shorts. Will definitely get these again. This is why I always shop Amazon first!

The shorts are excellent quality for the price, they fit right above my knees which is exactly as the picture. I'm 5'9 175 size 32 and it fits just perfect, the only drawback is the color of the khaki is not strong but at 15 dollars, i cant complain.

I've got name brand shorts with a whale logo that cost six times as much as these. Honestly, I'm not sure I could tell the difference if I could figure out a way to construct a "blind" test. The Amazon Essential shorts look and feel great. The fabric is a nice medium weight with a soft feel. Overall, I am very satisfied!

Incredibly poor quality.  The button of these shorts came off the first time I wore them (they were not tight) while I was walking around a crowded city. Was very embarrassing and I expect more from Amazon.  You really get what you pay for with these shorts

Good quality for the price. I found them to be a little longer than I expected. I think that's because I'm used to shorts that sit lower. These are right at my true waist and then some, leading to a bit of extra length through the seat and crotch. I just rolled the ends of the shorts up once and now they look more stylish and fit pretty much as I expected. If they could do anything I'd ask for a 28" waist version. That would probably be spot on for me.

Highly recommend this product, purchased this for my wife 2 weeks ago along with the iPhone X. Also had a tempered glass screen protector on it...anyways, I dropped her off at the front door of the house today and after she closed the door she accidentally dropped the phone and it of course landed under the back tire of the car. Unknowingly I proceeded to drive to park and run over it! Thankfully it was perfectly fine! The screen protector however didn’t get so lucky. I’m extremely pleased with the performance of this case! Recommend to everyone! -Rebeca’s husband

Doesn't fit properly on my iPhone Xs. The rubber buckles around the buttons. It is real loose the volume and on and off button. This case does not fit properly, the edges are exposed and flimsy. I’d be worried if I drop it. This is not for iPhone Xs. I am hugely disappointed. Openings at the bottom for mike is bigger than required (looks like they sent the cover for iPhone Xs). Camera and apple logo on the back of the phone do not properly fit at the center of the openings.  This is a huge disappointment since its a costly cover then it should fit in the iPhone Xs.

This case is great! Sleek but feels protective. It has a "lip" that goes over the phone screen so if you drop it, the case hits the ground first and not the screen. I had no issues with it not fitting as previous reviewers mentioned, this one fits perfectly over the X with no bulges or button alignment issues.I've used the Commuter Otterbox for every previous iPhone I owned and they were always great, so I hope this one continues to work just as well!

I bought this case because I had the same one for my iPhone 6s and it worked with a new baby so well. My baby would throw it and drop it all the time and nothing ever happened. For years I didn’t have one crack.  I got the new iphone XS two weeks ago and just a few days into using this case the screen is cracked. You can tell that this case isn’t as good as the older version of the same model because it doesn’t come up as high around the sides of the screen so it can’t provide as much protection. I’m not sure why otter box changed their design for the commuter but I am returning this and paying to get my screen fixed :(((((

Pros• Slim but provides the perfect protection to your iPhone X.• Two layers case.• Hole in the back for the ones who like to show off the Apple logo.• Feels good in your hands with a great grip.• Even if your phone has a tempered glass, thanks to its raised beveled edge, it will keep the screen safe if the phone fell on a flat surface.• Provides great protection to your back camera thanks to the raised beveled edge.• The buttons are very responsive.• Protects your lighting port against dust and debris, thanks to a nice cap.• Wireless charger friendly, I am using a Choetech.Cons• Might slip on some hard surface.

Overview: This case has protected my iPhone X from numerous drops.Pros:  I'm not an overtly clumsy person.  But for some reason I feel like I need to drop my $1,000 phone onto the ground from waist to chest height.  Not a single scratch has appeared from the numerous drops.Cons:  The reason I keep dropping my phone is the hard outer shell is super slick.  Imagine dipping your hands into olive oil and then picking up your phone.  That is how slick this case is.  There is no texture to the outer shell.  You will accidentally drop your phone with this case...numerous times.  The good news is, it is awesome at protecting the phone from the inevitable drops.

I do not believe this is a legit Otterbox, or the quality of Otterbox has changed. With all my previous Otterbox cases the two part system has worked really well and both layers feel of quality. This case has a cheap rubber that is not flexible as they have been before and and doesn’t fit like a glove. The plastic is lacking the support to keep the rubber tightly against the phone especially on the top half of the phone.

I bought the symmetry case clear and it was scratched up in a week. This case has more protection and is just as slim! Weighs more yes, but it’s worth it. 1,000 dollar phone deserves this case. Don’t be cheap!  Plus you get the opening in the back for the Apple LogoWorks with WIRELESS CHARGING TOO

I got this for my new iPhone Xs as I loved the Commuter case on my previous iPhone 7.  Overall I did not feel like this case fit the phone well. Not sure if this is an issue with the Xs or just the overall design of the case.  The rubber portion felt loose and spongy, especially around the side button and camera while the outer plastic piece felt like it was too small and never felt completely secure over the rubber.  Things just didn't line up or look tidy.I just ordered and received the Otterbox Symmetry Case which feels perfect on my phone.  Seems like a much more secure fit and doesn't seem to sacrifice anything on protection.  Love Otterbox and their products, but the Commuter on the iPhone Xs is a "miss" for me

I was really excited to get this case but disappointed when I got it. I have always had a Defender case and this doesn’t feel as safe as I’m used to. There is only rubber on the inside and slightly on the edges so I doesn’t grip that well when holding or using on the side. Also there is no clear protector for the circle in the back which is what made me decide to return it. Great case for someone who is careful with their phone just not someone who wants to feel protected.

Say you were at a high school football game. Say you were sitting on the top of the bleachers. Say some old lady kicked your purse and your phone was on top. Say your phone skated in slo-mo into the gap in between the seats and walkway. Say you watched it careen the 15 feet or so to the ground below, into the dirt, under the bleachers. Say you looked at her and you knew she knew and she didn’t even say sorry. Say you found a custodial guy eating a burger with a *LOT* of mustard. Say you complimented him on his hunk of keys and told him the tale. Say he unlocked a creepy gate under the bleachers and found your phone in THIS OTTERBOX and it was perfectly fine. This is what happened to me. Wish it were cuter? Say you put on a jungle PopSocket with pink flamingoes. I will NEVER get another case. Only me and the OTTERBOX.

I purchased this case for an iPhone 8 Plus. The first case Amazon sent lifts in the center causing a gap between the screen and the phone. I called OtterBox and filed a complaint. They said exchange the case with Amazon cause it's been less than 30 days. Amazon quickly sent me a second case. The second case had the exact same problem suggesting the new iPhone 8 Plus Defender Case may have quality control problems. Take a look at the photo I included with this review. The point where the plastic is connected to the case is lower on the bottom and the top then it is in the middle. The video shows the same anomaly - pressing on the screen causes the case to bend resulting in missed keypresses and harder contact. I am a huge fan of OtterBox Defender cases and my previous iPhone 6 case does NOT have this defect.UPDATED 9/26/17 - Per OtterBox's response to my review, I called Customer Service for a replacement case. A representative named Ariel took my call, looked up my incident number, and offered to help. I explained the issue with the case and OtterBox's response to my review. Ariel apologized for the defect and placed me on hold to speak with a Supervisor. Upon return, Ariel offered to complete a Warranty exchange for a new case to be sent out. I said that sounds good until Ariel asked me to pay $4.99 for Shipping and Handling. I said, let me get this straight, I ordered a new case through Amazon and it arrived defective. I replaced the case through Amazon and the second one is also defective. OtterBox invited me to call Customer Service for a replacement case and now I need to pay an additional $4.99 to have a working case sent to me by OtterBox. Clearly, OtterBox has given up on Quality Control AND on Customer Service.DO NOT BUY THIS CASE UNTIL OTTERBOX PROVIDES A SATISFACTORY RESPONSE!!!!UPDATED 10/5/17 - The replacement case finally arrived via FedEx SmartPost. The screen protector is perfectly attached to the side of the shell and there doesn't appear to be any gap between the screen and the phone. This suggests the first release of iPhone 8+ cases likely had a manufacturing defect which was corrected in stock sent to OtterBox. Check your case for screen protector alignment issues before the Amazon return policy expires and if you do need to go through OtterBox for a warranty exchange, expect to pay for shipping and handling.

If you want ultimate protection, this is the case for you. But if want a case to show how slim your new iPhone is, look elsewhere. To give you an idea on the thickness, on the back around the Apple logo and camera is about a quarter inch of protection. Again, great case, small hands beware.

I’ve used OtterBox in the past and sometimes felt it was beyond the protection I needed.  The cases have always been made sturdy, easy to put together, and built to last.  The OtterBox remains one of the leading brands for phone case protection and I feel the brand continues to improve the case design that aligns with phone innovations.Usually, I don’t gravitate towards colorful cases but the rosemarine/plum haze color is fun and not overbearing.  I also enjoy the color combination with my rose gold iPhone 7 Plus and feel that it compliments it.  The case comes in 3 pieces and is easy to put together.  The inner layer consists of two hard plastic pieces that snap around the case, one side includes the screen protector.  The outer shell is a rubbery flexible material that covers the area where the inner pieces connect and add extra protection.I’m very impressed with the screen protection with this Otterbox.  In my opinion, the screen protector feels better than using the solo film screen protectors.  Not better than glass, but I have the luck of breaking glass ones after a couple of days.  The screen protector also doesn’t have the annoying bubbles and doesn’t cling to a speck of dust.  The only parts of the phone that are consistently exposed are the speakers and the cameras.  The buttons are covered and are fully functional without difficulty.  The lightning port and the switch to set your iPhone 7 Plus to silent are covered with the rubber but you can open them.The only downfall I used to have with the Otterbox was the size.  Now that the iPhone 7 Plus is much slimmer I feel the case is a better fit.  I can’t use the Otterbox with my lightning dock but not many cases on my phone allow me to use it anyway.Overall, the Otterbox Defender for the iPhone 7 Plus is an excellent choice for people with an active lifestyle or professions that put your phone at risk for damage.  The Otterbox is one of those cases that if I were to drop my phone I wouldn’t gasp and cringe in fear because I know it’s thoroughly protected.

I had just bought a new iPhone 7 Plus and I wanted a good case for protective purposes. In the past there had always been occasions when somehow, no matter how careful I was, I managed to drop my cellular phones. In addition, not only did I drop it, but I somehow always managed to drop it onto either a concrete or asphalt surface. At least 2 cell phones I had broken that way, so I was looking for a case that featured "protection" as the primary functionality feature of the case I bought. This time, I decided I was not going to make the same mistake again. Thus, I did a search for highly protective iPhone 7 plus compatible cases.Amazon has a huge collection of cases, even ones that are protective. Some even use special military grade plastics. Yet I wanted one that would allow easy access to all the features of my cell phone. This one achieves those objectives, without creating any barriers to access of all my new phone's features. Thus, I chose this one which did everything on my list of requirements.The best results and comments I can make about this "Otterbox Defender Series Case" is the following:  1). Installation is trivial and simple  2). Access to every feature and button is easy  3)  AND, the case is very PROTECTIVE!!!How do I know? Because within 48 hours of my installation I was getting out of my car, when I dropped it on the cement parking lot. So, I said to myself, "Well, that is why I bought this one, so let's see if it is still working.And, Voila, every single function and button still worked. Nothing was damaged, and it greeted me immediately with perfect functionality! In addition, since that time I have dropped the phone 3 more times. Once on my hardwood floor, once on my asphalt parking lot driveway and once again on the concrete slab of my garage and every time it worked perfectly.Note please that all the drops were from an altitude of approximately waist high, therefore about 3 to 4 feet from impact. I decided that in every respect, this Otterbox Defender Series case was a perfect selection for meeting all my criteria. However, I would not attempt to find the limits of its protection. Thus, I do not recommend high altitude drops or throwing the phone and case to the concrete, but for normal use, including accidental drops this product fits the bill in every respect (I did not test for water) and thus I was totally satisfied and gave this product a well earned 5 Star rating. If good accidental drop protection is what you need, then I strongly recommend this product!

The case goes on and comes off easy, dropped more than once on pavement(butterfingers) phone protected. Only two things I dont like about it are the plastic screen protector that it comes with already attached, terrible, zero protection from anything but dust, Last couple of these for other phones I just took the plastic off and the glue that attaches it and got the glass screen protector that I know offers real protection from minor impacts. The second thing is not a big deal but I figured  I’d mention it, the case does increase the size of the already big phone slightly, the otterbox commuter case is thinner but I like the all rubber exterior of this one over the mostly hard plastic case of the commuter whch I also owned, the all rubber just makes the grip much more secure in your hand. Both cases offer superior protection in my opinion.

What the hell is the point of getting a NEW defender case when it comes completely smeared?! This will be the second one I’ve purchased the first one was fine this one looks like it fell out at the warehouse and dirty fingerprints are all over it.

UPDATE- Very disappointed in otter box quality of this case. I may have received a weak and defective product. The white plastic part of the case has snapped inside the soft cover. People use these cases on construction sites with no problems. I go to school, work, and home. There should be no reason why my case has broken after 2 months of me having it. The rest of the case is in perfect condidtion. Also another downside to this open part at the top of the phone is I have to open the case to clean lint and debris from the screen every couple of weeks. That whole also lets water through so if I forget to flip the phone over while I’m at the sink I have to clean water out of the case(which is how I found this break)Very pretty medium dark teal with white shell looks great on my black phone. Fit is sleek at a little under a dimes width for thickness. Durability fantastic obviously otter box is know for being one of the best for protection. The dad clip I’ll admit I use. It helps my small hands hold onto this huge phone kind of like a popsocket would. The clip is also the perfect size to fit in my car door cup holder so I can use my phone for gps. Case does not obstruct the sound quality. Dislikes- although the screen protector does protect my screen from scratches it doesn’t not stop debris from getting in the case. I did not want to have a built in screen protector. I wanted tempered glass but every case with this level of fall protection has a built in protector. I also don’t like the fact that it doesn’t have the apple logo centered in the circle in the back.I am afraid that this rubber part will start to warp and loosen. Will update with progress of that aspect.

I have been a otter box fan/ user since they came out, all my cells have had them. I just upgraded my phone and i got my case in the mail. I have never experienced almost having to slam my finger down on my screen to be able to text or unlock it. the screen cover has made it almost impossible to use my phone without slamming the screen. I am so disappointed right now with this case.

This is a great case, but you have to remove the built-in screen protector. The gap between the protector and your phone’s glass is insane — you have to press so much harder just to initiate a tap on your phone. AND it’s loud! It sounds like you’re tap dancing when you text someone.Solution: Remove the built-in protector. Grab a knife and start cutting it out, get rid of it, and apply one of those adhesive high-impact glass screen protectors before you put the case on. Much better.

I used to find these Beefy- tees in Walmart years ago. My husband needs the 2x. Then they stopped carrying them. One day, when my brain was working, I decided to peruse through Amazon. I couldn't believe my luck, when I found the Hanes Beefy tees. So I ordered 12. But you have to know: The ones I purchased at Wal-Mart 10 years ago, are still holding up, (barely). If you are married to a larger size man, or if YOU happen to be one, these are THE best quality t-shirts you'll ever find, or wear. They stand up to hundreds of washings, and the color seletion is superb. But the most important thing to us, is that they are 100% cotten. Best quality for your money.

NOT TAGLESS. Pretty sure I got a knock off,  it has 2 cheap big tags. It is not "beefy" it is thin. Every other Hanes Beefy Tee(at least 5) I have bought are tagless with thick cotton. Will never buy from this seller again..."Clothing Shop Online"

This shirt is very well made with a thick weave.  The color matches the picture even after repeated washings and there is no noticeable shrinkage even after tumble-drying on my dryer's highest setting.  I also tried applying iron-on transfers made for dark t-shirts to one of them and it worked beautifully.  I would recommend washing the shirt first, however, before trying to apply any iron-on transfer.

I ordered a medium, which according to Haynes is for chests 38-40. My chest is exactly 40. When I tried the shirt on it was skin tight; so tight that I actually had some problems peeling it off. I then measured the shirt front just below the armpits and it was 19" wide; times two is 38". This explains why it was so tight for a 40 chest. As far as "beefy" was concerned, my opinion is that it's not. It's not thin, but neither is it heavy. Hanes used to sell a true "beefy" T, which I wore for probably 10 years, but a few years ago they cheapened the product.I had also been considering buying similar shirts from LL Bean or Land's End, but those cost 3 times as much; around $18 each, I decided to return the Hanes shirts and see what the much higher price of a LL Bean shirt would get me. When the shirts arrived I did some comparisons. The LL Bean shirt chest front measured 22" (compared to 19" for the Hanes) and it weighed 7.6  oz compared to 6.5 oz for the Haines; i.e. the LL Bean shirt was beefier than the Hanes, even though it was described as standard weight.Is it worth 3 times the price? Probably not. Just order one size up, don't expect a heavy weight shirt, and you'll probably be happy and definitely richer.

I don’t know why I just don’t understand that you get what you pay for.I bought two of these, one Royal Blue and one Black.After washing and drying on a low setting, the overall shrinkage was minimal but as I suspected might happen, the bottom of the shirt folds up below the bottom seam. It is almost impossible to get it to fold back. Spraying a mist of water and adding a few clothes pins helps but that’s just ridiculous.In addition to that, the seams where the sleeves are sewn to the body of the shirt are all puckered. It’s impossible to flatten them, even ironing them.They are just plain old garbage and I should have paid double for one shirt...at least I would have had a wearable shirt instead of none.

Junk!  These used to be like G.I. issue shirts long ago.  Now they include stretched out neck bands which get larger when washed!  I'm sorry I bought them, typical Asia made shirts with poor quality.  Seams were not uniform as well.  I've heard that the Costco shirts may be better.  Amazon did have a good price on these shirts, but I'm sorry that I purchased them.

This is not "beefy" at all! I have a few Hanes Beefy T-shirts from a couple of years back and those are of the real quality: 100% cotton, no BS.The new t-shirt is 90% cotton + 10% polyester: you can see the daylight through the fabric. I's expect these to go through 4-5 wash cycles and become a rag. For the $6 it doesn't worth the trouble of returning it. But be aware.

I keep coming back to buy more of these.  These are great work shirts and just general usage shirts and the only decent t-shirt with a pocket anymore.* Durability for cheap.  For $7 a shirt you get a fairly beefy cotton that doesn't rip the instant it catches on anything.  It holds up well in the wash.  The dye doesn't seem to fade.  I can't tell the difference between two year old and two month old shirts.* Pocket is nice.  It's big enough to stuff your phone into it, but its better suited to light items that won't fall out due to gravity if you bend forward and stuff that you can clip to the edge of the pocket.  Business cards, paper notes, pens, and small flashlights with pocket clips all do well in the pocket.  If you put a phone in it expect it to flop out on the concrete if you bend forward more than 45 degrees.* Consistency.  I've bought 8 of these so far, two at a time over the course of about two years as I replaced my other work t-shirts.  The sizing has not been altered in that time, nor has the material weight.  I can't even tell the difference between the shirts from two years ago and the most recent ones, they don't even seem to have worn.* Modest cut.  They lean toward the boxy side which is fine if you aren't trying to show off.  If you're a little on the pudgy side it's actually preferable.  When I first got these I was about 195 at 6'1", two years later I've slimmed down while hitting the weights and sitting at 175 with a little more muscle in my upper torso and considerably less fat around my waist.  If you want to turn any heads or catch any eyes this is not your go to t-shirt.

A few months ago I ordered a sample of these tshirts. They fit perfect and were nice and beefy. However after I reordered this time with the same seller, these tshirts were not the same. They were a lot thinner material and they did not have the tagless style. It seems like Hanes sold out just like the Rast of the t-shirt companies and opted for cheaper thin stretchy material. Very disappointing, since this was the last resort for thicker tshirts. They'll say it was the same thickness bit standards have definitely changed. I have the comparisons right here In front of me. I hate wasting money buying cloths online when they keep getting cheaper with quality.
I think this is a knock off.  The shirt has tags and shrunk considerably in the first wash.  This is not a Hanes Beefy Tee quality shirt.  Must be a fake.

I love how slim this case is and how well it protects my phone. However, I could not rate this product a "5" for two reasons. First, it is not a "stay-clear/anti-yellowing" case. After exactly a month of using it (purchase January 7, 2018 and today is February 7, 2018), the front/face of the case has turned yellow. So if you hold the phone case on its side, the front is a yellowish tint and the back is still clear like the day I bought it. I thought it was my make up rubbing off on it, but after cleaning it with soup and water (more than once) it still has a yellowish tint. Also, the back of this case is not a "hard scratch-resistant shell". Within my first week of using it I already had numerous scratches. Today, a month later, the back of my case is completely filled with scratches. I will admit, the case does protect my phone. The actually case has cracked but the case is so thick that I can see the crack but I can not feel it and most importantly, my phone is unharmed. By the way, I NEVER write reviews. But I felt the need because I love this case but hate the issues I have encountered within my first month.

CONFIRMED: This case does work well with the iPhone X and does support QI Charging through the case! It's a snug fit the first time popping the device in, but once it is in it gives great all around protection as expected from OtterBox.My only complaint is that with my Glass Cover which wraps on the sides, the case forces it up and creates a bubble. I will need to try and re-apply the glass with the case on. I would suggest that others do the same.I will also add that the case feels great in my hand with the iPhone X in it, I think this will hold up to anything I throw at it.

Got this case and put my brand new iPhone in it. I dropped my phone 2ft to the kitchen floor, and it shattered (front and back) into pieces. I even had the Otterbox brand tempered glass on the screen. I have always used the commuter with my previous iPhones and I swear by it. This one is awful, do not trust your $1100 phone in this case. I was stuck making an insurance claim to replace a brand new phone within 2 weeks of buying it and placing it in this case :(

I don't know about you but the objective of getting a clear case is to show off how elegant the iPhone X really is. My go-to case "was" Otterbox because of it's durability. Within a week's time however, the sides started to turn yellow; within 2 weeks even more yellow. So I call the Otterbox customer service to ask if the case is supposed to turn yellow. They say no, so I ask for a replacement. To their credit, they replace it with no problem, albeit, a $6 shipping charge. I get the 2nd one and within the same 2 weeks, it was pretty yellow again. I call Otterbox again and they send me a 3rd one, free of charge this time because I insisted (since they won't admit it turns yellow). Sure enough, after 2 weeks it was yellow again. Folks, it just looks awful with a yellow tint around the sides...it just removes the beauty of the phone. Fortunately, I had known a person who had a Speck Presidio clear case, and theirs had not turned yellow. I finally bought the Speck case in July. We are now in September and it has not turned yellow. Go Speck if you HATE that yellow tint. I'm careful with my phone so I don't usually drop it...I'm not sure is Speck can handle drops better than Otterbox but it sure looks good without that DAMNED yellow tint.

After a long stay away from this company I decided to give this case a try for my iPhone X.At first glance it’s bulky and rounded, and makes me feel like I’m holding an old Android phone.Incredibly it seems as if the techs at Otterbox have created a completely frictionless phone case. This made my iPhone X slide into places no phone should ever go.  Consistent only in the fact that the surface chosen to rest the phone on must be plumb and level or else suffer yet another trip to the floor, nook or wormhole.However the case did manage to protect my new IPhone from the dozen or so drops it sustained within 24hrs due to the case itself.Just long enough to order a new case which is perf and return this warm stick of butter surrounding my sweet phone.

The product is horrible. It says that it has anti yellowing features and it’s already yellow after only having just about three weeks I am very disappointed in the product and would like some explanitaion on this.
I LOVE this case. Not only is it efficient and 100% genuine in its function, it's also SO PRETTY.
The case is amazing, but the clear version does scratch easily on the back, returning for the black version now2 weeks later.  The whole back is scratched pretty bad

Installed on an Iphone XS (2018)This cover was meant to be used in an IPhone X. It fits fine on the XS, except for the speakers at the bottom. Left speaker was shifted to the right and now has 2 of the holes covered up by the case. This does not affect performance of the speakers at all though.The cover is made out of hard plastic with semi rigid rubber areas inside and on the sides. It was very hard to install on the phone because the case does not flex. I thought I was going to break my brand new phone, but eventually got it in.This case provides plenty of protection for the rear cameras. The camera bump sits around 1-1.5mm deep inside the case. This was exactly what I wanted. Most other cases Ive seen are practically flush with the camera.Buttons operate correctly, though a little hard to push. The silent mode switch I find a little hard to get as it sits very deep inside the case. I need long nails to reach the switch.I find the case a little on the slippery side. Particularly the back side. I installed a metal plate such that I could use my magnetic phone holder that I have in my car. Due to the thickness of this case, the phone is held up fine, but not as tight as my previous phone. The slippery back makes me nervous that the phone might slide off.Overall I like it. Plenty of protection, to be tested when I drop this phone eventually.Might eventually change it for something more stylish though.

I’m not one to write reviews but I felt like I need to for this product. First off, I had this case for my iPhone 8 Plus and it was great. 3 weeks ago I go the iPhone XS and purchased this case thinking it would be great like my last one. Boy, WAS I WRONG. On week 2 of having my phone, I dropped my phone from maybe 3 feet off the ground. It landed flat on concrete. I picked it up and the upper right corner of the phone slipped out of the case which caused the phone to crack between the case and the screen protector. So I thought to myself, maybe user error.... I ended up replacing the cracked screen. A WEEK LATER my phone fell 2 feet from my hand as I was leaning over and fell to the ground. AGAIN the phone slipped from the case and it cracked the bottom right part of my screen protector (thankfully not the actual screen). I am not sure if the case is not tight enough or what, but I DO NOT recommend this case to anyone with an X or XS. I just ordered my MOUS case and cannot wait to throw this one out!

I love how slim this case is and how well it protects my phone. However, I could not rate this product a "5" for two reasons. First, it is not a "stay-clear/anti-yellowing" case. After exactly a month of using it (purchase January 7, 2018 and today is February 7, 2018), the front/face of the case has turned yellow. So if you hold the phone case on its side, the front is a yellowish tint and the back is still clear like the day I bought it. I thought it was my make up rubbing off on it, but after cleaning it with soup and water (more than once) it still has a yellowish tint. Also, the back of this case is not a "hard scratch-resistant shell". Within my first week of using it I already had numerous scratches. Today, a month later, the back of my case is completely filled with scratches. I will admit, the case does protect my phone. The actually case has cracked but the case is so thick that I can see the crack but I can not feel it and most importantly, my phone is unharmed. By the way, I NEVER write reviews. But I felt the need because I love this case but hate the issues I have encountered within my first month.

CONFIRMED: This case does work well with the iPhone X and does support QI Charging through the case! It's a snug fit the first time popping the device in, but once it is in it gives great all around protection as expected from OtterBox.My only complaint is that with my Glass Cover which wraps on the sides, the case forces it up and creates a bubble. I will need to try and re-apply the glass with the case on. I would suggest that others do the same.I will also add that the case feels great in my hand with the iPhone X in it, I think this will hold up to anything I throw at it.

Got this case and put my brand new iPhone in it. I dropped my phone 2ft to the kitchen floor, and it shattered (front and back) into pieces. I even had the Otterbox brand tempered glass on the screen. I have always used the commuter with my previous iPhones and I swear by it. This one is awful, do not trust your $1100 phone in this case. I was stuck making an insurance claim to replace a brand new phone within 2 weeks of buying it and placing it in this case :(

I don't know about you but the objective of getting a clear case is to show off how elegant the iPhone X really is. My go-to case "was" Otterbox because of it's durability. Within a week's time however, the sides started to turn yellow; within 2 weeks even more yellow. So I call the Otterbox customer service to ask if the case is supposed to turn yellow. They say no, so I ask for a replacement. To their credit, they replace it with no problem, albeit, a $6 shipping charge. I get the 2nd one and within the same 2 weeks, it was pretty yellow again. I call Otterbox again and they send me a 3rd one, free of charge this time because I insisted (since they won't admit it turns yellow). Sure enough, after 2 weeks it was yellow again. Folks, it just looks awful with a yellow tint around the sides...it just removes the beauty of the phone. Fortunately, I had known a person who had a Speck Presidio clear case, and theirs had not turned yellow. I finally bought the Speck case in July. We are now in September and it has not turned yellow. Go Speck if you HATE that yellow tint. I'm careful with my phone so I don't usually drop it...I'm not sure is Speck can handle drops better than Otterbox but it sure looks good without that DAMNED yellow tint.

First off, I had this case for my iPhone 8 Plus and it was great. 3 weeks ago I go the iPhone XS and purchased this case thinking it would be great like my last one. Boy, WAS I WRONG. On week 2 of having my phone, I dropped my phone from maybe 3 feet off the ground. It landed flat on concrete. I have had this protector as I feel it is was necessary to get it for my iPhone 8 plus. Being a recent convert from a Samsung Galaxy 5, I could no longer feel comfortable being responsibly gentle with an even larger and significantly heavier phone, so I looked for a case that wasn't too bulky, but also something that offered some protection. My first case was the Pursuit, but I felt it was too big, and the cover switch for the ringer did not work properly, so I returned it.After much research, and nearly buying a silicon case with fuzzy lining, I chose this. I went back to it because it was American made, which I felt meant it may have went through a strict quality control process, and I liked the feel of the pursuit case, despite the non-functioning ringer cover switch.I am happy with this purchase, and for the face of the phone that is not covered, I feel this product works well if you have a separate glass face protector. I am usually a bigger fan of single piece protectors, but not in the instance of a case where a touch screen is involved. I am also happy that this case was not as bulky as I expected, as I had planned to get a slimmer case for formal events. To me, this provides excellent protection without being bulky.This unit went on over my phone a little tight at first, as it was activating some of the side volume buttons as it was being fitted over my iPhone 8 Plus. But once on, it felt very snug. I like that the case feels nice with semi-grippy rubber around the side, but rigid and hard along the surfaces on the back at the same time. I guess I'm a tactile sort of person because besides liking the feel of this case in hand, I have no problems placing my phone down on hard concrete (which I would be nervous about doing with iPhones bare glass exterior) and enjoy that the phone feels protected in my front (yes, front) pocket as well, from shifting and or bending.An important feature to me is that the camera 'bump' is aligned in a fitted hole that gives it and the flash an ample opening and provides what feels to be a quarter's thickness to keep the bump from touching a surface if the case is placed camera-side down.The bottom cut-outs for the lightning cable and bottom speakers holes seem perfectly aligned for me, and the side buttons for the power and the volume controls are pleasantly stiff, which are find for me since I do not use them much and value the protection they provide for the little-used buttons. I also like that the ringer on/off switch is a simple cut-out rather than an attempted addition side button. I feel that this switch is, by design, something to correctly cover and have another working switch over it, as the Pursuit attempted to do.I highly recommend this case and I think it is an excellent value on Amazon at $28 at the time of purchase. I would be willing to bet it's nearly twice as much if you buy it at your local cell phone provider.Thank you for reading and I hope this review helps you.

This is the fake GARBAGE that AMAZON Fullfilment sent to me! It’s a FAKE KNOCK OFF of an Otterbox branded Symmetry Series case. Amazon’s is made in China. The REAL Symmetry case from Otterbox is much different looking and comes in very expensive packaging!!! Total disappointment from Amazon today!!!

The item I received is NOT a true Otterbox. The box that this cheap silicone/ rubber cover came in states “Stylish Coice, Fashion Case” with an Otterbox sticker stuck crookedly on front. The “case” does not have a hard back or a raised beveled edge. I know this is fake since I’ve had one for my previous iPhone and it was a wonderful product. Otterbox box was also imprinted in the case. This “cover” does not have Otterbox on it anywhere. Returning immediately.** Added pics. I purchased a real one from Best Buy on left. They price matched Amazon. You can see the flimsy fake in second pic and the true Otterbox in last two pics.

I've had this case for almost 10 months so I think I can speak definitively about this.Look I know I'm the kind of person who drops stuff. I'm also the kind of person who likes to go out which makes me a 2x kind of person who drops stuff. So when I'm getting a case, it's a short term relationship.Not this son of a gun. Let me tell you the ways I've dropped this - off of a desk, off a ladder, accidentally threw across the street, sneezed so hard it flew out of my hands and hit the wall, angrily made hand movement and it slipped out, demonstrating how good it is by throwing it on a couch, demonstrating how good it is by throwing it on the floor,  dropped in a pot of water (that probably has more to do with the phones water resistance but STILL), thrown as a joke, thrown as not a joke, adamant gesticulation, demonstrating how hard my brother's head was by hitting him with it (would not recommend), trying to impress girlfriend, dropped every day.Seriously, as someone who drops their phone both intentionally and unintentionally, I cannot recommend this case enough. Also it looks good, I love the color, it's light and is the slimmest case that will still protect your phone to a degree that you legitimately don't have to worry about it if you're a class A phone dropper.

Case seems to protect the phone well enough but it scratches very easily and the scratches make it very slippery and hard to hold. After only having the case for a short time it already looks terrible. Not a good design, next time I’ll be going with something other than OtterBox.

Terrible...I always trust otter box with my phones. This case however let me down. It is really pretty but pretty poor quality. The back got scratched from just placing it on a table, and not to mention the color transfer from any clothing item you wear. I’m disappointed I paid so much money for this disappointing case 👎🏻

Did not protect the back of my phone from breaking.  My phone was in my coat pocket and I was bent down getting something from the floor of my car when my phone slipped out of my pocket and fell to the driveway. I didn’t even cringe, it was such a small distance and didn’t sound like a hard fall. Very shocked to see the cracks across the back. Ive trusted in this brand for years and was very disappointed!

I give one star because I can’t give a 0... In the features says STAY- CLEAR / ANTI-YELLOWING, one of the main reasons I bought it. But after a week using it it’s horrible. Looks like it’s 2 colors! All the edge it’s yellow, looks dirty. DONT BUY IT !

I bought this for my daughter for Christmas and she loves it! It is very protective yet fashionable. She’s dropped her phone multiple times from pretty high with his case on and her phone stayed safe; the case did not take any damage either. It came in the nice packaging and also came with a warranty. (The white splotches seen on the case in the photos are just from the flash.) I hope this review helps! 😄

Ugh I had high hopes for this one, but I dropped my phone twice..and not from a skyscraper.. from less than 3 feet and both times my glass protector cracked.. thankfully I had the protector on it, but I have had the same screen protector on my phone since December ($40) and have dropped it many times without a scratch.. but since this case doesn’t actually cover the phone.. the phone touches the ground first instead of the case.. and that’s why it cracked it.. I went back to the other series and so far so good..Another thing ..the phone is hella slippery when your trying to use it.. no grip what so ever ..The only thing I liked was that I could use the Apple mirror in the back since it was see through

I wanted people to see how this shirt was cut! My 6yo grandson put it on and it is so wide, but not even long enough to cover his stomach! It looks like a toddler size cut too wide! Awful! I requested a return, and found out that I'd have to pay for the return! It cost me $5 to get the darn thing shipped, not spending another $5 to return a $7.95 defective shirt. Lesson learned!

These are wonderful, colorful shirts with interesting designs and good quality. The sizes are just a bit smaller than I expected, so I'd advise beer-bellied men to buy one size larger than we're used to. Hey, we came from the 60s and now we're approaching our 70s. We need a bit more room than we used to...I was walking down the street, and a 12-yr-old shouted, "Nice shirt!" from across the street. I don't get that kinda compliment very often anymore, so I bought a second shirt of the same brand.

High quality shirt -- no loose threads or defects, great colors, beautiful design. But although the shirt fit very well for my size (XXL) around the chest and across the shoulders, it was almost exactly a full 6" longer than standard. I don't tuck my t-shirts in so I look just plain silly when the shirt that goes down to my thighs. I tried tucking it in to compensate. That didn't turn out so well either -- it filled up my pants with huge, unsightly, and uncomfortable bulges. Because I hate making returns, I actually went out to buy a sewing machine at the Goodwill, trained myself how to use it, and then trimmed and seamed the bottom hem. But that seams like a lot of extra work to correct a manufacturing defect. If it wasn't a defect than they're using some very low-waisted, long-torsoed clothing dummies/sewing mannequins for the shirt length of their XXL size.  But excellent service and fast delivery

(Rainbow and Pastel Rainbow) I absolutely love this shirt. I like my shirts to fit loose and a bit baggy, its comfy that way, so I originally ordered a large but that was a bit too large for me (true to size, it was just my fault for ordering wrong size), I am about 125lb and about 5foot8, but the large was easily returned and I ordered a medium and it's perfect, loose but not too much so. It is really bright and pretty, fits great and is really comfy (they also don't shrink in the washer/dryer!) I wear it way too much, so I decided to also order the pastel rainbow one lol. They are both really pretty I wear them a lot, actually wearing the pastel one as I write this. They don't bleed in the wash and the color lasts, I have washed them a lot. The quality of the shirts is good. Pretty much I really like them and you get one if youre thinking about it lol. I plan to order more in different colors....

I LOVE MY TIE-DYED TEE SHIRT!!!! I have wanted one of these since they were in style back in the day! I wore the two I had until they were too holey for outside wear. :) This one is BEAUTIFUL! I LOVE the rainbow colors! The actual tee shirt looks exactly like the image here, thank you very much! I ordered 2XL because I wasn't sure if this 2XL was small or actual size. This one is actual size, thus 2XL is bigger than I prefer, but I can just knot it on the size or back and wear it young and teenagery. THANK YOU for your product matching the advertising. Haven't washed it yet, but I should have some room for shrinkage (if it even shrinks).

Better than I expected. I purchased this shirt for as part of a "hippie" costume for my 17 year old son who is a very picky dresser. He actually liked the shirt. The cotton was soft. When I washed it the colors did not fade or run. I am pretty impressed with the quality.

It's awesome, its colorful, shirt is good quality.  It did shrink a little when I dried it with heat but that's ok because it was a bit large to start with.  I am not sure it's large for a 4x but it was large for me because I wanted it oversize. It just turned out to be a little more over-sized than I counted on so the dryer is helping with that.  It did not shrink the first wash when I used cold water and cool dryer setting.

I'm a size small/xs in girl's in the teen section. The size small in this shirt fits me like a short dress and it's baggy but i expected that. I just tuck it in my pants and roll up the sleeves. The color is vibrant and beautiful. I love it.

I love this T-shirt. The shirt itself is a nice quality and of an adequate length. I'm 5'11" and prefer a shirt that leans toward tall & narrow. The tie-dying on it is beautifully done! The colors are bold, edges are sharp, none of the colors are muddy. I own a lot of tie-dye shirts & this is definitely my new favorite. This is the shirt I will reach for if I am in a good mood or when I'm not but want to be. I have had long enough to wash it a few times already & the colors are staying true. I've heard that if you add a cup of vinegar to the washer when washing your new tie-dye shirts that it helps set the color. I forgot to do that this time, but the colors still look bright & clear. I'm super-happy with this purchase & will likely order more as gifts.

Bought for my daughter to wear for tie-dye themed spirit day at school. Bright colors & looks great! I believe it is true to size. I bought youth M & my daughter wears a 10-12. It is same size as her other youth M shirts made by different companies.  I can already see that she'll want to wear this shirt... a lot!*i have not washed the shirt yet so I can't speak to the colors running or how well it holds up in wash. I'll update if I have any issues.

I notice that many people are complaining about the number of pages the ink prints.  I too had this problem at first.  The solution was simple.  I put the settings on draft which prints the same quality with less ink.  Standard print eats a lot of ink and if you put it on best it definitely consumes ink really quick.  I keep my printer set on draft and change it to standard only when doing special printing such as t-shirts, invitations or greeting cards.  When the light comes on that means that you have at least 50 pages (sometimes more) that you can print before you run out of ink.  I was able to put the cartridges I removed (because of the low ink light) back into the printer and got 50 or more pages out of them.  Just glad I decided to try it before I threw the cartridges away.  I hope this helps.

Yes, this was easy to install.  No, it wasn't worth the purchase price.  I printed out about 15 pages and all of a sudden my low ink light was back on.  Yes, the printer was inexpensive, but I have since tossed it because the cost of the ink was going to bankrupt me.  I am very disappointed because I liked the printer.  This is no deal.  Maybe if you print something every week or two, but not good for daily use.

Didn't seem to last as long as I expected.  But that may be misleading, since it starts telling you your ink levels are low when the cartridge is maybe one-half consumed. The Pop-up warning screen shows the ink level to be like maybe 5%, when you still have lots of ink left.  So, don't replace the cartridge until it actually stops printing.  For me, that was at least one hundred copies later.

This is the first time I ordered just the black ink (I usually get the combo) but there is no reason it should be such a poor product...they are the same thing. This printed 10 pages vs 25 with the one I got in the combo pack. I couldn't finish my project even. NEVER again!
Would of gave it five stars but could only afford 4 after buying ink lol
I am very dissapointed. I put this in today and after making four copies my printer says I need new ink.

As with all Canon ink cartridges, runs out much too quickly. This was never a problem some years back but most definitely is now. I used to print regularly and only had to replace ink every few months but now it seems even with hardly printing anything at all, the ink runs out. It is getting to where buying a new printer is cheaper than buying ink!

Lasted for about 15 sheets. Very much a scam. I thought i was imagining things, or perhaps doing something wrong with the printer settings but, after reading others’ reviews, I’ve concluded it’s a scam. I saved 5 cartridges I have bought and used in about one year, and I hardly ever print. Waste of money, shipping and packaging. Someone should complain that this is FRAUDULENT.

works well and easy to install, swapping cartridges takes 15 seconds. For some reason, the canon printers burn lots of black ink. It could be the consumption rate or the cartridge itself that requires this much ink. I don't print much so it isn't a issue.PS: Based on the supreme court decision in Lexmark v. Impression, it is fully legal and permissible for a third party to fill your ink cartridges. Not sure if there is one yet for this cartridge, but maybe worth a search? Hope that saves you some money!

It just doesn't seem fair that these ink cartridges are so darn expensive. The quality of re-manufactured or other brand cartridges is just the same, but the problem is that Canon printers detect them and flash up a warning and won't work with anything of a reasonable cost. So we are stuck with buying Canon's new ones.Canon compensates by selling the printer for $34! The Canon printer is wonderful and definitely my favorite among all the many other brands I've owned. But it doesn't seem fair that the ink is so very expensive -- not much of a discount for buying in bulk, either.I'd be happier if they would do good discounts if you are buying 3 or more. Give the consumer a break.

Highly recommend this product, purchased this for my wife 2 weeks ago along with the iPhone X. Also had a tempered glass screen protector on it...anyways, I dropped her off at the front door of the house today and after she closed the door she accidentally dropped the phone and it of course landed under the back tire of the car. Unknowingly I proceeded to drive to park and run over it! Thankfully it was perfectly fine! The screen protector however didn’t get so lucky. I’m extremely pleased with the performance of this case! Recommend to everyone! -Rebeca’s husband

Doesn't fit properly on my iPhone Xs. The rubber buckles around the buttons. It is real loose the volume and on and off button. This case does not fit properly, the edges are exposed and flimsy. I’d be worried if I drop it. This is not for iPhone Xs. I am hugely disappointed. Openings at the bottom for mike is bigger than required (looks like they sent the cover for iPhone Xs). Camera and apple logo on the back of the phone do not properly fit at the center of the openings.  This is a huge disappointment since its a costly cover then it should fit in the iPhone Xs.

This case is great! Sleek but feels protective. It has a "lip" that goes over the phone screen so if you drop it, the case hits the ground first and not the screen. I had no issues with it not fitting as previous reviewers mentioned, this one fits perfectly over the X with no bulges or button alignment issues.I've used the Commuter Otterbox for every previous iPhone I owned and they were always great, so I hope this one continues to work just as well!

I bought this case because I had the same one for my iPhone 6s and it worked with a new baby so well. My baby would throw it and drop it all the time and nothing ever happened. For years I didn’t have one crack.  I got the new iphone XS two weeks ago and just a few days into using this case the screen is cracked. You can tell that this case isn’t as good as the older version of the same model because it doesn’t come up as high around the sides of the screen so it can’t provide as much protection. I’m not sure why otter box changed their design for the commuter but I am returning this and paying to get my screen fixed :(((((

Pros• Slim but provides the perfect protection to your iPhone X.• Two layers case.• Hole in the back for the ones who like to show off the Apple logo.• Feels good in your hands with a great grip.• Even if your phone has a tempered glass, thanks to its raised beveled edge, it will keep the screen safe if the phone fell on a flat surface.• Provides great protection to your back camera thanks to the raised beveled edge.• The buttons are very responsive.• Protects your lighting port against dust and debris, thanks to a nice cap.• Wireless charger friendly, I am using a Choetech.Cons• Might slip on some hard surface.

Overview: This case has protected my iPhone X from numerous drops.Pros:  I'm not an overtly clumsy person.  But for some reason I feel like I need to drop my $1,000 phone onto the ground from waist to chest height.  Not a single scratch has appeared from the numerous drops.Cons:  The reason I keep dropping my phone is the hard outer shell is super slick.  Imagine dipping your hands into olive oil and then picking up your phone.  That is how slick this case is.  There is no texture to the outer shell.  You will accidentally drop your phone with this case...numerous times.  The good news is, it is awesome at protecting the phone from the inevitable drops.

I do not believe this is a legit Otterbox, or the quality of Otterbox has changed. With all my previous Otterbox cases the two part system has worked really well and both layers feel of quality. This case has a cheap rubber that is not flexible as they have been before and and doesn’t fit like a glove. The plastic is lacking the support to keep the rubber tightly against the phone especially on the top half of the phone.

I bought the symmetry case clear and it was scratched up in a week. This case has more protection and is just as slim! Weighs more yes, but it’s worth it. 1,000 dollar phone deserves this case. Don’t be cheap!  Plus you get the opening in the back for the Apple LogoWorks with WIRELESS CHARGING TOO

I got this for my new iPhone Xs as I loved the Commuter case on my previous iPhone 7.  Overall I did not feel like this case fit the phone well. Not sure if this is an issue with the Xs or just the overall design of the case.  The rubber portion felt loose and spongy, especially around the side button and camera while the outer plastic piece felt like it was too small and never felt completely secure over the rubber.  Things just didn't line up or look tidy.I just ordered and received the Otterbox Symmetry Case which feels perfect on my phone.  Seems like a much more secure fit and doesn't seem to sacrifice anything on protection.  Love Otterbox and their products, but the Commuter on the iPhone Xs is a "miss" for me

I was really excited to get this case but disappointed when I got it. I have always had a Defender case and this doesn’t feel as safe as I’m used to. There is only rubber on the inside and slightly on the edges so I doesn’t grip that well when holding or using on the side. Also there is no clear protector for the circle in the back which is what made me decide to return it. Great case for someone who is careful with their phone just not someone who wants to feel protected.

I have had this protector as I feel it is was necessary to get it for my iPhone 8 plus. Being a recent convert from a Samsung Galaxy 5, I could no longer feel comfortable being responsibly gentle with an even larger and significantly heavier phone, so I looked for a case that wasn't too bulky, but also something that offered some protection. My first case was the Pursuit, but I felt it was too big, and the cover switch for the ringer did not work properly, so I returned it.After much research, and nearly buying a silicon case with fuzzy lining, I chose this. I went back to it because it was American made, which I felt meant it may have went through a strict quality control process, and I liked the feel of the pursuit case, despite the non-functioning ringer cover switch.I am happy with this purchase, and for the face of the phone that is not covered, I feel this product works well if you have a separate glass face protector. I am usually a bigger fan of single piece protectors, but not in the instance of a case where a touch screen is involved. I am also happy that this case was not as bulky as I expected, as I had planned to get a slimmer case for formal events. To me, this provides excellent protection without being bulky.This unit went on over my phone a little tight at first, as it was activating some of the side volume buttons as it was being fitted over my iPhone 8 Plus. But once on, it felt very snug. I like that the case feels nice with semi-grippy rubber around the side, but rigid and hard along the surfaces on the back at the same time. I guess I'm a tactile sort of person because besides liking the feel of this case in hand, I have no problems placing my phone down on hard concrete (which I would be nervous about doing with iPhones bare glass exterior) and enjoy that the phone feels protected in my front (yes, front) pocket as well, from shifting and or bending.An important feature to me is that the camera 'bump' is aligned in a fitted hole that gives it and the flash an ample opening and provides what feels to be a quarter's thickness to keep the bump from touching a surface if the case is placed camera-side down.The bottom cut-outs for the lightning cable and bottom speakers holes seem perfectly aligned for me, and the side buttons for the power and the volume controls are pleasantly stiff, which are find for me since I do not use them much and value the protection they provide for the little-used buttons. I also like that the ringer on/off switch is a simple cut-out rather than an attempted addition side button. I feel that this switch is, by design, something to correctly cover and have another working switch over it, as the Pursuit attempted to do.I highly recommend this case and I think it is an excellent value on Amazon at $28 at the time of purchase. I would be willing to bet it's nearly twice as much if you buy it at your local cell phone provider.Thank you for reading and I hope this review helps you.

This is the fake GARBAGE that AMAZON Fullfilment sent to me! It’s a FAKE KNOCK OFF of an Otterbox branded Symmetry Series case. Amazon’s is made in China. The REAL Symmetry case from Otterbox is much different looking and comes in very expensive packaging!!! Total disappointment from Amazon today!!!

The item I received is NOT a true Otterbox. The box that this cheap silicone/ rubber cover came in states “Stylish Coice, Fashion Case” with an Otterbox sticker stuck crookedly on front. The “case” does not have a hard back or a raised beveled edge. I know this is fake since I’ve had one for my previous iPhone and it was a wonderful product. Otterbox box was also imprinted in the case. This “cover” does not have Otterbox on it anywhere. Returning immediately.** Added pics. I purchased a real one from Best Buy on left. They price matched Amazon. You can see the flimsy fake in second pic and the true Otterbox in last two pics.

I've had this case for almost 10 months so I think I can speak definitively about this.Look I know I'm the kind of person who drops stuff. I'm also the kind of person who likes to go out which makes me a 2x kind of person who drops stuff. So when I'm getting a case, it's a short term relationship.Not this son of a gun. Let me tell you the ways I've dropped this - off of a desk, off a ladder, accidentally threw across the street, sneezed so hard it flew out of my hands and hit the wall, angrily made hand movement and it slipped out, demonstrating how good it is by throwing it on a couch, demonstrating how good it is by throwing it on the floor,  dropped in a pot of water (that probably has more to do with the phones water resistance but STILL), thrown as a joke, thrown as not a joke, adamant gesticulation, demonstrating how hard my brother's head was by hitting him with it (would not recommend), trying to impress girlfriend, dropped every day.Seriously, as someone who drops their phone both intentionally and unintentionally, I cannot recommend this case enough. Also it looks good, I love the color, it's light and is the slimmest case that will still protect your phone to a degree that you legitimately don't have to worry about it if you're a class A phone dropper.

Case seems to protect the phone well enough but it scratches very easily and the scratches make it very slippery and hard to hold. After only having the case for a short time it already looks terrible. Not a good design, next time I’ll be going with something other than OtterBox.

Terrible...I always trust otter box with my phones. This case however let me down. It is really pretty but pretty poor quality. The back got scratched from just placing it on a table, and not to mention the color transfer from any clothing item you wear. I’m disappointed I paid so much money for this disappointing case 👎🏻

Did not protect the back of my phone from breaking.  My phone was in my coat pocket and I was bent down getting something from the floor of my car when my phone slipped out of my pocket and fell to the driveway. I didn’t even cringe, it was such a small distance and didn’t sound like a hard fall. Very shocked to see the cracks across the back. Ive trusted in this brand for years and was very disappointed!

I give one star because I can’t give a 0... In the features says STAY- CLEAR / ANTI-YELLOWING, one of the main reasons I bought it. But after a week using it it’s horrible. Looks like it’s 2 colors! All the edge it’s yellow, looks dirty. DONT BUY IT !

I bought this for my daughter for Christmas and she loves it! It is very protective yet fashionable. She’s dropped her phone multiple times from pretty high with his case on and her phone stayed safe; the case did not take any damage either. It came in the nice packaging and also came with a warranty. (The white splotches seen on the case in the photos are just from the flash.) I hope this review helps! 😄

Ugh I had high hopes for this one, but I dropped my phone twice..and not from a skyscraper.. from less than 3 feet and both times my glass protector cracked.. thankfully I had the protector on it, but I have had the same screen protector on my phone since December ($40) and have dropped it many times without a scratch.. but since this case doesn’t actually cover the phone.. the phone touches the ground first instead of the case.. and that’s why it cracked it.. I went back to the other series and so far so good..Another thing ..the phone is hella slippery when your trying to use it.. no grip what so ever ..The only thing I liked was that I could use the Apple mirror in the back since it was see through

I ordered this bag in size small for the gym, and it fit my essentials with room to spare. I packed up my protein shaker, three 16oz water bottles, a small backpack, gloves, towel, diapers/wipes/snacks for my kids among other necessities and could still fit maybe 20% more. I posted pics wearing the bag so you can see how large the “small” size is. It’s lightweight but feels well made, and the material feels like it should be easy to clean. I am so happy with this bag!

Ok so I was trying to find a bag that worked for my 12 year old for volleyball. She had a book bag for school and wanted something small enough she could fit in her locker with her book bag. The small seemed like it might be too big. They are small lockers... and they can’t carry bags at school. I wanted so bad to see reviews of the extra small but I couldn’t find them so I took a chance and I’m glad I did. I can fit her volleyball shoes in the side pockets still, her uniform, water bottle, inhaler, and a volleyball in her bag. Everything she needs fits great. Hopefully this helps if anyone is wondering what I was...is it “too” small... nope!

I wanted something I could use for a weekend worth of clothes and still be carried onto an airline. This is a good size. I was really torn between the medium and small. After checking the medium in person at a local store it's way too big compared to this. Bag seems well made and zippers are good quality and the carry handles are seen on nice. Can't wait to load it up with stuff and see how it holds.
i love the fit, i wore this to work as a dress shirt, i'm a female 180 lbs and a small fits just right

This is huge disapointment. The bag looks good, but poorly designed.I bought small size, the ad video said it's a shoe compartment and it appears to be a shoe compartment too. I have man shoe size 10, and it doesn't fit that I cannot zip the compartment.While my other bag which is much smaller than this one can store the same shoe easily in its shoe compartment (see photos)If you want a nice looking bag, this bag is an option. But if you want a funtional compact bag with usable shoe compartment, DON'T BUY THE SMALL SIZE (not sure about the larger size)

So I ordered a medium size. Upon arrival I enthusiastically opened the package and inspected my new gym bag. I'm pretty sure I ordered brand new, either that or I missed the fine print where it said "complementary women's hair scrunchie inside" hence the 4 star rating. My wife and I laughed but I'm disappointed. I paid for brand new and got a used bag. (Buying and returning with accessories left in bag is considered used in my opinion) it didnt even have to under armour tag on it 😱

Perfect size duffel bag. I was able to fit three days worth of clothing for a weekend golf trip. Three polo shirts, three pairs of shorts, one pair of pants, two T-shirts, one pair of gym shorts,  One pair sneakers, socks, underwear, my toiletry bag, Kindleand headphones with room to spare.  I love the look, held up well on its first test. Would recommend

This Bag fits all my 9 year old daughter’s needs.She currently uses it as a basketball bag, she packs her basketball, slide sandals, basketball sneakers, extra clothing, water bottle and more. Bag is very roomy and I feel it could be used for any age. The vented shoe compartment is a huge plus for an athlete.We love how the bright colors pop against the black, it is a very attractive bag.Could be used for multiple sports or a sleepover bag for travel.Definitely would purchase another bag like this!Very nice quality.

I’ve had my old UA bag for going on ten years. It’s old but still holding together. I ordered a new one, cheaper material, no rubber pads on bottom, cheaper zipper, thin fabric. No reinforcements in the straps, just sewn into the seam.  I carry my chains for doing weighted dips in my bag and other items.  I don’t think this would last 2 months. It’s going back.

I love my gym bag! Prior to writing the review, I legitimately tried to think of any cons to share with you all about the bag. I have nothing! The only thing that I would tell you is to be aware that this is a LARGE bag. Meaning, if you are of average height, it may look a little odd on you. You may have to play with the straps a bit to get it how you want it. Personally, I could care less about that.I literally store everything I need for the gym into this bag: my "under clothes", shirt, pants, shoes, bag to keep my dirty clothes in, shower towel, workout towel, earbuds, Kindle, shaker cup, and shake mix. Even after I have all that in the bag, there is still a bunch more space left that is left unused.So, if you need a high quality bag to put all your stuff in, this is it!
