I'm big boned and incredibly my bones have grown over the years. One way to grow bones bigger is to eat junk food and not move around much. Okay I'm fat. There you happy? I put on a few pounds in the belly region and needed shirts that would cover up my gut. I hate standing there feeling a cool breeze on my stomach only to realize it's because my fat is sticking out. These shirts do the trick. Sure I'm still fat but at least these shirts help cover the skin up so I don't scare random people sending them screaming and crying only to be traumatized for the rest of their lives.Update: I just ordered for the third time.

This is one issue I've had with the few clothing purchases I've made on line... so often what you see is NOT what you get, which is why I don't often resort to it. I ordered the "assorted earth tones" 4 pack, and when you click on the assorted earth tones, what's shown are shirts that look like a steel blue, a brown, an olive green, and I guess what they're calling a "heather grey". The description says that they're all 100% cotton, with the exception of the heather grey, which is 90% cotton, 10% polyester. Well, the most important part of the product description is the part that says "colors may vary" - you ain't kiddin'!What I ended up getting were two of the EXACT SAME same grayish-blue shirts (90% cotton, 10% polyester) rather than steel blue, a much lighter shade of brown than shown (90% cotton, 10% polyester), and a teal shirt rather than the olive (the ONLY one that's 100% cotton!)These are for my hard-working, blue collar hubby, and he's not really going to care what the colors are - he's always been completely satisfied with the Fruit of the Loom pocket tees I've purchased in the past (he's a big guy, we buy the 3XL size, he likes the way they fit him), and it's nice that they're all tag-less now. But the shirts in this pack are made in El Salvador, and here's what the washing instructions say: "Para Mexico Lavar Con Detergente/No Exprimir". My high school Spanish class was a lifetime ago! And I expect to get the colors featured in the "assorted earth tones" photo accompanying the choice I clicked on - surely not TWO of the same color, which wasn't even shown!  We like the shirts - just not the misinformation.

Bought these T-shirts for my son and husband as they are the only shirts my son will wear.  But something has changed and these do not fit like the last ones we bought in the store.  They run small and too long.PROS:  They are soft and don't get twisted when washed.  There is some minimal pilling after multiple wears (like six months of every day wear) but that is to be expected.  Price is great as you get 4 shirts for the price and one shirt in the stores costs $6.CONS:  Size is off.  My son wears a XL and fits XL in other FOL shirts. These ones are way too tight and too long for him.  He said they feel like he's wearing a tube sock as a top. Also, going by the picture we expected two darker grey and two blue but received 3 blue (light blue, darker deep blue, and a grayish blue) and a light grey shirt.

With this product you get 4 crew neck t-shirts at an inexpensive price.These undershirts are made of cotton which makes them soft and comfortable.The branding and sizing information is stamped on the back of the inside of these shirts, which is great because there are no tags to cause irritation and itching.These undershirts are fairly thin and lightweight, so if you are doing some heavy construction work (or yard work, or etc.) they aren't the most durable.It must be noted that these undershirts will shrink after a couple washes, which could mean trouble for people who wear these tighter to begin with or have long torsos.I purchased these undershirts to wear under my polo shirts at work.  They fit well and I am still able to tuck them into my pants (even after shrinking in the wash), so I am very happy with this purchase and I recommend that you purchase these undershirts if you have similar needs.-In Short-Pros:InexpensiveComfortableAssorted colorsCons:Will shrink after a few washesNot the most durable*Please click "Yes" if you found this review helpful. It would be appreciated. Thank you.

I bought these for my fella, who's a  6' 2", muscular built man. He works outdoors, at a ranch, and like pockets on his t-shirts to carry a note pad for easy access. So these t-shirts fit all his needs at a reasonable price ($14.00 for a 5-pack in April 2019).I noticed other people reviewing said they shrunk. Well, duh. ALL t-shirts shrink if you put them in the dyer. For that matter, everything shrinks if dried long enough.  We don't do that. Just hang the freshly washed t-shirt on a plastic hanger, pull the wrinkles out while it's wet, and they won't shrink. Problem solved. They'll last longer, too. (Hint: You can do the same thing with jeans, etc. Towels line dried (or hung in the bathroom if you live in an apt or it's raining) are a little stiff when first dried but fluff out fine as soon as they hit your damp skin. To hang items like jeans and slacks, save & reuse the plastic snap hangers that come with new clothing.  Line drying saves money, prolongs the life of the material  and works almost as well as if you had actually IRONED your clothing if done right.)

These shirts fit perfectly! And they arrived pretty quickly, as well. The material is great! It's pretty thick, which is not what I expected it all. These are some great quality shirts! The only reason I'm not giving it a 5 out 5 is that the colors do not match the picture at all. Instead of a royal blue and a bright red like the picture depicts, I received a burgundy/maroon and navy, along with the dark gray and black shirts. Hope this review was helpful lol :)

So lately I have been tryna get into the fashion game and let me tell you, this is a step in the right direction. I went from looking like a average dude to an average dude who can kinda dress. Notice, that I am still an average dude. With that being said, these are fantastic shirts for a great price. I feel more comfortable shooting my shot with these shirts. That should clear some things.Note: I am like 5'4 so keep that in mind while reading this.

As a woman, i find that sometimes man’s T shirts are better than women’s. I received a white, grey, navy and black one. I bought a medium. I machine-washed and dried in medium heat, and didn’t see critical shrinking. The fit is great like boyfriend style. For ladies’ reference, i am 5’4” and 125 lbs.

Amazon sent me an email asking me to review these, probably because I keep buying them.I'm not very good at reviewing stuff, but, well...These are very good T-shirts.I mean, if you like T-shirts...Then these are very good T-shirts.(How come no one says my reviews are helpful? It's T-shirts, or boxer shorts...It's not like you're seeking advice on purchasing a pet badger or something. What do you want from me?)
I'm a small, but all smalls were sold out... I got a medium and it fits perfectly. So they're a little smaller than they seem.

Say you were at a high school football game. Say you were sitting on the top of the bleachers. Say some old lady kicked your purse and your phone was on top. Say your phone skated in slo-mo into the gap in between the seats and walkway. Say you watched it careen the 15 feet or so to the ground below, into the dirt, under the bleachers. Say you looked at her and you knew she knew and she didn’t even say sorry. Say you found a custodial guy eating a burger with a *LOT* of mustard. Say you complimented him on his hunk of keys and told him the tale. Say he unlocked a creepy gate under the bleachers and found your phone in THIS OTTERBOX and it was perfectly fine. This is what happened to me. Wish it were cuter? Say you put on a jungle PopSocket with pink flamingoes. I will NEVER get another case. Only me and the OTTERBOX.

I purchased this case for an iPhone 8 Plus. The first case Amazon sent lifts in the center causing a gap between the screen and the phone. I called OtterBox and filed a complaint. They said exchange the case with Amazon cause it's been less than 30 days. Amazon quickly sent me a second case. The second case had the exact same problem suggesting the new iPhone 8 Plus Defender Case may have quality control problems. Take a look at the photo I included with this review. The point where the plastic is connected to the case is lower on the bottom and the top then it is in the middle. The video shows the same anomaly - pressing on the screen causes the case to bend resulting in missed keypresses and harder contact. I am a huge fan of OtterBox Defender cases and my previous iPhone 6 case does NOT have this defect.UPDATED 9/26/17 - Per OtterBox's response to my review, I called Customer Service for a replacement case. A representative named Ariel took my call, looked up my incident number, and offered to help. I explained the issue with the case and OtterBox's response to my review. Ariel apologized for the defect and placed me on hold to speak with a Supervisor. Upon return, Ariel offered to complete a Warranty exchange for a new case to be sent out. I said that sounds good until Ariel asked me to pay $4.99 for Shipping and Handling. I said, let me get this straight, I ordered a new case through Amazon and it arrived defective. I replaced the case through Amazon and the second one is also defective. OtterBox invited me to call Customer Service for a replacement case and now I need to pay an additional $4.99 to have a working case sent to me by OtterBox. Clearly, OtterBox has given up on Quality Control AND on Customer Service.DO NOT BUY THIS CASE UNTIL OTTERBOX PROVIDES A SATISFACTORY RESPONSE!!!!UPDATED 10/5/17 - The replacement case finally arrived via FedEx SmartPost. The screen protector is perfectly attached to the side of the shell and there doesn't appear to be any gap between the screen and the phone. This suggests the first release of iPhone 8+ cases likely had a manufacturing defect which was corrected in stock sent to OtterBox. Check your case for screen protector alignment issues before the Amazon return policy expires and if you do need to go through OtterBox for a warranty exchange, expect to pay for shipping and handling.

If you want ultimate protection, this is the case for you. But if want a case to show how slim your new iPhone is, look elsewhere. To give you an idea on the thickness, on the back around the Apple logo and camera is about a quarter inch of protection. Again, great case, small hands beware.

I’ve used OtterBox in the past and sometimes felt it was beyond the protection I needed.  The cases have always been made sturdy, easy to put together, and built to last.  The OtterBox remains one of the leading brands for phone case protection and I feel the brand continues to improve the case design that aligns with phone innovations.Usually, I don’t gravitate towards colorful cases but the rosemarine/plum haze color is fun and not overbearing.  I also enjoy the color combination with my rose gold iPhone 7 Plus and feel that it compliments it.  The case comes in 3 pieces and is easy to put together.  The inner layer consists of two hard plastic pieces that snap around the case, one side includes the screen protector.  The outer shell is a rubbery flexible material that covers the area where the inner pieces connect and add extra protection.I’m very impressed with the screen protection with this Otterbox.  In my opinion, the screen protector feels better than using the solo film screen protectors.  Not better than glass, but I have the luck of breaking glass ones after a couple of days.  The screen protector also doesn’t have the annoying bubbles and doesn’t cling to a speck of dust.  The only parts of the phone that are consistently exposed are the speakers and the cameras.  The buttons are covered and are fully functional without difficulty.  The lightning port and the switch to set your iPhone 7 Plus to silent are covered with the rubber but you can open them.The only downfall I used to have with the Otterbox was the size.  Now that the iPhone 7 Plus is much slimmer I feel the case is a better fit.  I can’t use the Otterbox with my lightning dock but not many cases on my phone allow me to use it anyway.Overall, the Otterbox Defender for the iPhone 7 Plus is an excellent choice for people with an active lifestyle or professions that put your phone at risk for damage.  The Otterbox is one of those cases that if I were to drop my phone I wouldn’t gasp and cringe in fear because I know it’s thoroughly protected.

I had just bought a new iPhone 7 Plus and I wanted a good case for protective purposes. In the past there had always been occasions when somehow, no matter how careful I was, I managed to drop my cellular phones. In addition, not only did I drop it, but I somehow always managed to drop it onto either a concrete or asphalt surface. At least 2 cell phones I had broken that way, so I was looking for a case that featured "protection" as the primary functionality feature of the case I bought. This time, I decided I was not going to make the same mistake again. Thus, I did a search for highly protective iPhone 7 plus compatible cases.Amazon has a huge collection of cases, even ones that are protective. Some even use special military grade plastics. Yet I wanted one that would allow easy access to all the features of my cell phone. This one achieves those objectives, without creating any barriers to access of all my new phone's features. Thus, I chose this one which did everything on my list of requirements.The best results and comments I can make about this "Otterbox Defender Series Case" is the following:  1). Installation is trivial and simple  2). Access to every feature and button is easy  3)  AND, the case is very PROTECTIVE!!!How do I know? Because within 48 hours of my installation I was getting out of my car, when I dropped it on the cement parking lot. So, I said to myself, "Well, that is why I bought this one, so let's see if it is still working.And, Voila, every single function and button still worked. Nothing was damaged, and it greeted me immediately with perfect functionality! In addition, since that time I have dropped the phone 3 more times. Once on my hardwood floor, once on my asphalt parking lot driveway and once again on the concrete slab of my garage and every time it worked perfectly.Note please that all the drops were from an altitude of approximately waist high, therefore about 3 to 4 feet from impact. I decided that in every respect, this Otterbox Defender Series case was a perfect selection for meeting all my criteria. However, I would not attempt to find the limits of its protection. Thus, I do not recommend high altitude drops or throwing the phone and case to the concrete, but for normal use, including accidental drops this product fits the bill in every respect (I did not test for water) and thus I was totally satisfied and gave this product a well earned 5 Star rating. If good accidental drop protection is what you need, then I strongly recommend this product!

The case goes on and comes off easy, dropped more than once on pavement(butterfingers) phone protected. Only two things I dont like about it are the plastic screen protector that it comes with already attached, terrible, zero protection from anything but dust, Last couple of these for other phones I just took the plastic off and the glue that attaches it and got the glass screen protector that I know offers real protection from minor impacts. The second thing is not a big deal but I figured  I’d mention it, the case does increase the size of the already big phone slightly, the otterbox commuter case is thinner but I like the all rubber exterior of this one over the mostly hard plastic case of the commuter whch I also owned, the all rubber just makes the grip much more secure in your hand. Both cases offer superior protection in my opinion.

What the hell is the point of getting a NEW defender case when it comes completely smeared?! This will be the second one I’ve purchased the first one was fine this one looks like it fell out at the warehouse and dirty fingerprints are all over it.

UPDATE- Very disappointed in otter box quality of this case. I may have received a weak and defective product. The white plastic part of the case has snapped inside the soft cover. People use these cases on construction sites with no problems. I go to school, work, and home. There should be no reason why my case has broken after 2 months of me having it. The rest of the case is in perfect condidtion. Also another downside to this open part at the top of the phone is I have to open the case to clean lint and debris from the screen every couple of weeks. That whole also lets water through so if I forget to flip the phone over while I’m at the sink I have to clean water out of the case(which is how I found this break)Very pretty medium dark teal with white shell looks great on my black phone. Fit is sleek at a little under a dimes width for thickness. Durability fantastic obviously otter box is know for being one of the best for protection. The dad clip I’ll admit I use. It helps my small hands hold onto this huge phone kind of like a popsocket would. The clip is also the perfect size to fit in my car door cup holder so I can use my phone for gps. Case does not obstruct the sound quality. Dislikes- although the screen protector does protect my screen from scratches it doesn’t not stop debris from getting in the case. I did not want to have a built in screen protector. I wanted tempered glass but every case with this level of fall protection has a built in protector. I also don’t like the fact that it doesn’t have the apple logo centered in the circle in the back.I am afraid that this rubber part will start to warp and loosen. Will update with progress of that aspect.

I have been a otter box fan/ user since they came out, all my cells have had them. I just upgraded my phone and i got my case in the mail. I have never experienced almost having to slam my finger down on my screen to be able to text or unlock it. the screen cover has made it almost impossible to use my phone without slamming the screen. I am so disappointed right now with this case.

This is a great case, but you have to remove the built-in screen protector. The gap between the protector and your phone’s glass is insane — you have to press so much harder just to initiate a tap on your phone. AND it’s loud! It sounds like you’re tap dancing when you text someone.Solution: Remove the built-in protector. Grab a knife and start cutting it out, get rid of it, and apply one of those adhesive high-impact glass screen protectors before you put the case on. Much better.

I have had this protector as I feel it is was necessary to get it for my iPhone 8 plus. Being a recent convert from a Samsung Galaxy 5, I could no longer feel comfortable being responsibly gentle with an even larger and significantly heavier phone, so I looked for a case that wasn't too bulky, but also something that offered some protection. My first case was the Pursuit, but I felt it was too big, and the cover switch for the ringer did not work properly, so I returned it.After much research, and nearly buying a silicon case with fuzzy lining, I chose this. I went back to it because it was American made, which I felt meant it may have went through a strict quality control process, and I liked the feel of the pursuit case, despite the non-functioning ringer cover switch.I am happy with this purchase, and for the face of the phone that is not covered, I feel this product works well if you have a separate glass face protector. I am usually a bigger fan of single piece protectors, but not in the instance of a case where a touch screen is involved. I am also happy that this case was not as bulky as I expected, as I had planned to get a slimmer case for formal events. To me, this provides excellent protection without being bulky.This unit went on over my phone a little tight at first, as it was activating some of the side volume buttons as it was being fitted over my iPhone 8 Plus. But once on, it felt very snug. I like that the case feels nice with semi-grippy rubber around the side, but rigid and hard along the surfaces on the back at the same time. I guess I'm a tactile sort of person because besides liking the feel of this case in hand, I have no problems placing my phone down on hard concrete (which I would be nervous about doing with iPhones bare glass exterior) and enjoy that the phone feels protected in my front (yes, front) pocket as well, from shifting and or bending.An important feature to me is that the camera 'bump' is aligned in a fitted hole that gives it and the flash an ample opening and provides what feels to be a quarter's thickness to keep the bump from touching a surface if the case is placed camera-side down.The bottom cut-outs for the lightning cable and bottom speakers holes seem perfectly aligned for me, and the side buttons for the power and the volume controls are pleasantly stiff, which are find for me since I do not use them much and value the protection they provide for the little-used buttons. I also like that the ringer on/off switch is a simple cut-out rather than an attempted addition side button. I feel that this switch is, by design, something to correctly cover and have another working switch over it, as the Pursuit attempted to do.I highly recommend this case and I think it is an excellent value on Amazon at $28 at the time of purchase. I would be willing to bet it's nearly twice as much if you buy it at your local cell phone provider.Thank you for reading and I hope this review helps you.

This is the fake GARBAGE that AMAZON Fullfilment sent to me! It’s a FAKE KNOCK OFF of an Otterbox branded Symmetry Series case. Amazon’s is made in China. The REAL Symmetry case from Otterbox is much different looking and comes in very expensive packaging!!! Total disappointment from Amazon today!!!

The item I received is NOT a true Otterbox. The box that this cheap silicone/ rubber cover came in states “Stylish Coice, Fashion Case” with an Otterbox sticker stuck crookedly on front. The “case” does not have a hard back or a raised beveled edge. I know this is fake since I’ve had one for my previous iPhone and it was a wonderful product. Otterbox box was also imprinted in the case. This “cover” does not have Otterbox on it anywhere. Returning immediately.** Added pics. I purchased a real one from Best Buy on left. They price matched Amazon. You can see the flimsy fake in second pic and the true Otterbox in last two pics.

I've had this case for almost 10 months so I think I can speak definitively about this.Look I know I'm the kind of person who drops stuff. I'm also the kind of person who likes to go out which makes me a 2x kind of person who drops stuff. So when I'm getting a case, it's a short term relationship.Not this son of a gun. Let me tell you the ways I've dropped this - off of a desk, off a ladder, accidentally threw across the street, sneezed so hard it flew out of my hands and hit the wall, angrily made hand movement and it slipped out, demonstrating how good it is by throwing it on a couch, demonstrating how good it is by throwing it on the floor,  dropped in a pot of water (that probably has more to do with the phones water resistance but STILL), thrown as a joke, thrown as not a joke, adamant gesticulation, demonstrating how hard my brother's head was by hitting him with it (would not recommend), trying to impress girlfriend, dropped every day.Seriously, as someone who drops their phone both intentionally and unintentionally, I cannot recommend this case enough. Also it looks good, I love the color, it's light and is the slimmest case that will still protect your phone to a degree that you legitimately don't have to worry about it if you're a class A phone dropper.

Case seems to protect the phone well enough but it scratches very easily and the scratches make it very slippery and hard to hold. After only having the case for a short time it already looks terrible. Not a good design, next time I’ll be going with something other than OtterBox.

Terrible...I always trust otter box with my phones. This case however let me down. It is really pretty but pretty poor quality. The back got scratched from just placing it on a table, and not to mention the color transfer from any clothing item you wear. I’m disappointed I paid so much money for this disappointing case 👎🏻

Did not protect the back of my phone from breaking.  My phone was in my coat pocket and I was bent down getting something from the floor of my car when my phone slipped out of my pocket and fell to the driveway. I didn’t even cringe, it was such a small distance and didn’t sound like a hard fall. Very shocked to see the cracks across the back. Ive trusted in this brand for years and was very disappointed!

I give one star because I can’t give a 0... In the features says STAY- CLEAR / ANTI-YELLOWING, one of the main reasons I bought it. But after a week using it it’s horrible. Looks like it’s 2 colors! All the edge it’s yellow, looks dirty. DONT BUY IT !

I bought this for my daughter for Christmas and she loves it! It is very protective yet fashionable. She’s dropped her phone multiple times from pretty high with his case on and her phone stayed safe; the case did not take any damage either. It came in the nice packaging and also came with a warranty. (The white splotches seen on the case in the photos are just from the flash.) I hope this review helps! 😄

Ugh I had high hopes for this one, but I dropped my phone twice..and not from a skyscraper.. from less than 3 feet and both times my glass protector cracked.. thankfully I had the protector on it, but I have had the same screen protector on my phone since December ($40) and have dropped it many times without a scratch.. but since this case doesn’t actually cover the phone.. the phone touches the ground first instead of the case.. and that’s why it cracked it.. I went back to the other series and so far so good..Another thing ..the phone is hella slippery when your trying to use it.. no grip what so ever ..The only thing I liked was that I could use the Apple mirror in the back since it was see through

I’m 5’7 / 125lbs / 27inch waist. I got the XS size. The color shirts I got were Black,Dark Blue,White. I can understand why maybe other buyers didn’t like these shirts due to the material perhaps not being the best but listen this shirts are good! They get the job done, they look stylish! I guess my only wish was that this shirts were a little bit slimmer from the waist but hey maybe it’s probably me who needs to grow more lol anyways I would buy these again if I have to, I’ll wait untill my 3 shirts ware out and most likely purchase them again & try different colors. I hope my review helps you.

The shirts are absolutely great and have a great look but they aren't as stretchy as some other brands. However, the price for the three of them is definitely a steal! I'm in a stage in my life where I can juggle between a medium and a large because of my physique and my height but I definitely ordered a size too small. Medium size isn't a bad fit but I should've gone with the large option. If you know for a fact that you are a certain size then definitely choose that option but if you also struggle with being able to juggle between two different sizes, choose the larger option. As for quality of the material, they have been doing well so far and I don't expect any tears in these any time soon but if they do (keep in mind this could also be due to the fact that I ordered a size smaller), I will definitely update this review as I'm sure any one person would want to have workout shirts last.
I'm only 5'10" 169lbs this shirt fits really well. I like the way it sits on the shoulders and it allows my body to breath while working out.

The package came on time ..it fit me perfectly ..I am a guy with 5’6 and 152lb ...I ordered large as I like little loose ...overall I am very much impressed with this tank top ...let see how it will be after a wash..till now I am fully satisfied with price and quality.

These three tanks tops are a great deal for the price! I love the texture and feel of them. The medium size fit me well, these do run slightly big as I typically wear a large in T-Shirts and tank tops. For your reference, I am 5-10 ~170lbs.If I had one complaint, it would be that the cut at the front of the tank hangs pretty low, as in deep down your chest. This is more of a style thing, but I would have preferred it a little bit higher. Otherwise, great tanks so far. Can't lose at that price

I bought a medium and it shows my muscles perfectly.  I wear them mostly on back day to show off my lats. Not dry fit but still worth the purchase. The material is like a thin jersey but we'll made. I will buy more colors soon.

Best tanks ever.  Literally wear them everyday to, gym or for a run or even just out. Lightweight material (like a sports jersey material) with plenty of holes for air travel.  Initially purchased a three pack in L and wanted to see if they fit as expected and wanted to see the quality of the material.  Size fit as expected.  I'm 5'10 and 185 pounds.  I usually wear a large T-Shirts and sometimes a med 15 1/2 fitted dress shirt.  Tanks fit great without being too tight or too loose.  Loved them so much, I bought a second three pack in different colors.  I've washed them several times so far in cold water and haven't had any problems with shrinking, color fading, or fraying.  For this price, highly recommend.

I am 6'3 and about 155 lbs, so its always a struggle to find clothes that fit well. I bought the SMALLS because I wanted them to fit snugger on me than on the model in the pic, and I thought they looked long enough on the model in the pic to where a SMALL would still fit me.Turns out, I was correct. They fit me well. The back of the shirts are slightly longer than the front (just a note). I like that they fit me in a more form fitting (but not tight or anything) way.Keep in mind that these shirts are kind of mesh-like, although I don't think anything is too visible through them.The material is not made of cotton so they will not shrink in the washer, etc.I bought the triple black pack, would buy again.

The red, blue and yellow 2xl tanks showed up as expected.  Stitching looks good, color looks good, and laying them out they look consistent in size. 2xl size was measured at 30.5 inches length, 25.5 inches at the waist, and 25 inches just under the arm pits.  Me... I am 5’10” athletic stocky build ranging from 225 to 245.  Today... 245.  Chest measurement is 46 inch unflexed. I range between 46 and 48 suit coat... 48 right now.  At 225 my belly button measurement is around 37”.  Now... we’ll... not 37.  But still smaller than my chest so the shirt still works well.Took the yellow through a back wo test run.  The shirt fit well, no tugging, no restrictions and fit well.  The shirt wasn’t stretched with normal stance. The shirt is very light and works well.  Then took it through cardio wo that the mesh did its job not absorbing a bunch of sweat.I prefer cotton tanks over all the sheer nylon tanks out there due to the fit. These tanks are a great option for workouts without having a soaked cotton tank.Great price.  I would recommend giving them a try.

Great workout shirt.  I'm 6'2, 240 and I ordered a XXL.  Fits perfect.  It does have the feel of a jersey and appears to be stitched together very well and the length is just right.  Gives me total freedom of movement when working out.

I ordered a two-pack of these Slim Fit t-shirts and a two-pack of the Regular Fit t-shirts to compare and contrast. Both styles are made of the same thick cotton knit fabric, which is soft and substantial, but the fits are definitely different. These Slim Fit shirts are significantly tighter fitting in the stomach, arms, and chest area(s). The Regular Fit shirts are much looser in all three of these areas, especially the arms.Compared to a Regular Fit I would categorize these as a Slim Fit not, a Snug Fit; they fit close to the body but not tightly enough to show something like muscle definition, if that's what you're looking for.For comparison, I would say that these  Amazon Essentials Slim Fit t-shirts are tighter fitting than a standard Gap or Old Navy t-shirt fit but looser fitting than a standard American Apparel or H&M t-shirt fit.Overall the quality is nice, with minimal fading and only very minor shrinkage after laundering in cold water and putting in a medium dryer. Recommended if you like a close fitting, thick cotton t-shirt.
I bought both medium and large to check for best fit. Before washing, medium fit the best and large was a bit too big. After washing, the medium becomes too small and the large fits better.

As someone who's pushing 6'3" and 175lbs (most of that being around the mid-region), I was really debating between getting this shirt in large or the regular/loose fit in a medium. So I got both! And if I'm being honest, there wasn't very much of a difference. While this shirt in a medium (which I also bought) did feel tight, the large met with my broad shoulders perfectly and didn't get too slim as it went down along my chest and stomach (though the advertising photo makes it look like it totally just becomes a "V" towards the crotch). The regular-fit medium had a very similar fit, but was about a half inch shorter in vertical length and an inch shorter across the shoulders. Though it didn't slim as it went down like the slim-fit large, it's already shorter width made it feel like a tighter fit. Weird, right?? I tried on both shirts again and again, both before and after a single wash/dry, trying to point out all the differences before I came here to write about it here. All in all, I'm probably going to keep the slim-fit large as it actually has the shoulder length I like while not staying that length all the way down and giving off a total box-y fit. The slim-fit medium was just too small and the regular-fit medium was just a little too narrow, though I believe a regular-fit large would probably be too wide. One complaint of all the shirts that I'll have is that after a wash/dry, the hems at the bottom of the shirt did begin to curl up a bit, which is disappointing because it looks cheap (which I know it is, but other people don't). But other than that, I didn't detect any shrinkage and that's a huge plus given the price.

One of the shirts was just as expected; the other one had two different sleeve sizes. The left sleeve is wayyy smaller than the right (and the other shirts sleeves) to the point that it hugs my arm while the other hangs loose.

Not sure why these were called slim fit. This is definitely a regular fit shirt. This is one of the few times an Amazon product has disappointed me. It's a decent regular fit shirt, but just call it what it is.
The material of the shirts feel really good but they are way to small.I wear a 2XL, the shirts fit like an XL and after washing they turn into a Large, at this point I can not get the shirt on.

I am 5'10" 150lbs, with some muscle from strength training. I washed in cold water and dried on low heat before trying the shirt on for the first time and it fits perfect. Please keep these in stock in manly colors and white, thank you.

To loosely quote Mitch Hedberg, "The shirt feels like a really weak man is choking you".My biggest complaint is the neck.  It's so small and uncomfortably tight on your neck.  Really the whole shirt fits odd, but the neck is the real problem.  The actual shirt material is fine.  I tossed this shirt pretty early into me having it.Try again Amazon.  Find a better pattern.

You can't go wrong with these.  The fabric is soft and the sleeves and torso seem to have a little more intentional length added to them--both plusses in my book for a casual t-shirt.  I ordered a medium and, with about a 16.5'' neck, the rim of the collar comes right up to my neckline--fine for me but might perhaps be a potential warning for guys who are a little more husky or athletic.  I personally love them and will be buying again.

I think if XS had been available it would have fit perfectly but I knew it would be a little large for me so I’m not disappointed. It was precisely the shirt I needed for this cosplay! I’m very picky about getting colors right and this one came the exact color as seen. It’s also nice to get two in case one gets a stain while at convention! It’s a very comfortable shirt and doesn’t hug my chest. Tucking the front in my belt provided the exact look I was trying to duplicate. It’s a great product! And I’ll definitely wear these beyond cosplay!

I'm a woman and I bought these to wear as everyday white tees. All the reviews I saw were written by men, so I thought I'd offer my two cents.Despite what some reviewers have said, the shirts I received are definitely see-through – I tried one on without a bra and everything was very visible, even in low light. That said, they're NOT that heavy, stiff fabric so many men's shirts are made of, and they feel well-made. I machine-wash and hang-dry them, and they're holding up very well.I normally wear a 34C, a women's small or medium top and size 4 dress. I ordered size small and they fit ... not exactly tight, but not really drapey. If you're looking for a looser, more tuckable fit, you should probably match your chest measurement to the size chart and then go up one size.

These shirts fit great when I first got them.  I bought a 2 different kind of Hanes t shirts.  These shirts are made of thin 100% cotton and have a black printed label on the inside that says Comfort Soft.  After washing on warm and  drying on warm in the dryer they have shrunk at least 2 to 3 inches in lenght and no longer fit good because they are too short.  The other Hanes t shirts that I bought are made of a heavier 100% cotton and have a red printed label that says “ Hanes Our Most Comfortable”. I would rate those shirts with 5 stars

This was one of the first that popped up in my search white T-shirts and had a way better price than anything I could find in stores.  I went to Kohl's looking for something similar and they wanted to charge about 10$ per shirt!  I thought that was so ludicrous.  Anyway, these fit me perfectly.  I am average build, wider in the shoulders than I am in the waist - most of the time ;) - and after several wears, the color has remained very white.  I'm expecting them to hold up for a long time.

Holy mackerel are these cheap. And terrible. For me, the first consideration is how the collar wears: it’s the only part that anyone can see. After a single wash (and before I wore it once), the collar looks slightly worn, like a T-shirt that I’ve had for a year. The fabric is thin - not breathes well, cozy thin, but cheap and won’t last long thin. And the fabric isn’t that soft. It’s already a little rough. I could hope that after a few washings it would soften up, but honestly, I don’t think this shirt will last that long. Hanes clearly tries to squeeze as much profit out of this shirt - and to be fair it’s a super cheap shirt - but this is unacceptable.

I bought these to wear underneath my white button-up shirts, and they are great. The fabric is soft and light (but not too thin) and the collar is high enough that you can't see it through a lighter button-up shirt while wearing a tie. Not to mention, they are long enough that they're not going to come untucked easily -- which is one of the main things that I was looking for (I have short undershirts). I would definitely recommend these as very good undershrts.
Horrible product. I washed them before wearing and not only did they shrink and become misshapen, but one t shirt has holes already. Seems like a knockoff of the actual quality product.

I have bought these like three times.  The first two times they were great. Thin, snug and fit as a perfect undershirt.  The collar held up well, the ones from a year ago still do.  BUT!  The 3 pack I bought about a month ago....fit a lil tighter (which was fine), but after wearing the t-shirt like two times each (wear, wash, wear) the collar was all stretched out and saggy....on ALL THREE SHIRTS!  Why? I don't know.  Different cut, vendor....but buy at your own risk.  I already threw the three new ones away, yet still have the ones from a year ago.

I am still on a quest for cotton undershirts that feature a few things:1. Do not shrink (some minor shrinking is normal)2. The collar does not sag3. The material is not rough4. The shirt is not see-throughThese shirts are literally garbage.  I got them and put them in the wash.  They dropped by over a full size as they become rough as sand paper, and the collars, even before I tried to wear them the first time just collapsed.  Plus you can see right through them even before you wash them.

I had previously gotten Hanes "Our Most Comfortable" t-shirts for my husband. I thought these would be the same. NOT. The material, although still 100% cotton is almost scratchy. I washed these before wearing, and now I am on the lookout to find replacements. Apparently Hanes no longer makes the ones we have previously had. Very disappointed.

Arrived on time, and not damaged. Nice shirts, a bit thinner than the previous Hanes undershirts I've had in the past. They've held up well in the wash, no shrinking. Despite them being thinner, they are comfortable to wear, and I have worn them around the house like I did my previous undershirts. Too early to tell how long they will last, but if there are any longevity issues I'll report back here.

Say you were at a high school football game. Say you were sitting on the top of the bleachers. Say some old lady kicked your purse and your phone was on top. Say your phone skated in slo-mo into the gap in between the seats and walkway. Say you watched it careen the 15 feet or so to the ground below, into the dirt, under the bleachers. Say you looked at her and you knew she knew and she didn’t even say sorry. Say you found a custodial guy eating a burger with a *LOT* of mustard. Say you complimented him on his hunk of keys and told him the tale. Say he unlocked a creepy gate under the bleachers and found your phone in THIS OTTERBOX and it was perfectly fine. This is what happened to me. Wish it were cuter? Say you put on a jungle PopSocket with pink flamingoes. I will NEVER get another case. Only me and the OTTERBOX.

I purchased this case for an iPhone 8 Plus. The first case Amazon sent lifts in the center causing a gap between the screen and the phone. I called OtterBox and filed a complaint. They said exchange the case with Amazon cause it's been less than 30 days. Amazon quickly sent me a second case. The second case had the exact same problem suggesting the new iPhone 8 Plus Defender Case may have quality control problems. Take a look at the photo I included with this review. The point where the plastic is connected to the case is lower on the bottom and the top then it is in the middle. The video shows the same anomaly - pressing on the screen causes the case to bend resulting in missed keypresses and harder contact. I am a huge fan of OtterBox Defender cases and my previous iPhone 6 case does NOT have this defect.UPDATED 9/26/17 - Per OtterBox's response to my review, I called Customer Service for a replacement case. A representative named Ariel took my call, looked up my incident number, and offered to help. I explained the issue with the case and OtterBox's response to my review. Ariel apologized for the defect and placed me on hold to speak with a Supervisor. Upon return, Ariel offered to complete a Warranty exchange for a new case to be sent out. I said that sounds good until Ariel asked me to pay $4.99 for Shipping and Handling. I said, let me get this straight, I ordered a new case through Amazon and it arrived defective. I replaced the case through Amazon and the second one is also defective. OtterBox invited me to call Customer Service for a replacement case and now I need to pay an additional $4.99 to have a working case sent to me by OtterBox. Clearly, OtterBox has given up on Quality Control AND on Customer Service.DO NOT BUY THIS CASE UNTIL OTTERBOX PROVIDES A SATISFACTORY RESPONSE!!!!UPDATED 10/5/17 - The replacement case finally arrived via FedEx SmartPost. The screen protector is perfectly attached to the side of the shell and there doesn't appear to be any gap between the screen and the phone. This suggests the first release of iPhone 8+ cases likely had a manufacturing defect which was corrected in stock sent to OtterBox. Check your case for screen protector alignment issues before the Amazon return policy expires and if you do need to go through OtterBox for a warranty exchange, expect to pay for shipping and handling.

If you want ultimate protection, this is the case for you. But if want a case to show how slim your new iPhone is, look elsewhere. To give you an idea on the thickness, on the back around the Apple logo and camera is about a quarter inch of protection. Again, great case, small hands beware.

I’ve used OtterBox in the past and sometimes felt it was beyond the protection I needed.  The cases have always been made sturdy, easy to put together, and built to last.  The OtterBox remains one of the leading brands for phone case protection and I feel the brand continues to improve the case design that aligns with phone innovations.Usually, I don’t gravitate towards colorful cases but the rosemarine/plum haze color is fun and not overbearing.  I also enjoy the color combination with my rose gold iPhone 7 Plus and feel that it compliments it.  The case comes in 3 pieces and is easy to put together.  The inner layer consists of two hard plastic pieces that snap around the case, one side includes the screen protector.  The outer shell is a rubbery flexible material that covers the area where the inner pieces connect and add extra protection.I’m very impressed with the screen protection with this Otterbox.  In my opinion, the screen protector feels better than using the solo film screen protectors.  Not better than glass, but I have the luck of breaking glass ones after a couple of days.  The screen protector also doesn’t have the annoying bubbles and doesn’t cling to a speck of dust.  The only parts of the phone that are consistently exposed are the speakers and the cameras.  The buttons are covered and are fully functional without difficulty.  The lightning port and the switch to set your iPhone 7 Plus to silent are covered with the rubber but you can open them.The only downfall I used to have with the Otterbox was the size.  Now that the iPhone 7 Plus is much slimmer I feel the case is a better fit.  I can’t use the Otterbox with my lightning dock but not many cases on my phone allow me to use it anyway.Overall, the Otterbox Defender for the iPhone 7 Plus is an excellent choice for people with an active lifestyle or professions that put your phone at risk for damage.  The Otterbox is one of those cases that if I were to drop my phone I wouldn’t gasp and cringe in fear because I know it’s thoroughly protected.

I had just bought a new iPhone 7 Plus and I wanted a good case for protective purposes. In the past there had always been occasions when somehow, no matter how careful I was, I managed to drop my cellular phones. In addition, not only did I drop it, but I somehow always managed to drop it onto either a concrete or asphalt surface. At least 2 cell phones I had broken that way, so I was looking for a case that featured "protection" as the primary functionality feature of the case I bought. This time, I decided I was not going to make the same mistake again. Thus, I did a search for highly protective iPhone 7 plus compatible cases.Amazon has a huge collection of cases, even ones that are protective. Some even use special military grade plastics. Yet I wanted one that would allow easy access to all the features of my cell phone. This one achieves those objectives, without creating any barriers to access of all my new phone's features. Thus, I chose this one which did everything on my list of requirements.The best results and comments I can make about this "Otterbox Defender Series Case" is the following:  1). Installation is trivial and simple  2). Access to every feature and button is easy  3)  AND, the case is very PROTECTIVE!!!How do I know? Because within 48 hours of my installation I was getting out of my car, when I dropped it on the cement parking lot. So, I said to myself, "Well, that is why I bought this one, so let's see if it is still working.And, Voila, every single function and button still worked. Nothing was damaged, and it greeted me immediately with perfect functionality! In addition, since that time I have dropped the phone 3 more times. Once on my hardwood floor, once on my asphalt parking lot driveway and once again on the concrete slab of my garage and every time it worked perfectly.Note please that all the drops were from an altitude of approximately waist high, therefore about 3 to 4 feet from impact. I decided that in every respect, this Otterbox Defender Series case was a perfect selection for meeting all my criteria. However, I would not attempt to find the limits of its protection. Thus, I do not recommend high altitude drops or throwing the phone and case to the concrete, but for normal use, including accidental drops this product fits the bill in every respect (I did not test for water) and thus I was totally satisfied and gave this product a well earned 5 Star rating. If good accidental drop protection is what you need, then I strongly recommend this product!

The case goes on and comes off easy, dropped more than once on pavement(butterfingers) phone protected. Only two things I dont like about it are the plastic screen protector that it comes with already attached, terrible, zero protection from anything but dust, Last couple of these for other phones I just took the plastic off and the glue that attaches it and got the glass screen protector that I know offers real protection from minor impacts. The second thing is not a big deal but I figured  I’d mention it, the case does increase the size of the already big phone slightly, the otterbox commuter case is thinner but I like the all rubber exterior of this one over the mostly hard plastic case of the commuter whch I also owned, the all rubber just makes the grip much more secure in your hand. Both cases offer superior protection in my opinion.

What the hell is the point of getting a NEW defender case when it comes completely smeared?! This will be the second one I’ve purchased the first one was fine this one looks like it fell out at the warehouse and dirty fingerprints are all over it.

UPDATE- Very disappointed in otter box quality of this case. I may have received a weak and defective product. The white plastic part of the case has snapped inside the soft cover. People use these cases on construction sites with no problems. I go to school, work, and home. There should be no reason why my case has broken after 2 months of me having it. The rest of the case is in perfect condidtion. Also another downside to this open part at the top of the phone is I have to open the case to clean lint and debris from the screen every couple of weeks. That whole also lets water through so if I forget to flip the phone over while I’m at the sink I have to clean water out of the case(which is how I found this break)Very pretty medium dark teal with white shell looks great on my black phone. Fit is sleek at a little under a dimes width for thickness. Durability fantastic obviously otter box is know for being one of the best for protection. The dad clip I’ll admit I use. It helps my small hands hold onto this huge phone kind of like a popsocket would. The clip is also the perfect size to fit in my car door cup holder so I can use my phone for gps. Case does not obstruct the sound quality. Dislikes- although the screen protector does protect my screen from scratches it doesn’t not stop debris from getting in the case. I did not want to have a built in screen protector. I wanted tempered glass but every case with this level of fall protection has a built in protector. I also don’t like the fact that it doesn’t have the apple logo centered in the circle in the back.I am afraid that this rubber part will start to warp and loosen. Will update with progress of that aspect.

I have been a otter box fan/ user since they came out, all my cells have had them. I just upgraded my phone and i got my case in the mail. I have never experienced almost having to slam my finger down on my screen to be able to text or unlock it. the screen cover has made it almost impossible to use my phone without slamming the screen. I am so disappointed right now with this case.

This is a great case, but you have to remove the built-in screen protector. The gap between the protector and your phone’s glass is insane — you have to press so much harder just to initiate a tap on your phone. AND it’s loud! It sounds like you’re tap dancing when you text someone.Solution: Remove the built-in protector. Grab a knife and start cutting it out, get rid of it, and apply one of those adhesive high-impact glass screen protectors before you put the case on. Much better.

Highly recommend this product, purchased this for my wife 2 weeks ago along with the iPhone X. Also had a tempered glass screen protector on it...anyways, I dropped her off at the front door of the house today and after she closed the door she accidentally dropped the phone and it of course landed under the back tire of the car. Unknowingly I proceeded to drive to park and run over it! Thankfully it was perfectly fine! The screen protector however didn’t get so lucky. I’m extremely pleased with the performance of this case! Recommend to everyone! -Rebeca’s husband

Doesn't fit properly on my iPhone Xs. The rubber buckles around the buttons. It is real loose the volume and on and off button. This case does not fit properly, the edges are exposed and flimsy. I’d be worried if I drop it. This is not for iPhone Xs. I am hugely disappointed. Openings at the bottom for mike is bigger than required (looks like they sent the cover for iPhone Xs). Camera and apple logo on the back of the phone do not properly fit at the center of the openings.  This is a huge disappointment since its a costly cover then it should fit in the iPhone Xs.

This case is great! Sleek but feels protective. It has a "lip" that goes over the phone screen so if you drop it, the case hits the ground first and not the screen. I had no issues with it not fitting as previous reviewers mentioned, this one fits perfectly over the X with no bulges or button alignment issues.I've used the Commuter Otterbox for every previous iPhone I owned and they were always great, so I hope this one continues to work just as well!

I bought this case because I had the same one for my iPhone 6s and it worked with a new baby so well. My baby would throw it and drop it all the time and nothing ever happened. For years I didn’t have one crack.  I got the new iphone XS two weeks ago and just a few days into using this case the screen is cracked. You can tell that this case isn’t as good as the older version of the same model because it doesn’t come up as high around the sides of the screen so it can’t provide as much protection. I’m not sure why otter box changed their design for the commuter but I am returning this and paying to get my screen fixed :(((((

Pros• Slim but provides the perfect protection to your iPhone X.• Two layers case.• Hole in the back for the ones who like to show off the Apple logo.• Feels good in your hands with a great grip.• Even if your phone has a tempered glass, thanks to its raised beveled edge, it will keep the screen safe if the phone fell on a flat surface.• Provides great protection to your back camera thanks to the raised beveled edge.• The buttons are very responsive.• Protects your lighting port against dust and debris, thanks to a nice cap.• Wireless charger friendly, I am using a Choetech.Cons• Might slip on some hard surface.

Overview: This case has protected my iPhone X from numerous drops.Pros:  I'm not an overtly clumsy person.  But for some reason I feel like I need to drop my $1,000 phone onto the ground from waist to chest height.  Not a single scratch has appeared from the numerous drops.Cons:  The reason I keep dropping my phone is the hard outer shell is super slick.  Imagine dipping your hands into olive oil and then picking up your phone.  That is how slick this case is.  There is no texture to the outer shell.  You will accidentally drop your phone with this case...numerous times.  The good news is, it is awesome at protecting the phone from the inevitable drops.

I do not believe this is a legit Otterbox, or the quality of Otterbox has changed. With all my previous Otterbox cases the two part system has worked really well and both layers feel of quality. This case has a cheap rubber that is not flexible as they have been before and and doesn’t fit like a glove. The plastic is lacking the support to keep the rubber tightly against the phone especially on the top half of the phone.

I bought the symmetry case clear and it was scratched up in a week. This case has more protection and is just as slim! Weighs more yes, but it’s worth it. 1,000 dollar phone deserves this case. Don’t be cheap!  Plus you get the opening in the back for the Apple LogoWorks with WIRELESS CHARGING TOO

I got this for my new iPhone Xs as I loved the Commuter case on my previous iPhone 7.  Overall I did not feel like this case fit the phone well. Not sure if this is an issue with the Xs or just the overall design of the case.  The rubber portion felt loose and spongy, especially around the side button and camera while the outer plastic piece felt like it was too small and never felt completely secure over the rubber.  Things just didn't line up or look tidy.I just ordered and received the Otterbox Symmetry Case which feels perfect on my phone.  Seems like a much more secure fit and doesn't seem to sacrifice anything on protection.  Love Otterbox and their products, but the Commuter on the iPhone Xs is a "miss" for me

I was really excited to get this case but disappointed when I got it. I have always had a Defender case and this doesn’t feel as safe as I’m used to. There is only rubber on the inside and slightly on the edges so I doesn’t grip that well when holding or using on the side. Also there is no clear protector for the circle in the back which is what made me decide to return it. Great case for someone who is careful with their phone just not someone who wants to feel protected.

Say you were at a high school football game. Say you were sitting on the top of the bleachers. Say some old lady kicked your purse and your phone was on top. Say your phone skated in slo-mo into the gap in between the seats and walkway. Say you watched it careen the 15 feet or so to the ground below, into the dirt, under the bleachers. Say you looked at her and you knew she knew and she didn’t even say sorry. Say you found a custodial guy eating a burger with a *LOT* of mustard. Say you complimented him on his hunk of keys and told him the tale. Say he unlocked a creepy gate under the bleachers and found your phone in THIS OTTERBOX and it was perfectly fine. This is what happened to me. Wish it were cuter? Say you put on a jungle PopSocket with pink flamingoes. I will NEVER get another case. Only me and the OTTERBOX.

I purchased this case for an iPhone 8 Plus. The first case Amazon sent lifts in the center causing a gap between the screen and the phone. I called OtterBox and filed a complaint. They said exchange the case with Amazon cause it's been less than 30 days. Amazon quickly sent me a second case. The second case had the exact same problem suggesting the new iPhone 8 Plus Defender Case may have quality control problems. Take a look at the photo I included with this review. The point where the plastic is connected to the case is lower on the bottom and the top then it is in the middle. The video shows the same anomaly - pressing on the screen causes the case to bend resulting in missed keypresses and harder contact. I am a huge fan of OtterBox Defender cases and my previous iPhone 6 case does NOT have this defect.UPDATED 9/26/17 - Per OtterBox's response to my review, I called Customer Service for a replacement case. A representative named Ariel took my call, looked up my incident number, and offered to help. I explained the issue with the case and OtterBox's response to my review. Ariel apologized for the defect and placed me on hold to speak with a Supervisor. Upon return, Ariel offered to complete a Warranty exchange for a new case to be sent out. I said that sounds good until Ariel asked me to pay $4.99 for Shipping and Handling. I said, let me get this straight, I ordered a new case through Amazon and it arrived defective. I replaced the case through Amazon and the second one is also defective. OtterBox invited me to call Customer Service for a replacement case and now I need to pay an additional $4.99 to have a working case sent to me by OtterBox. Clearly, OtterBox has given up on Quality Control AND on Customer Service.DO NOT BUY THIS CASE UNTIL OTTERBOX PROVIDES A SATISFACTORY RESPONSE!!!!UPDATED 10/5/17 - The replacement case finally arrived via FedEx SmartPost. The screen protector is perfectly attached to the side of the shell and there doesn't appear to be any gap between the screen and the phone. This suggests the first release of iPhone 8+ cases likely had a manufacturing defect which was corrected in stock sent to OtterBox. Check your case for screen protector alignment issues before the Amazon return policy expires and if you do need to go through OtterBox for a warranty exchange, expect to pay for shipping and handling.

If you want ultimate protection, this is the case for you. But if want a case to show how slim your new iPhone is, look elsewhere. To give you an idea on the thickness, on the back around the Apple logo and camera is about a quarter inch of protection. Again, great case, small hands beware.

I’ve used OtterBox in the past and sometimes felt it was beyond the protection I needed.  The cases have always been made sturdy, easy to put together, and built to last.  The OtterBox remains one of the leading brands for phone case protection and I feel the brand continues to improve the case design that aligns with phone innovations.Usually, I don’t gravitate towards colorful cases but the rosemarine/plum haze color is fun and not overbearing.  I also enjoy the color combination with my rose gold iPhone 7 Plus and feel that it compliments it.  The case comes in 3 pieces and is easy to put together.  The inner layer consists of two hard plastic pieces that snap around the case, one side includes the screen protector.  The outer shell is a rubbery flexible material that covers the area where the inner pieces connect and add extra protection.I’m very impressed with the screen protection with this Otterbox.  In my opinion, the screen protector feels better than using the solo film screen protectors.  Not better than glass, but I have the luck of breaking glass ones after a couple of days.  The screen protector also doesn’t have the annoying bubbles and doesn’t cling to a speck of dust.  The only parts of the phone that are consistently exposed are the speakers and the cameras.  The buttons are covered and are fully functional without difficulty.  The lightning port and the switch to set your iPhone 7 Plus to silent are covered with the rubber but you can open them.The only downfall I used to have with the Otterbox was the size.  Now that the iPhone 7 Plus is much slimmer I feel the case is a better fit.  I can’t use the Otterbox with my lightning dock but not many cases on my phone allow me to use it anyway.Overall, the Otterbox Defender for the iPhone 7 Plus is an excellent choice for people with an active lifestyle or professions that put your phone at risk for damage.  The Otterbox is one of those cases that if I were to drop my phone I wouldn’t gasp and cringe in fear because I know it’s thoroughly protected.

When this shirt arrived, I put it on and the fit was good. However, there are certain parts about it that make it seem cheaply made to me.For one, they didn't include spare buttons like every other collared shirt I own, so if one rips off I'm just SOL.Most notably, when you get a shirt that doesn't have a button-down collar, typically that means the shirt has slots under the collar for plastic or metal collar stays, so that the collar doesn't flop around and look shitty. Well, this shirt doesn't have those.I will probably get a tiny bit of thread and sew the collar down, which is no big deal at all, it's just annoying for a brand-new shirt. Why would you even skip this part in the factory?

My experience with Goodthreads products are that they are basically Target brand clothing. They are made well; they don't feel like junk, but they don't feel fancy either. However, my biggest criticism is the sizing.I'm 5'5", athletic build, and the shirt fits VERY LOOSE. Like wow. Goodthreads manufacturer probably targets a general husky audience for their clothing line which is fine but don't call this a "slim-fit". It's not slim-fit, not at all.

5'8" 150lbsThe medium is WAY too big. The material is comfortable though and the arms are actually perfect compared to the small which is way too tight in the arms.The small is a very good fit. But a good 1-2 inches too long to actually wear untucked for a shorter person. It would probably be perfect for anyone over 5'10".These pictures are of the medium size. The small is about 1-2 inches shorter. Which is still too long to wear untucked.

Nice shirt. It's lightweight, but doesn't feel cheap in my opinion. I purchased a medium and I'm 6'0" and roughly 150lbs. I'm thin (I play soccer and have that sort of tall and thin build if you can picture that) and the shirt fit great in the chest, arms, and torso. However, before washing it was a little too long. Fortunately, after washing it probably shrunk about an inch to an inch and a half in length (this was intentional on my part) which put the shirt right where I wanted it to be. People who are built like me are certainly used to having shirts fit oddly on them in one way or another, whether that be too wide, too short, or too tight. I'm somewhat of an "inbetweener" when it comes to sizes. Mediums can be too large sometimes, and smalls too tight or too short. Luckily this shirt fit well enough that I'll be adding this brand and cut in to my usual shopping when I search out new clothes. Overall, happy with the purchase and will be buying more patterns and colors. I'll also try and test out some of the other shirt types offered by this same brand.

Quick about me: 6', 180#, slightly muscular build. J.Crew Slim fit is still fits me like a tent so I end up spending more money to get a bunch of fabric taken in...... not with this shirt. I went with a Medium. Slim fit is exactly that. Slim. Sleeve length is superb (35/36"). Collar is comfortable when buttoned up all the way (16.5" neck). Does not billow out when tucked in.My only con is that the shirt is not terribly long so it might not be suitable tucking in for some.
Nice shirt and great fit. I got this one and the green and blue one. I like the latter better but they're both nice and a perfect fit. I'm 6' 1 around 205 lbs and I went with the L

I was pleasantly surprised at the fit and quality of this shirt.  It is slim fit without being tight, and the medium fits me perfectly (I'm 6'0 and 165 lbs).  The fabric is high quality.  Easily as nice as a Banana Republic or J Crew shirt, and a lot cheaper!

After 2-3 washes, the shirt developed large holes at the end one sleeve and near the front buttons.  Routinely wash lots of other shirts that have no issues.  Definitely poor quality.  Liked the style but I have other cheap shirts that have held up to years of washing with minimal wear.

Shirt looks just as promised. If you're not overweight, definitely get the slim fit cut, it will look much better on you. My only minor complain is that at 5'8", it was just a bit on the long side and I like to wear my shirts untucked with jeans. As someone with a solid build, the medium was too tight and the large was a decent fit. I just wish the shirt with a bit shorter. If you're a few inches taller than I am then I guess this won't be an issue.
Love this company, I'm 6'2 weigh 210 lbs and tbis thing fits just right. I have a out 5 if there shirts and they all fit just right I get slim fit xl.

In addition, not only did I drop it, but I somehow always managed to drop it onto either a concrete or asphalt surface. At least 2 cell phones I had broken that way, so I was looking for a case that featured "protection" as the primary functionality feature of the case I bought. This time, I decided I was not going to make the same mistake again. Thus, I did a search for highly protective iPhone 7 plus compatible cases.Amazon has a huge collection of cases, even ones that are protective. Some even use special military grade plastics. Yet I wanted one that would allow easy access to all the features of my cell phone. This one achieves those objectives, without creating any barriers to access of all my new phone's features. Thus, I chose this one which did everything on my list of requirements.The best results and comments I can make about this "Otterbox Defender Series Case" is the following:  1). Installation is trivial and simple  2). Access to every feature and button is easy  3)  AND, the case is very PROTECTIVE!!!How do I know? Because within 48 hours of my installation I was getting out of my car, when I dropped it on the cement parking lot. So, I said to myself, "Well, that is why I bought this one, so let's see if it is still working.And, Voila, every single function and button still worked. Nothing was damaged, and it greeted me immediately with perfect functionality! In addition, since that time I have dropped the phone 3 more times. Once on my hardwood floor, once on my asphalt parking lot driveway and once again on the concrete slab of my garage and every time it worked perfectly.Note please that all the drops were from an altitude of approximately waist high, therefore about 3 to 4 feet from impact. I decided that in every respect, this Otterbox Defender Series case was a perfect selection for meeting all my criteria. However, I would not attempt to find the limits of its protection. Thus, I do not recommend high altitude drops or throwing the phone and case to the concrete, but for normal use, including accidental drops this product fits the bill in every respect (I did not test for water) and thus I was totally satisfied and gave this product a well earned 5 Star rating. If good accidental drop protection is what you need, then I strongly recommend this product!

The case goes on and comes off easy, dropped more than once on pavement(butterfingers) phone protected. Only two things I dont like about it are the plastic screen protector that it comes with already attached, terrible, zero protection from anything but dust, Last couple of these for other phones I just took the plastic off and the glue that attaches it and got the glass screen protector that I know offers real protection from minor impacts. The second thing is not a big deal but I figured  I’d mention it, the case does increase the size of the already big phone slightly, the otterbox commuter case is thinner but I like the all rubber exterior of this one over the mostly hard plastic case of the commuter whch I also owned, the all rubber just makes the grip much more secure in your hand. Both cases offer superior protection in my opinion.

What the hell is the point of getting a NEW defender case when it comes completely smeared?! This will be the second one I’ve purchased the first one was fine this one looks like it fell out at the warehouse and dirty fingerprints are all over it.

UPDATE- Very disappointed in otter box quality of this case. I may have received a weak and defective product. The white plastic part of the case has snapped inside the soft cover. People use these cases on construction sites with no problems. I go to school, work, and home. There should be no reason why my case has broken after 2 months of me having it. The rest of the case is in perfect condidtion. Also another downside to this open part at the top of the phone is I have to open the case to clean lint and debris from the screen every couple of weeks. That whole also lets water through so if I forget to flip the phone over while I’m at the sink I have to clean water out of the case(which is how I found this break)Very pretty medium dark teal with white shell looks great on my black phone. Fit is sleek at a little under a dimes width for thickness. Durability fantastic obviously otter box is know for being one of the best for protection. The dad clip I’ll admit I use. It helps my small hands hold onto this huge phone kind of like a popsocket would. The clip is also the perfect size to fit in my car door cup holder so I can use my phone for gps. Case does not obstruct the sound quality. Dislikes- although the screen protector does protect my screen from scratches it doesn’t not stop debris from getting in the case. I did not want to have a built in screen protector. I wanted tempered glass but every case with this level of fall protection has a built in protector. I also don’t like the fact that it doesn’t have the apple logo centered in the circle in the back.I am afraid that this rubber part will start to warp and loosen. Will update with progress of that aspect.

I have been a otter box fan/ user since they came out, all my cells have had them. I just upgraded my phone and i got my case in the mail. I have never experienced almost having to slam my finger down on my screen to be able to text or unlock it. the screen cover has made it almost impossible to use my phone without slamming the screen. I am so disappointed right now with this case.

This is a great case, but you have to remove the built-in screen protector. The gap between the protector and your phone’s glass is insane — you have to press so much harder just to initiate a tap on your phone. AND it’s loud! It sounds like you’re tap dancing when you text someone.Solution: Remove the built-in protector. Grab a knife and start cutting it out, get rid of it, and apply one of those adhesive high-impact glass screen protectors before you put the case on. Much better.

I'm not sure what the reviewers who are complaining that these shirts are "too heavy" were expecting. It says "heavyweight" quite clearly. Anyway, I think these are great. I bought these mainly because of the advertised no-stretch collar, and I am very happy with them. If anything, the collar is actually slightly tight! The weight is great -- they are heavy, but I prefer that to a thin, flimsy undershirt.. These definitely have more heft to them than the standard ten-in-a-pack garbage you get at WalMart. Going to order some more of these from them soon.Update, one week after buying: after washing in cold water, with low-heat tumble drying, the cotton tightened up just enough that they fit well now. Shirt was not a real pro club shirt. It was way too thin and came with no tag. Plus only one shirt came when the description says it's a 3 pack.

I have been looking for heavy weight t shirts for my husband.  When I received these, I was very happy with the weight. I have had this protector as I feel it is was necessary to get it for my iPhone 8 plus. Being a recent convert from a Samsung Galaxy 5, I could no longer feel comfortable being responsibly gentle with an even larger and significantly heavier phone, so I looked for a case that wasn't too bulky, but also something that offered some protection. My first case was the Pursuit, but I felt it was too big, and the cover switch for the ringer did not work properly, so I returned it.After much research, and nearly buying a silicon case with fuzzy lining, I chose this. I went back to it because it was American made, which I felt meant it may have went through a strict quality control process, and I liked the feel of the pursuit case, despite the non-functioning ringer cover switch.I am happy with this purchase, and for the face of the phone that is not covered, I feel this product works well if you have a separate glass face protector. I am usually a bigger fan of single piece protectors, but not in the instance of a case where a touch screen is involved. I am also happy that this case was not as bulky as I expected, as I had planned to get a slimmer case for formal events. To me, this provides excellent protection without being bulky.This unit went on over my phone a little tight at first, as it was activating some of the side volume buttons as it was being fitted over my iPhone 8 Plus. But once on, it felt very snug. I like that the case feels nice with semi-grippy rubber around the side, but rigid and hard along the surfaces on the back at the same time. I guess I'm a tactile sort of person because besides liking the feel of this case in hand, I have no problems placing my phone down on hard concrete (which I would be nervous about doing with iPhones bare glass exterior) and enjoy that the phone feels protected in my front (yes, front) pocket as well, from shifting and or bending.An important feature to me is that the camera 'bump' is aligned in a fitted hole that gives it and the flash an ample opening and provides what feels to be a quarter's thickness to keep the bump from touching a surface if the case is placed camera-side down.The bottom cut-outs for the lightning cable and bottom speakers holes seem perfectly aligned for me, and the side buttons for the power and the volume controls are pleasantly stiff, which are find for me since I do not use them much and value the protection they provide for the little-used buttons. I also like that the ringer on/off switch is a simple cut-out rather than an attempted addition side button. I feel that this switch is, by design, something to correctly cover and have another working switch over it, as the Pursuit attempted to do.I highly recommend this case and I think it is an excellent value on Amazon at $28 at the time of purchase. I would be willing to bet it's nearly twice as much if you buy it at your local cell phone provider.Thank you for reading and I hope this review helps you.

This is the fake GARBAGE that AMAZON Fullfilment sent to me! It’s a FAKE KNOCK OFF of an Otterbox branded Symmetry Series case. Amazon’s is made in China. The REAL Symmetry case from Otterbox is much different looking and comes in very expensive packaging!!! Total disappointment from Amazon today!!!
